Reviews.Title: “Service, service, service”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlNashville
Reviews.Content: This hotel makes you realize why you pay what you do for this level of accomodation. It was one of the nicest rooms, nicest staffed, and comfortable atmosphere's I think I have stayed in. My husband and I typically go to New Orleans about twice a year, and we had narrowed our perferred hotels to two choices. After staying here, I'm not sure I'll ever be able to stay at any of the other's again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JL4350
Reviews.Content: Had another nice stay at the Ritz. The location is hard to beat. Everyone treated us well. No complaints about the hotel or the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotraveldjd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location. It was only a block away to get to Bourbon Street but the noise level never hit the hotel. The hotel is tended to as you would expect a Ritz hotel to be. The conversion from a department store to a hotel would never be guessed at; although the elevator switching stands out as the hotel not being the original occupant of the space. The elevator's were not a big deal to us as we are used to different elevator banks for specific floors for work, etc. But, if you are staying with family or friends and they are in a different area I could see how that could be frustrating. We stayed in the Club level and it was worth every penny. I highly recommend it to anyone who would enjoy light-fare being available any time (in-between hours they offer light snacks, etc.) and would like to start or end their touring with a drink (or more; they do not limit you) in the Club lounge. Drinks consisted of offerings of three selections of red and three selections of white, Champagne, a number of beer selections, mixed drinks made to order, and all the expected dessert wines. The food selection varied day by day, but there was always enough for my husband and I to find that we never needed a formal breakfast, etc. The Club lounge is beautiful and offers seating for everyone's style from quiet tables to large overstuffed chairs. The staff there was incredible and very attentive. Foster was extremely helpful with dinner reservations and suggestions. He also makes a signature drink that we highly recommend you ask him about if he is on the floor during your visit. Somewhere along the course of our stay he asked about why we were visiting NOLA and we mentioned it was our anniversary. That night he had sent Chocolate Covered Strawberries to our room with his compliments which was a lovey touch. Overall, the hotel was a wonderful haven from the hustle and bustle of the city during our stay. We hope to be traveling back to NOLA just for an opportunity to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: getawaycharters
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Ritz in New Orleans. It is very nice and the service is really good. The comfortable bed was the best. Food was okay. I had a massage at the spa and there was no communication with the massage therapist. She spoke maybe 3 words. Very disappointing. I would rate the massage a 5 since I paid for a deep tissue and did not receive it. Overall not a bad stay but not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “A slice above the rest”
Reviews.Author: RobfromPA
Reviews.Content: Many of the hotels in NOLA are "ok." This gets you one cut above them all. Staff is quite helpful. I think it was an old department store so there are something like 60 floor plans so every room is a bit different. Did not eat in the hotel so can't comment on that but it looked good. Lobby is on the 3rd floor so it keeps some of the late night bourbon street crowd from wandering through. Location is convenient to the french quarter for shopping and everything else. An easy walk to the superdome if you are in town for a sporting event there as I was there for the final four.

Reviews.Title: “A must place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: red0099
Reviews.Content: This is a first class place to stay. We are offered an upgrade to a club level room when checking in, well worth a few more bucks. The most impressive part of this great property is the staff. Everyone I walked by smiled and had a pleasent greeting. The hotel is immaculate and the rooms were very comfortable. The club was very nice and served a very nice breakfast, mid-day and evening snacks with complimentary beverages. The saving from not using the mini bar is worth the cost of upgrade. The location is very close to the action, but far enough away to be able to have a quiet evening. There is a beautiful spa at this location, I did not visit it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kikadeeka
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Club Room. Room large and comfortable. Club lounge very good with a great selection of food, wines and spirits throughout the day. Finding your way around the hotel is a bit tricky as the building is a converted department store. Location of the hotel is perfect for exploring the French quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: scoutsandiego
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in early April while on a tour of the Gulf Coast. When checking in, was advised of the benefits included in upgrading to the Club Level - Maison Orleans - by a lovely staff member. Highly recommend doing so. We were fortunate to have the services of their excellent Concierge staff dedicated to the Club Level - particularly a young gentleman named Foster who was very attentive and extremely helpful in his recommendations. Our room was gorgeous and everything about our stay was perfect. Found Bourbon St. and the French Quarter to be slightly smelly and seedy, which made returning to our hotel all the more inviting. What the French Quarter lacked, the lovely Garden District more than made up for including some terrific restaurants. Our stay at the Ritz Carlton was hands down the highlight of our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kareb5227
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton 4/6 through 4/8. My family and I thought it was a great hotel and really liked the location. The Davenport lounge was a nice place to have a drink and listen to great music at the end of the day. There were 4 in our party and I requested 2 beds. When we checked in they only had a king bed available. They gave us a roll away bed and guaranteed us another room the next day. For two days we decided to stay in the room and not move. I'm not writing this as a negative but just to let people know to confirm reservations over the phone if you need a special request

Reviews.Title: “Old world - the good and the not so”
Reviews.Author: plum9195
Reviews.Content: First off - if you like the smell of scented candles then this is the place for you! If, like me, you prefer to smell clean air - stay out of the lobby and elevator areas. Really - the smell was over the top and distracted from the stay. If I was there on a personal trip I would have walked out and never checked in once the smell hit me. I was there for a conference and did not have that choice. Expect the room to be small as it is an older hotel - and that is fine. Courtyard was lovely this time of year (4/10-4/13). Hotel has an old world feel which I love. Service staff were profesional, quickly replaced the light bulb that was out in my bathroom once reported. But I have to ask - shouldn't your 5th floor cleaning staff have noticed this and reported it? I did not report it because I was in a hurry and thought they would - finally after 2 days I reported it and it was fixed before I returned to the room. Sheets were stained. Not dirty, you could tell they were washed, crisp and clean. But had stains. Really? At the Ritz? The food served was delicious - I do not prefer Red Fish and theirs was some of the best fish I have ever had - would order again. Also, the oyster and mushroom breadpudding - WOW! Howard at the bell desk was so helpful and gracious. Made you feel very special and pampered. I do not remember her name, but the lady working the front desk at 1:30 AM on Thursday 4/12 was also very accomidating to our group and helped with several requests. But I do have to echo another reviewer - paying extra for WiFi when you are paying this much for a room is insulting. It is the little things you remember - and I will remember that. Also, bed was a little firm for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “Club level is quite nice”
Reviews.Author: Xenos1
Reviews.Content: If you've been to NOLA lately, you know it's still recovering. It's not the tourist destination it used to be; it's more a place that you have to go for some other reason. The streets are a little seedier, the denizens a little more desperate. It's in this context that I write this post. The Ritz is an oasis right in the middle of this mess. Inside, the property is beautiful, if a little maze-like. I stayed in the club level called Maison Orleans. I'd recommed it to anyone who finds they must stay in NOLA. It includes separate access, a concierge, a private lounge, and a small number of well-appointed rooms. I only stayed and dined there one night, so this next remark is only based on a single encounter. For dinner, I ate at the lounge. It was nearly deserted and was tended for by the bartender who was much more interested in talking at an ear-splitting volume with his underachieving friend visiting at the end of the bar. The food was good, but the service and deserted nature of the lounge made for an off combination. I give it 4 stars due to the Maison Orleans accomodations. Just realize you're in NOLA. It will only get so good, and never perfect, at least not till the town has fully recovered.

Reviews.Title: “Not exceptional at all”
Reviews.Author: L K
Reviews.Content: We stayed the the New Orleans Ritz-Carlton 4/6-4/11. This is the worst experience we have had with this chain to date. We have stayed in this hotel worldwide and it has always been a seamless and cohesive experience. When we checked in at 4:00 PM the room was not ready. The person at the reception told us to go to the atrium and he would call our cell as it would only be a few minutes. Thirty minutes later I had to call to find out the room had been ready for a while. He just never called. Mary Jane Squires apologized profusely and understood that we were frustrated as we had a long flight with a 2 year old. We arrived in the room to discover that there was no pack-n-play. Mary Jane fixed that. We thought the room was okay, but little things were off like the black paint chipping off the soap dish onto the soap. Or the dust all over the bed and the backing coming off the stool. Another issue was the lift was not working (for handicapped people, not the elevator) and my husband had to carry the stroller with child in it several times up the stairs. Eventually we changed rooms because the outlets did not work and therefore nothing electronic could be charged. We would like to compliment Kimmy in the Club. She was exceptionally kind, smart and courteous. She is what the hotel chain is about. Foster, Andrea and Russel were outstanding as well. Mary Jane Squires tried to make the stay better and we appreciate her efforts as did Valeria in housekeeping. We are very dissatisfied with our experience. We will not be recommending this Ritz- Carlton to our friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting Planners Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityChicago
Reviews.Content: I've learned that the word for the day, the word for all days at The Ritz NOLA is a very polite no. Can upgrade to and executive room? No...Despite this executive spending hundreds of thousands o f dollars at this venue the answer is always, no . It plays like a broken record department to department, anything you need, 99.9% of the time the answer will be no. I fully understand contracts can't be broken, but an upgraded room for the President and CEO, the same one that's footing the bill for the hundreds of thousands of dollars...the same answer goes to him as wellâ€¦..no, we apologize we can't help you. Meeting attendance was low and I was actually called by the Regional Manager and accused of not being proactive enough in generating meeting. She proceed to instruct me in how I should do my job, because attendance in the past was wonderful, so why not this time. She gave me unwanted pointers that were counterproductive and not the least bit helpful, actually they were less than helpful Funny Story, we spent literally hundreds of thousands of dollars at recent event at the South Beach venue. I asked my Boss, the CEO be given a nice room with amenities. I was told a bottle of wine would be charged to his room. This after we literally spent thousands of dollars at a receptions, And he was given a room facing the wall. Several moves later someone actually got it and moved him to a nicer room. Custom service here for large meeting is poor as best, flexibility in contracts even in small request is nonexistent, Save your stress and your money and check out one of the boutique hotels that value customer service and loyalty. One more story, there were many. We had a member collapse at one of the meeting. I called our meeting planner to summons an ambulance, he texted me back that he did not do that I would have to go to concierge to get help....a man is dying. I ran to the concierge, summoned the security team with the Defibrillator. All was good due to the quick response of the concierge and the security team As soon I get out of The Ritz and start focusing more on local boutique hotels with better service and value for your money I will be a happy planner. Itâ€™s nice to know there are some hotels that are so confident in this down economy that they can treat there loyal client with at best indifference.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elisabeth24
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at several Ritz Carltons around the country, but this one stands out. I've been to New Orleans countless times, and this hotel is always my favorite. It's around the corner from Bourbon Street and also right across the street from the Streetcar which in my opinion is a perfect location. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated, and the bed is extremely comfortable. The gym made me actually want to work out which doesn't always happen on vacation! I'd def recommend this hotel for anyone who wants a little bit of luxury while exploring New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location. Quiet hotel compared to others nearby.”
Reviews.Author: PLaurino
Reviews.Content: We particularly liked returning late at night on Friday and Saturday nights to Jeremy Davenport and his band playing to a full house in the Lounge. And, the outdoor courtyard in the interior atrium is a nice place for an early evening drink before heading out to the clubs. (The only negative, according to my wife, was how quickly the spa booked up. Even midday on weekdays was completely booked several weeks in advance.)

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed...”
Reviews.Author: BaseballandTiaras
Reviews.Content: The location, staff, and facilities were up to par. We did stick with the club level, which was lovely for snacks, and the occasional cocktail. Staff was willing to go above and beyond. The hotel really was an ideal location with an easy stroll to the Canal St shops, Harrah's, etc, and then an equally stroll-able distance in another direction to Jackson Square. The craziness of Bourbon St is incredibly close for being such a quiet hotel. Literally a cross street away. Our new standby for NOLA visits.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as other Ritzs, but still an excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lucaconfavb
Reviews.Content: I would totally rate this 5-stars, if only wireless signal got to our rooms (1044, 1046). They were right on the corner, and the signal wouldn't reach them - not the best thing if you use an iPad! Anyways, the rooms were as always nice, well-decored, and very very clean! The service was good, but the employees weren't always as kind and professional as the ones in other Ritzs. Location is great, and has a very good experience overall!

Reviews.Title: “Easter Weekend at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: jahjay62
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed an excellent weekend at the Ritz with my family. This is a wonderful hotel with many nice features. The service was wonderful. Everyone that I interacted with from the doormen, valet parking, housekeeping and wait staff were all incredibly nice and more than accommodating. The rooms were clean and well appointed with modern but classic decor. The beds were very comfortable as well. It has a great Spa and Gym. The location is great as well. It is within a few blocks of Bourbon Street and lots of French Quarter attractions. For some relaxation, spend some time in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves Us...Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: Candice P
Reviews.Content: This is the first time weâ€™ve stayed at a Ritz and it might be our lastâ€¦definitely not what we were expecting. We were in town for five days visiting relatives and decided to splurge and stay at the Ritz-Carlton. We tried to book a room on the Club Level but were told they were sold outâ€¦desk clerk offered to call us when they had an opening but never bothered to follow up. Our room faced Canal Street and although it had a great view it was quite noisy. The beds were horribleâ€¦felt like you were sleeping on a box spring instead of a mattress (and that was after they had been changed out for new ones). We also had to call down to the front desk to ask for washcloths on two different occasions as they were missing from the room. Upon checking out one of the desk clerk even suggested we bring our own washcloths on our next visitâ€¦LOL! The service was pretty good overall and most of the employees were very helpful and friendly with one exception. We had breakfast 3 of the 5 days of our stay at the M Bistroâ€¦while the food was good the service was disappointing. Our server had a bit of an attitude and felt it was all right to chew out the other employees in front of the customers (this happened on two separate occasions). His behavior was bazaar to say the least. I also wanted to add that the doormen were very helpful with both directions and dinning suggestions (one of which was Oceana for breakfast). And I love the fact that the hotel hires employees in all age groupsâ€¦the older gentleman with the glasses is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location with Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: Oinkeater
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton New Orleans at the end of March 2012 for business. The meeting facilities on the first level are on par with all other high end hotels, however the proximity to Bourbon street was ideal for exploring the area when I had free time. The gym also had a nice layout where the weight room was separate from the cardio machines, which was separate from the open gym/yoga space. The dual elevators where odd at first, then I soon realized that it was a nice security feature and separated the hotel from the busy streets below. The one complaint (although very minor) I had was that my mini fridge was not restocked, but I was able to order additional bottles of water from room service.

Reviews.Title: “Luck of the Irish”
Reviews.Author: CS1Dallas
Reviews.Content: Well it was St Patricks Day in the Quarter so green was the color of choice, not just on faces but the clothes too. The Ritz is an oasis, it has a superb location front door onto Canal and back door you fall into the Quarter. Well appointed rooms and smiling happy service. The A/C was broken in our room upon arrival, but repaired within the hour. We enjoyed coming back in the evenings to settle into the lounge for the live jazz trumpet & songs, and for that one last drink you always seem to need. We booked through American Airlines vacations with air, a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, but Don't Get Alot for your Money”
Reviews.Author: Equinox03
Reviews.Content: Made reservations for a long girls weekend in March. The Ritz is nicely located about a block from Bourban Street and was a generally good starting point for all of our activities. The rooms were average, but nothing special. There was no coffee maker in the room and there was also an additional charge for wi-fi. We didn't use the spa, as it seemed to be pricier than other Ritz's we have stayed at in the past. The Concierge was very helpful in making dinner reservations for us. Really enjoyed herr recommendation. The bellhops and door service was very poor. Most times they never asked if you needed a taxi or assitance. Not what you would expect from a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Basketball in the Big EZ”
Reviews.Author: JimWPPA
Reviews.Content: Spent the Regional Semi Finals of the 2011 NCAA tournament at the Ritz. 1Br Suite - club level. Really nice stay. With my Dad, he really liked the Gumbo served in the Club level parlour one day. He expressed his liking to the hostess who in turn had the chef cut the recipe down, print it out and send it up. My father being appreciative said thank you and began looking over the recipe. He looked a bit confused and asked the hostess what a Roux was. The hostess instead of being flustered, had the head chef come up and spend 15 minutes explaining to my father how to make Gumbo. It is the little things at the Ritz that they do right. Nice location too

Reviews.Title: “First stay here since Katrina, not our last!”
Reviews.Author: PattyH999
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Ritz Carlton in New Orleans since Hurricane Katina. We had stayed here three weeks prior to the storm. First of all, they have remodeled the hotel to bring the main level of the hotel up to the third floor. We heard many stories from the staff about the hotel's loyalty to guests and employees during the hurricane. Even years later, these were welcomed stories of triumph. The service we received during the stay was exceptional--front desk, operation manager, housekeeping, event coordinator, banquet staff, valet, bell captain, business center and spa. The rooms, although redecorated and clean, are small which is normal in New Orleans. I cannot emphasis the great service and spirit among the employees and staff. This management's doing something right by keeping the right people on the bus! Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!! Only One Negative.”
Reviews.Author: LexBeach
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is an AMAZING hotel. Its common areas and the room are beautiful and very comfortable. The room was beautifully decorated, the bed is very comfy, and the bathroom is luxurious. I do not think the pictures on here represent how amazing it it. The service personnel are wonderful. They recongized us and greeted us each time we came back to the hotel. In fact, the doorman would open the door and welcome us back as as we approached the hotel on the street. That is awesome. The courtyard is also wonderful, and it is a nice place to relax in the evening/night. The only negative was that there was a group of people in the courtyard who were clearly smoking marijuana and behaving a bit uncharacteristic (e.g., loud, jumping on chairs) for the "Ritz" environment. Such behavior would be less shocking on Bourbon Street, though still illegal. It went on for a long time, and there was no attempt by those guests to be discrete about their activity. I was surprised that the staff did nothing about it. The waitress strolled the area, and it would be hard to believe that hotel security doesn't monitor their hotel and this area. I still give this hotel 5 stars because it is that amazing and I would come back. Perhaps this review will inspire hotel security to step up their surveillance and enforcement.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from the Ritz Carlton.”
Reviews.Author: S R
Reviews.Content: Currently stating in this hotel, until Sunday. Service is spotty, and so is cleaning the room. I never get the same toiletries twice. I requested an upgrade, and was given some excuse that they were fully sold out, and then I received a call from the front desk the same day mind you, saying that if I wanted an upgrade it would cost $200 additional dollars per night. That is not an upgrade. I checked several times on the Ritz Carlton website and there are rooms available. If they aren't going to give me the upgrade, then please do not make an excuse that is not accurate. I gave two genrous tips to the front desk and the bellman, don't waste your time. It does not get you anywhere. The other problem is the phone system, I have called several time for various items and when you call the wrong room number comes up, and you never get what you asked for. The best is that I have been calling for wake-up calls, and since the wrong room number comes up, some poor guy is getting my 6:30 wake-up call. Room service is very good, but make sure they repeat your order back to you, twice they have gotten it wrong. I have reservations in San Juan and I am considering cancelling them, since I was not treated as I should be from a Ritz Carlton

Reviews.Title: “great hotel downtown new orleans”
Reviews.Author: shelley b
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton hotel in downtown New Orleans is very well run. The concierge team was very helpful and the rooms were large and comfortable. Bathrooms had wonderful , large towels and we used the resistance pool and spa area.We also had a snack at the bar next to the M restaurant and were very satisfied. My only complaint was that our room faced Canal street which is incredibly noisy so being on the 4th floor did not help. I used my ear plugs and that softened the noise but I would suggest asking for a higher floor when staying there.

Reviews.Title: “VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: HoneyLove76
Reviews.Content: Good Location, beautiful furnishings. However, this hotel is full of excuses and empty promises. Dealing with the people at the front desk, who are very nice, but they do not have any authority to do anything for you. Regardless of how many Ritz's you stay in. I find this totally unacceptable, and do not understand how this can be. VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED, I really thought this would be a phenomenal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Luxury New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Alexjrosen
Reviews.Content: I love Ritz Carlton Hotels. With few exceptions, you can count on a Ritz Carlton to be elegant, clean and luxurious, with an attentive staff providing top-notch service. I have stayed at this property at least three times this year, most recently for an eight-day-stay, and I was again pleased with my decision. During my most recent stay, my room was nothing special, lacking even a decent view. I have, however, stayed in suites at this hotel and they were nothing short of spectacular. The beds are always comfortable, the room decor consistent with the rest of the hotel, and spacious bathrooms. For Marriott Platinum members, internet service is free, otherwise, it is $12.95 a day. The hotel has an excellent fitness center open 24 hours with numerous cardio machines and a separate weight room. The hotel has a great location - right on Canal Street, on the French Quarter side. You are easily within walking distance to Bourbon Street and all the attractions of the Quarter. Additionally, there is a street car stop directly across from the hotel, as well as the Canal Street shopping and business district. The hotel also has valet parking, which is not a guarantee in New Orleans. The hotel's bar is quite popular, particularly on weekend nights. It makes the elevators crowded, the wait at valet longer and perhaps most annoying--the inebriated guests and bar patrons being loud and obnoxious in the lobby as well as the hallways of the guest floors. There isn't much the hotel can do about this, however. If you are looking for luxury and a great location, I definitely recommend the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Ritz Carlton but less so vs other properties”
Reviews.Author: Jonny99
Reviews.Content: The property shares the big, gracious amenities of the chain with plenty of tasteful local artwork, colorful carpets and lots of marble in a historic building. However, compared to its bigger brothers in other places, the New Orleans version lacks a certain grandness including no views other than the very top floors, no pool area (there is an endless pool device that closes early) and a layout that requires moving between a 3-story public section and a 9-story private section. As expected the staff is solicitous although the local "Nawlins" laxity can be viewed in the occasional uncollected finished drink or discarded banana peel. The concierge desk is a standout and given that reservations and things to do are at a premium in "The Big Easy" this is unusually important. The food in the central courtyard and in the French Quarter bar is impeccable if a little dull. Prices for drinks in the Davenport Lounge run $15 to $20 which seriously begs the question why you would drink here given you are in a city chock-a-block with bars. In short, this is sort of a little brother in the Ritz Carlton portfolio.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - even better after the new renovation!”
Reviews.Author: caymanstyle5
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Ritz in New Orleans. Lovely gracious hotel. We come to New Orleans every year mainly to eat and to listen to some great music. The concierge is always helpful and provides us with line bypass tickets for our favourite restaurant. The Davenport lounge is a wonderful place to spend an evening. The hotel is first class comparatively speaking. We had once stayed at the Marriot, and found that the larger, budget "conference style" hotels don't even come close to the quality of rooms and service which you get at the Ritz Carlton, New Orleans. Great service, good value. The hotel is well maintained and the recently renovated rooms look great. There is no other place that even comes close in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, Club Level great!”
Reviews.Author: FitToLive
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights recently and could not have been happier with this hotel. Classic Ritz Carlton service. Stayed on Club Level, which is absolutely the way to go - breakfast, lunch, snacks, plus hot and cold hors d'oeuvres and cocktails in the evening. Great cookies all day long - we found ourselves stopping by the 4th floor just to get cookies! The service in club lounge was very good, they were welcoming and always eager to help with any of our needs. Rooms are just gorgeous with sumptuous decor, comfy beds, and the bathroom was spacious with a huge tub (unfortunately did not have the time to get in it!) Location is very convenient; right on Canal, two blocks from Bourbon Street, easy walk to Harrahs or Canal Place shopping. One warning - getting to and from the Club Level is a little trickly due to the layout of the hotel. Looking forward to a convention in NO next year, will definitely be back at the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Staci M
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at a first class hotel. Only negative was the concierge desk trying to push tours on me. Big negative!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, and club level is worth it.”
Reviews.Author: cbernard1sc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding a few weeks ago. It was during Mardi Gras, and the hotel still managed to maintain some semblance of calm - which is saying a lot for New Orleans in February. The lobby, the bar, the concierges and the staff were all super patient and nice. No one seemed overwhelmed, which can be an issue in Nola. I feel like I can say that having lived there. The regular/deluxe room was nice. Small bathroom with a pedestal sink, so not a lot of countertop space. Probably my only complaint. We also stayed in a club level room one night and the room was much larger nad much nicer and the lounge was great. The club level is a little difficult to navigate from the lobby becasue the hotel is set up very choppy. But, club level is worth the splurge - for the lounge, the larger room and the much nicer bathroom. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: SebDix
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the club level, worth every dollar! The concierge was exceptional, from putting our boudin in the freezer for us to recommending Acme Oyster Bar (which was awesome by the way). I could go on and on about how great our experience was there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet room”
Reviews.Author: tctravelgirl
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for a wedding and stayed 3 nights at the Ritz Carlton. We have been to New Orleans many times, have stayed in about 10 different hotels, and I would definitely stay at the Ritz Carlton again. The location is great. You can walk out the back door of the hotel and be just a couple of blocks away from Bourbon Street. We asked for an interior room, and it was very quiet. We had a suite so the bedroom was large with a nice separate seating area. We only ate breakfast there, and the food and service were good. When I asked about the pool, we were told that we could use the pool at a sister hotel. So if a pool is important to you, then this might not be the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Kelerd
Reviews.Content: Originally was going to stay for two nights but enjoyed it so much that we stayed for five nights, including the New Year. The location, being virtually in the French Quarter,was perfect as a base for seeing New Orleans. The rooms, service and ambience were as you would expect from a Ritz Carlton. Being between Christmas and the New Year, the hotel had all the Christmas decorations that you could ask for. One good thing for smokers is that the hotel has an outdoor courtyard (with waiter service etc.) on the 3rd floor which is smoker- friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Wedding Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Shadowhider
Reviews.Content: WE had a blast at the Ritz and the food plus the staff were impressive. The spa was top notch and evrything we attended was right on! Great job Ritz for a faboulous wedding weekend. Glad I did not have to pick up that tab! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best looking Ritz outside of NYC!”
Reviews.Author: P0ntNeuf
Reviews.Content: Set in a beautiful historic building near the French Quarter, this hotel makes for a great location with all the usual Ritz amenities

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: barryjparker
Reviews.Content: I could hear the entire conversation of a couple next door (at midnight) and of anybody talking who walked past my room in the hall. Room decor also a little gaudy. I hate to say it, but it is not near as nice as the Ritz in Atlanta or DC. Haves stayed in almost every hotel in New Orleans and prefer Windsor Court or Omni Royal.

Reviews.Title: “Tea + Harp + Beignets on a Cold Day = Awesome”
Reviews.Author: BWR269
Reviews.Content: I loved the bar lounge. With some of the best tea I've ever had and a live harpist, it was a unique stay!

Reviews.Title: “Updated hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Airmay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz in New Orleans for a week in January (primarily work related, but stretched some personal time into the stay). The rooms and the hotel were 'fresh' and updated...very comfortable and clean. The bar/lounge has live music several nights a week, which was great jazz and a real treat. The food at the bar/restaurant was delicious. The location of the hotel was really perfect. On Canal St., just around the corner from Bourbon St. and the French Quarter, and near the financial center. I was primarily there for work, and the facilities for meetings was very nice. The catered lunches for those meetings would be my only somewhat negative. Those were average. Nothing wrong with them...but nothing very good either. Service was great and efficient. The gym was better than most. The inside courtyard was a really nice amenity as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jimbob44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a two night stay our daughter gave us (with her Marriott Points) as a Christmas present. From arrival to departure the staff was welcoming, helpful and professional. Our comfortable, well appointed room looked out over the courtyard which was colorful and inviting. Morning coffee and croissants on the courtyard was very pleasant. Some reviews complain about noise, housekeeping, etc. but we would love to go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “You don't want to put up with this”
Reviews.Author: gooddogStavanger
Reviews.Content: Who requires booking by fax theese days? Who replies in sloppy, unreadable hand scribbling on the said fax? What kind of hotel requires the full time effort of one person for one month in advance for booking a weeks reservation in connection with a seminar? The Ritz-Carlton New Orleans Hotel. You just do not want to stay there, no matter who pays the bill. OK, the rooms were fine, and always clean. But do you really appretiate being disturbed 10.30 at night for someone to take the covers off your bed? Do you really find it worthwhile having to argue with the reception staff over absolutely everything? But what really makes this hotel stand out in a negative way is the breakfast procedures. In this hotel you are not a guest. You are something they must handle, a raw material in some way that they need to shape. Honestly, they think it is OK to ask you to queue up for 20 mins. while your companions wait for you. They will charge you a full cost for two breakfasts if two friends sit down to chat with you without eating. They will, as my assosiates thougth, spill juice on your chair on purpose to punish you. This hotel nearly made us downrate Louisiana and the whole south east US. No, be advised. You do not want to stay there, no matter who pays. There are so many better options in this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in NOLA, would easily return”
Reviews.Author: solomentehawaii
Reviews.Content: I tagged along on my husband's work trip (not expensed) and had a great time. I think we made the perfect choice. PROS: 1. Location is fantastic. If you head out the back entrance you are a block from Bourbon street, yet when you return home you feel a world away, which is fantastic when you see how seedy some elements along Bourbon street are (FYI I felt safe the entire trip and walked around on my own). 2. Rooms, I thought they were great. Our bed was comfy, our room was well decorated. The bathroom, though not huge, was tasteful, and separate door for comode from the rest of the bathroom, which I liked. 3. Service, the conceirge was helpful, when I asked for guidance on two occasions I got knowledgeable, professional advice, without the condescending air some concierges have. Bellhop was friendly and helpful. I like turn down service, bring me little chocolates and bedside slippers and I'm a happy camper. Check in & check out were a breeze. 4. Crowd, pretty upscale people (I know, snobby, but New Orleans is a mixed bag my friends--part of the charm but nice to have a break from the "charming"). I saw a few NBA players from Houston in the lobby...funny how they stand out. 5. Cost, we found the rates for our dates more than affordable, given the caliber of the hotel 6. Gym, it's pretty darn nice for a hotel, they have the cardio room with individual TVs on the machines, a weight room, and a Yoga stretch room with weights, medicine balls and cool yoga mats. I spent like an hour doing yoga by myself, uninterrupted. fun. CONS: 1. Noise, our room faced Canal street and I didn't hear regular traffic but the first night I heard several sets of sirens from emergency vehicles. My husband never woke, and I didn't hear it subsequent nights. Perhaps a courtyard room would be quiter. 2. Pool, only indoor lap pool and jacuzzi. For such a hot climate, a nice pool scene could be fun. Tips 1. We traveled in January. I'm from San Diego and packed for San Diego winter. It was 75 degrees and 97% humidity. I made use of the Shops at Canal (Athropologie, Saks 5th Avenue, Banana Republic, Ann Taylor...I missed you JCREW coming FEb 2012). I wish I had brought one warm weather outfit "Just in case"...learn from my mistake. 2. Men bring sports coats, for restaurants like Galatoire's and Commander's Palace, where you'll stick out without one. (By the way, we enjoyed Galatoire's, Commander's Palace was disappointing to us). 3. St Charles Streetcar $1.25 one way, or $3 all day pass, need exact change, the pick up stop at Lady Footlocker on Canal about a block away. I had a Garden District walking tour in the travel book from the library and it gave history on homes in the area (ie Ann Rice's former home, Jefferson Davis' home, etc). Great city to visit. Happy Travels

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressed as I should have been”
Reviews.Author: sharem57
Reviews.Content: travel alot, alot of "high end" hotels. Didnt really find the RC in NOLA to have the spark of a toop tier hotel. the room was average, though comfortable. I hate it when there is no coffee maker in the room. I expect a high end coffee maker in a Ritz property but many thimes ther is not any ocffee maker. Clearly a policy decision that I do not understand. Bathroon adequate. No real extras. Took forever for hot water to become HOT WATER. Service adequate. Usual Ritz smile and hello. Gym was decent. Otherwise it was just another hotel to me. Not the way one should experience a Ritz. I'm going to the ROOSEVELT for next years meeting. the RITZ really lacks any character.

Reviews.Title: “Your best bet in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: NDWHoustonTX
Reviews.Content: We attended a wedding in the French Quarter and stayed at the Ritz-Carlton New Orleans. Though the more negative reviews made us a bit wary, our friends' experiences at other hotels in the Quarter made us realize that we had definitely made the right choice. This may not be the fanciest nor the most luxurious of the Ritz-Carlton properties, but it's very nicely decorated and furnished. Neither our king room nor our bath were unusually spacious, but they were more than adequate, and both were well furnished, with all of the amenities you expect at a Ritz-Carlton hotel, including a very comfortable bed. The service was great and the staff was friendly, polite, and accommodating. Our only dining experiences were room service Continental breakfasts, and they were quite good. Based on the comments of friends who stayed in other hotels in the French Quarter, we highly recommend the Ritz-Carlton. We were told the rooms and baths in other area hotels, like the Monteleone and the Omni Royal Orleans, are very, very small. Friends also reported that the rooms at the Omni are in desperate need of refurbishing. One couple, who moved from the Omni to the Roosevelt, reported that the Roosevelt's lobby and rooms were beautiful, but service was virtually non-existent. Calm and quiet aren't easy to come by in the French Quarter on a weekend night. But if the weather is nice, the Ritz-Carlton's atrium is a pleasant, peaceful place to enjoy a drink and a conversation. And it's probably one of the few places you can be heard without shouting.

Reviews.Title: “pay for the name, not the service”
Reviews.Author: clarej2610
Reviews.Content: first trip to New Orleans, thought we'd do it in style. the hotel is centrally located, clean but the service is terrible. our experience in the hotel restaurant was laborious and over priced. I hate it when hotels milk their guests for every penny they can make just because...they're greedy.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual!”
Reviews.Author: cjc04
Reviews.Content: Although the decor of Ritz Carlton's is not my style, this hotel can't be beat for service. I hold virtually no status there, and I feel like a princess each time I go this hotel chain. This particular hotel was very nice. It was decorated beautifully for Christmas. The rooms were big and quiet. The staff was amazing. In fact, when I told the bellman (Eddie I think) that my mom was joining me for a mother/daughter weekend, he sent up a bottle of champagne! What a treat. The concierge was great too and have wonderful restaurant and sight-seeing recommendations. I would absolutely stay here again. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The new Ritz Carlton, New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: rnathen
Reviews.Content: The upgrades to this property are magnificient, new furnishings, drapes, carpets, etc. I was there December, 2012 and was upgraded to one of the new Executive Suites and it was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting...”
Reviews.Author: houselightsdown
Reviews.Content: We came here over MLK weekend with my family (my mom's birthday) and were visiting NO for the second time in less than a year. We had previously stayed at the Roosevelt. We decided to give the Ritz a try, as we have had great experiences at other properties (e.g., Marina del Rey). Prior to even arriving, we had some issues that were popping up around our reservation and we never received a call back from the hotel desk staff after several attempts to get help. Upon arrival, we found no doormen or anyone waiting for us. It took us several tries to find the reception area and, when we did, there were no notes in our file about any prior conversations we had with the hotel. Our room was fine - clean and comfortable - but nothing special. I had to work all day Friday so I had two meals via room service. The first, breakfast, was excellent - piping hot and fresh. The second, lunch, was meager and disappointing. The room service staff, though, was quite prompt and friendly. After an extremely loud evening where we heard raucous bachelor and bachelorette parties raging on until all hours, my wife and my mother went down to talk to someone at the front desk. We finally spoke to someone who was interested in our situation, Jerry, who apologized profusely and moved us over to the club level. AH! This is where the Ritz-Carlton was. We finally realized that we were initially put in the equivalent of a Marriott. You have to be on the club level in a totally different area of the hotel to get the Ritz experience. Everyone in the club area including the desk staff were wonderful. The rooms were beautiful with hardwood floors, amazing bathrooms, and canopy beds. When Jerry found out we were celebrating two birthdays, he had treats sent up to our rooms. We appreciated Jerry doing his best to make our stay better. In the end, the hotel is well-located and more affordable than the typical Ritz. Several employees were trying to make the experience pleasant and others seemed to not care. The hotel is definitely average if you are used to excellent R-C treatment. We would stay there again if the price were to be right, but will definitely look for other alternatives on special occasions. Several of my family members travel for work and host conferences/events in hotels all of the time. I would say that this hotel does not come close to what we expect in the St. Regis/Four Seasons or even Westin category. To be fair, the best staff members here do equate to the best at other locations, but you must expect a minimum level of professionalism and courtesy across the board.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Service Near the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BHM_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently for work (3-4 times per year) and have been back already twice this January 2012. As always, the service is impeccable, and the property and location are excellent. I always experience vintage RC service by all of the employees I encounter at this hotel. Pros: +Location: You are close enough to the offerings of the French Quarter, but also have a insulated oasis of calm to which you can escape. Mr. B's Bistro is only a few short blocks away (corner of Iberville and Royal), and there you can find the best Gumbo Ya Ya and Shrimp and Grits on the planet. +Club Level: The Maison Orleans is fantastic. The food offerings and attentive staff are top notch, and they have one of the best bloody mary recipes on the planet (with just the proper amount of horseradish!). +The spa is very nice +RC frequently has attractive rates at this property (particularly compared to rates at other RC properties) Cons: +If you have a car, valet parking is expensive +The hotel does not cater to business people enough for my taste. The in-room internet (wi-fi and/or wired) is fairly slow, and they charge you for it. Free wi-fi should be standard at nice hotels in my opinion. Charge me $10 a night extra for my room, but don't "nickel and dime" me on the fees. In the same vein, in the business center itself, the equipment/hardware is perfectly adequate, but if you forget to print something back at the office, beware....they gouge you for printing pages ($1.00 per page for B&W, $3.00/page for color prints). +The workout facility is adequate, but nothing glamerous...get's the job done All in all, a great place to stay in NO. I have had consistently very good stays here for the last 5-7 years.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: Chuckster55
Reviews.Content: Trip back to NOLA after a number of years away. Quick stay in July 2010 seemed fine...quick trip, oil spill, $100 room. Back with the wife for a long weekend in summer 2011...close to a disaster. Service staff in parking and room service the only bright spot. Desk service staff a joke. Room tired and worn out. Restaurant service marginal. All at RITZ pricing. Never to return...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every was”
Reviews.Author: jdeutsch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for a long weekend and so glad we chose the Ritz. It is in a perfect location, the level of service is fantastic, and we enjoyed the jazz club each night. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jackonferry
Reviews.Content: We stayed during a very busy period -- a Saints game, the Sugar Bowl, a Saints playoff game and the BCS championship game were all held in a 10 day period. The hotel was up to it. Our room was quiet, even though it faced Canal street, and quite spacious. The staff were helpful and attentive (with luggage, reservations, etc). I like the fact that the hotel is close to Bourbon street, but not right in the fray of the French Quarter. I would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: NjoyTravel2010
Reviews.Content: Was there this week for the Sugar Bowl. Â I walked away after spending 3 nights there thinking that, for a 5-star hotel, we did not have a 5-star experience. The pros: Â It's 2 blocks from Bourbon Street so conveniently located. Â The lobby decor is, indeed, grand and what you'd expect from a Ritz-Carlton property. Â The spa and fitness facilities are nice. Â The staff, overall, is friendly and helpful. The Club Level is great and the man who heads it is the epitome of good service. The cons: Â 1) Â The perpetual housekeeping. Â (I'm convinced they have a graveyard shift for housekeeping.) Cleaning carts and vacuum cleaners in hallways all through the day -- and evening. Â Our rooms weren't cleaned until the mid-afternoon. We eventually had to call to have it cleaned. 2) Â Unreliable check-in time. Â Check-in is 4:00 -- however, they didn't have our room ready by then. Â Had we not inquired about the status after some time, we probably would have been at the Ritz bar until midnight. Â (While I understand that we arrived on new year's day and the demands of cleaning rooms for new years' partygoers were factors in the check-in delay, one would presume that this was not their first New Year and the hotel would plan its staff accordingly. Clearly, they did not. ) Â  3) Â Rooms. Â For a Ritz property, our room was not up to par. For example, the top drawer's slide completely broke off from the side rendering it unusable and unsightly. 4) Â Manager. Â There was an issue with our initial room. Â So we nicely asked to change rooms. Since the front desk clerk couldn't really help, we had to talk to the manager. Â (If you ever saw, "Little Miss Sunshine," imagine the apathetic hospital administrator. Â That's her.) Â She was terse, irritated, and had this, "I can't help you, just deal with it" attitude. Â (A sincere apology would have gone a long way.) As someone who once worked for an uber-service organization (Disney), her attitude was far, far from even mediocre. I love N'awlins but don't love the hotel's housekeeping efficiency and its curt and impassive manager.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: DoctorG4
Reviews.Content: I lived in New Orleans while completing my residency at Ochsner, but this was prior to The Ritz coming into existence there. A very close friend recommended that I stay there several years ago. Now I will change my dates of travel if it is booked. Even when it had been months since I had stayed in The Club section, the staff remembered me personally. This is true from the valet to the bartenders in the main hotel. It isn't like I'm there every week. Usually I will travel to N'awlins 2 to 3 times a year. Yet, I am remembered by name.Can't think of anything I'd change except lobby is a bit too cold for my thinned out transplanted Floridian blood. I have stayed in multiple bed and breakfasts and multiple star hotels to dumps over the years in New Orleans. No place can come close to the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Holiday at the Ritz...a bit shaky.”
Reviews.Author: VillageGreenMan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton New Orleans for the Holidays and were particularly looking forward to the Holiday Brunch. Staying at the Ritz, one has come to expect a certain degree of service and standard of care. Unfortunately, this trip was a bit disappointing. The one exception to be noted is the on-site engineer, Will, who went out of his way to try to help and alleviate some of the frustration we encountered. Despite working double shifts over the holidays, he maintained an amazing spirit and really did make all the difference. Thank you Will!! As part of the AMEX Platinum program we were looking forward to receiving a free room upgrade. The upgrade ended up being a shift to the Club Level, which was a wonderful treat. The staff of the Club Level really takes their mission to heart and also must be commended for their exceptional serviceâ€¦ That is where the great things stopâ€¦ the first night we settled into a nice room that was made for someone else as indicated by the welcome card and fruit. We figured that this was probably due to the â€œupgradeâ€� that we received, and just went with it. That night after a Holiday meal, we were missing the signature turn-down service; again something we dismissed. The night was cut a bit short however, as the room, located next to the elevator lobby, was shaken repeatedly by the noisy closing of a fire door separating the lobby and the hallway as guests were coming home from the nightâ€™s events. The noise pretty much prevented any sleep. When bringing this to the attention of the staff the next morning, we were given another room and moved ourselves. This room had a broken AC and we moved ourselves once again to another, smaller room that had a shower of same proportionâ€¦one that I did not fit inâ€¦ After the third room, we were relocated to a suite. The suite indeed has a nice layout, but was in need of basic maintenance; including a loose shower door, loose bathroom shelving and broken light in the closet. Having spent a whole day moving, we did not bring the later to the attention of the hotel, simply being tired and wanting to enjoy the rest of our 3 day, now 2 day vacation. None of the above is truly problematic, but is something that should not occur, and if it does, should be better handled by staff, at a location like the Ritz. After all we are not staying at a Holiday Inn and are paying accordinglyâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: coltsfans
Reviews.Content: It is a pretty hotel; a nice building and lobby, but the room was more like something you'd expect in a less expensive price range. The front desk and outdoor valet staff (NOT the indoor person in the room where you give your ticket to) were kind and helpful. There were many small problems: 1. In the room, the guests before us had opened a bottle of water and left it there so I asked if it could be removed as we did not want to be charged this bottle of water since it had already been opened...gross! 2. Dirty hand towel when arrived. There were others towels that were clean so I did not need to call housekeeping for another towel, but again kind of gross. 3. We went to the bistro for dinner and our server had some friends dining there too. For more than 15 minutes after taking our drink orders, we sat with no drinks or even water while she chatted with her friends a few tables down. We decided to move to the bar, which was a great decision. The bartender was really nice, and the atmosphere was fun with great live music. 4. We were charged for a bottle of wine that we did not drink from our mini bar. This was not on our checkout bill but on the one e-mailed to me later. I called and spoke with a helpful customer service representative in the billing department who removed the charge.

Reviews.Title: “December is the best tine to be there!”
Reviews.Author: Ellis3752
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous, but when it is decorated for Christmas, it is amazing. This luxurious hotel is not only beautiful,it is comfortable and has remarkable service. New Orleans in December is not crowded, the weather is pleasant, and the entire city is festive. The restaurants are still wonderful and reservations are easily obtained. I highly recommend this city and hotel for a pre-Christmas get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Club level is good, but the rest they should never call a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: annadaria3
Reviews.Content: Club level- The club level at the Ritz in New Orleans meets the Ritz standards. Particularly helpful and great were Kimberly, Janice, and Foster. Great staff, really worked hard to accommodate us. They really tried hard in the club level lounge to accommodate food and drink requests. But wow, the the rest of the hotel... a disaster. In fact, they should never call that a ritz-carlton.The one thing they did that was positive was an upgrade to club level for the night i had a regular room. But from there it became a disaster, and considering two nights I was paying the high rate of $619 a night, it was inexcusable. Rooms- club level had nice furnishings, but dark and sleeping area small for the price. Also inner courtyard ones are really dark, and a large commode blocks one of the two windows making it even darker and smaller. They need to just have a tV stand like in the regular rooms. Also they say courtyard room is quieter, but the push-bar on the door out into the hallway was very loud every time anyone came in our out. M Bistro- made reservations for 7:30. Most people were already seated (you can listen to jazz in davenport Lounge which is a plus). waited for a hostess for 10 minutes. Another 15 for the menu (so glad jazz was playing). The waitress eventually took our order that included one appetizer. An hour and ten minutes, I had to waive her down to ask the whereabouts of the appetizer... she apologized, went to the kitchen, then went about her business without coming up to us. Another 10 minutes we got up and left. The entire time the hostess was at her desk once. i came up there one time, nobody ever appeared. when we left, nobody was at the host stand to inform that we were leaving... Management - that's the worst part. I told the front desk that we walked out on the restaurant. he told me the manager will call, not a word. The next day our room was not cleaned until I had to find a supervisor, at 5:30 pm... I told one of the club level supervisors about my troubles and they again said they talekd to a manager, Jonathan Hall, and he'd call me back. never did. Then the room key got cut off, so we had to walk to another part of the hotel to reception to get to club level. i demanded to see the manager this time. He walked out from the direction of the bar. Listened, didn't apologize, nothing. Just walked me to the room to make sure the keys worked. (they did, but got cut off again the next day). some lady at the bar was motioning to him as we walked past (I was in front, so she didn't realize we were walking together), but he signed to her not to interrupt. And yet i couldn't get him to call me back after 2 requests. Neither did he bother to apologize for the service at the restaurant. i never saw or heard from another manager or him again. Cell/Internet - There is virtually no cell phone reception in the rooms on club level 4, yet they charge internet fees. front desk said even the lounge had a fee, which turned out to be wrong. at check out i had a question about the charge, nobody could help. In fact, since i had two reservations, they said they only see one reservation up in the club level and thought conversation was over until i insisted... eventually club level offered me two massages (I get $100 credit from Amex, but that would've not quite covered one massage), so I was grateful for that. But management downstairs did nothing. not sorry, not anything. And when I got back i learned that they dared charge me for my drink at teh bar and wouldn't credit it back. The crowd- I have never seen so many loud, ill-bred people. In the library room - shouting (Mark from Gainesville, your relatives who were in NOLA on 12/30 hate your fiancee so much I got to hear all of it from another room of the club lounge). Two ladies in the relaxation room were also discussing men at the top of their lungs before my massage, and were still at it an hour later. as i was checking out at the club level one-person counter a man walked up, pushed me to the side and plopped himself in front of the front desk person i was talking to. he stood there the entire time we discussed my bill, listening to every detail!!!!! right there. The hotel staff are too scared to say anything to the guests. But all in all, they all deserve each other. I went to see rooms at the Windsor Court that was my other (and cheaper option), Saw the one bedroom suite. Huge. not my favorite colors, light blue with flowers, so looked a little cheap, but certainly a huge bright and light space. very crowded downstairs, but don't know how the service is.

Reviews.Title: “Repeated Service Failures Ruin a Fabulous Property”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuestTraveler
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes of staying at the Ritz. I had caused a work conference to be held here and it went very well. I had stayed here on other times for business and it was excellent. This trip, we decided to bring our toddler and stay for 5 nights. We almost decided to stay instead at the Windsor Court because their renovation was now finished. We made a very bad decision to stay at the Ritz. The problems began at check-in and did not end until we checked out. Check in. Our trip in was long because of weather delays and we were checking in at 7:30 pm. We had requested with our reservation that a crib be in our room when we arrived for we knew we might have a cranky toddler with us. We confirmed our request with the hotel before our arrival. When we checked in, we confirmed at the front desk that the crib would be there. He assured us that it was there but if for some reason it were not, he would have the crib brought to the room within 5 minutes. The crib was not in the room. We call immediately, for our toddler was very tired. Our luggage finally arrives 20 minutes later. It had somehow gotten delayed coming to our room from the valet. Still no crib. The bellman calls housekeeping. 20 minutes later again no crib. I return to the front desk and beg for a crib. The same person who checked me in and calls housekeeping and they tell him that they would be bringing it now. The front desk attendant was very annoyed that I returned to the front desk to ask for the crib but after 45 minutes of waiting I was unsure what else I could do. The Ritz also explains that they offer housekeeping two times per day and lists the hour. Again because of our toddler who goes to bed early, we called and asked housekeeping to complete the second service before 6:30pm to avoid any conflicts. At 7pm, we call housekeeping because they have not arrived. They say they will be there in five minutes. At 7:20, we call again, they say they will be there in 5 minutes. By 7:40, I say it is too late to come for we have to put our baby to sleep. We will make do with the towels that we have. I explain that I was putting the DND/privacy sign on the door and please do come to our room for I do not want the baby to wake up. At 8pm, housekeeping comes, bangs on the door and wakes up our baby. I cannot understand how housekeeping could have done this when I requested that they not and we have the DND sign on the door. We finally get our toddler down to sleep at 8:20. At 8:25, housekeeping calls the room. Again they wake up the baby. I tell them that I cannot believe they would call when I told them that I did not want to be disturbed. We finally put the baby down again after 15 minutes of crying. But housekeeping calls again at 8:45 and wakes him up again. At this point, I am beside myself that we are being so harassed by housekeeping that I go to the front desk to speak to a manager. He listens to the story that I just told, apologizes and asks when I want housekeeping to come every night for the remainder of my stay. I say 6pm. Well, housekeeping does not come by 6pm any of our five nights and I have to call every night to request additional service. None of this would be a big deal but for the fact we had a toddler who goes to sleep early. Also housekeeping during our stay was very inconsistent in quality. The maid the evening of the 30th was top notch but the others were not. They randomly took it upon themselves to move our belongings and place them in drawers throughout the suite. It was baffling to us what they had done until we started opening up drawers. Also, while they say they change linens every 2 nights unless requested otherwise, they did not honor their own rules. We requested otherwise for linens to be changed daily, but instead they changed the sheets only once during our five night stay. Also, during visits, they did not always leave us with a full supply of towels. One evening we were told that the hotel had ran out of hand towels and none were available. That seemed very odd. Also, the housekeepers did not always replace the empty bottles of shampoo and conditioner. The hotel provides a list of babysitting services but they are rightfully careful to point out they are not recommending the services. We used two services on the list.. One service was great but it was not available all the nights we wanted, so we used another service on the list. While we confirmed twice, the sitter from the second service was a no-show. We missed our Commander's Palace reservation. So, we decided to order room service. We order soup, salad and pizza. They said it would take 45 minutes. It took over 2 hours and 15 minutes to arrive and the pizza was cold on arrival. We called to check on our order, after about 90 minutes and they assured us, it would arrive right away. Luckily, room service agreed to comp the meal because we had waited so long. We booked under the Amex platinum program which includes breakfast. When reviewing my bill, I noticed a restaurant charge appeared which was incorrect. I go to the front desk to rectify the issue, and the person there really seemed to lack the essential skills to work at the reception desk. She initially disagreed with me that the charge was on the bill, although I showed her a copy of the express checkout invoice where it appeared. She then said that it was for breakfast. I told her that under the program, I pay only tip and tax, as the bill reflected for other days. She disagreed but eventually understood how the Amex program worked and agreed with me. She then said that I must have eaten breakfast twice on one day. I assured that I had not. She then pulls the invoices and tells me that I was charged twice for the same breakfast but she was only going to charge me for one. This whole process that should have taken 2 minutes to resolve took 15 minutes. Sadly, another guest was at the front desk with the same problem but far worse. It is astonishing that the Ritz front desk personnel do not understand the program. She then asked me how my stay had been. I told her very disappointing and that I had regretted my decision to stay at the Ritz. She said only have a nice day and asked no questions. We were a little concerned ahead of our arrival dealing with the concierge. It was very difficult to communicate with them in a way they could understand to make restaurant reservations. We asked for dinner reservations for 5 nights and gave them a list of restaurants from which to choose. To make a long story short, our request was misunderstood and took several emails to get it worked out. While these service experiences with housekeeping, room service and the front desk ruined the trip for my wife and me, there is much to the hotel to be commended. The room itself was beautiful. We booked and received an executive suite, The room was excellent in every way. Wonderful bed, nice bath, great furnishings, quiet opening to courtyard. The covered valet area is so nice. The location of the hotel is perfect. The restaurant staff could not have been nicer. They went above and beyond. They were truly exceptional. The breakfast buffet was great. High tea was great. The lounge food and drinks were great. The setting was excellent. There are steps everywhere with no ramps. I'm unsure how the hotel believes it complies with the ADA. There is locked door to use a lift that requires a key but there was no one who would open it for us. We are not disabled, but it was very difficult navigating the stairs with a stroller and the Ritz employees rarely offered to help with the exception of one male employee who always offered to help. The day concierge was great in suggesting day outings for us. They could not have been nicer or more helpful to us. The valet service was excellent. In fact, upon checking out, he asked how our stay was, and I told him not very good. He said, oh now, what did we do wrong with the car. I said, it had nothing to do with valet services which had been great. Rather, it related solely to housekeeping, room service and the front desk. He asked if a manger had spoken to me at checkout. I said no. I told him that the front desk clerk could have cared less whether our stay went well. He was horrified, and took our contact information and promised we would hear from the Ritz. If everyone at the Ritz was of the quality of the valet guest services person who was so wonderful to us at the end, none of these problems would have happened. Bottom line-- the repeated service snafus ruined our trip. The hotel would have been fine if we did not have our child with us and we traveled many years before he came along. Now, we need a hotel who can provide sufficient service to make traveling with a toddler something short of a nightmare. I give the Ritz extremely low marks and would discourage any family with a young child from staying here. The Ritz management at this hotel runs the risk of ruining a beautiful property by letting such service standards exist. I hope the Ritz management decides it wants to provide quality service, for they should not be allowed to ruin such a fabulous property.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz? Really?”
Reviews.Author: traveler from Hinsdale
Reviews.Content: This is not a five star hotel experience. At best, it's a small step up from a regular convention hotel. Our "upgraded" room was large, but had only one window overlooking a ventilation area. Consequently, it was dark and gloomy. The bathroom was very small with a combined shower/tub. The tub was not really useable for bathing and water pressure was very poor. Housekeeping was fine,except it could occur anytime up to 4pm as we discovered one day when we returned to our room and found it unserviced at 3 pm. One reason I stay at hotels and not b&bs is that I do not like scented candles, room diffusers, etc. Well, the manager of the NOLA Ritz must love that stuff AND have no consideration for people with allergies and migraines because there are whopping, smelly candles in the elevator and reception areas of this hotel. You can enter, leave, talk to the concierge or go to the restaurant without being subjected to these headache inducing smells. In addition, the outdoor courtyard allows smoking throughout so it is not possible to step outside to have a beverage or snack or get away from the candle smell without then having a smoker next to you. On a positive, the restaurant staff is very friendly and the breakfast and lunch offerings are quite tasty. The restaurant itself is a bit dated and dark.

Reviews.Title: “dirty sheets”
Reviews.Author: universeenergy
Reviews.Content: checked in about 5pm, complained about dirty sheets with lots of hair on it. sheets got changed around 7ish. this place is old. we had the tea time, was not worth 50 bucks. you got a small dish of 5 mini sandwiches, one really sucked, then a small dish of mini desert.. all sucked. very slow on refilling your wine and tea. got one glass of wine and one cup of tea in 2 hours and 30 mins

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is awesome”
Reviews.Author: bryhof
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is awsome, newly remodled and spotless. You could not ask for a better place to stay in NOLA off Bourbon Street. The rooms were a plush and luxurious as any I have every stayed in. The staff was incrediable. You can't go wrong at the Ritz

Reviews.Title: “OK stay”
Reviews.Author: NickTH
Reviews.Content: Brought the family to stay in 2 rooms for the long weekend. Overall, a very nice hotel, public spaces are very classy & beautiful. Excellent location, right on the edge of the French Quarter. Valet parked for $42/day. Internet use $12/day. We did not eat in the hotel restaurants, but ate in the many excellent restaurants in & near the French Quarter. After assigning us to the 3rd Floor facing Canal street, thanks to other reviewers' suggestions on here, we requested higher floor & away from the street, we got 2 rooms on the 10th floor, however, got views to AC equip on the roof, but it was very quiet. Although public spaces are outstanding, Rooms are just OK, didn't feel as luxurious for the price. Front desk, concierge, & bell desk personnel are average, not as friendly as expected, esp from the Ritz. Maid service were outstanding. We had 2 issues that were troubling, unacceptable for when staying at the Ritz. 1. We forgot a folder of paperwork in our car after dropping off at valet. We had to call down 3 times, personally came down to talk to concierge, who sent us over to the bell desk, who had to go back to concierge to no solution. Next day we called service manager who stated that it will be delivered to our room. Later in the day, still no folder. We sent our daughter down to concierge desk to finally picked up folder. So much aggravation for such a simple task. 2, I used hot tub by myself at 9:30pm Sat night by myself. Excellent experience. Brought entire family back to use hot tub at same time, 9:30pm, Sun night. But it was closed/locked. Staff would not open/allow us to use, said it was closed because the spa was closed, even though it was located in between the 2 fitness center rooms, which is open 24 hours. Our high school & college age kids wondered why was the small pool & hot tub run/operated by the spa, while they can be just as likely to be injured in the unsupervised 24 hour fitness center, without a hotel phone, & esp when it's located away from the main hotel premises. 3. One small complaint was that on Sunday morning, hotel had dozens of NY Times newspapers avail, but no local New Orleans newspaper. Overall, it was an decent stay. But for the money, there are many other excellent choice hotels in the area, where we think you'll get your money's worth. We just think we didn't get the "Ritz Carlton" wow factor at this location as with other Ritz's...

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking -- Best of Ritz-Carlton Portfolio”
Reviews.Author: dlcSilverSpring_MD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a stunner. I have stayed at a number of Ritz properties, and this one is among the best, if not the best. The building is a grand dame, and the rooms are nicely sized and appointed. The service is excellent, as one would expect. I was there near Christmas and the hotel was just beautifully decorated. They did have some difficulty finding my rental car, which delayed me about 20 minutes, but they did find it, were very apologetic and comped the parking fee, so they did a good job with the situation. A plus.

Reviews.Title: “holiday overkill?”
Reviews.Author: amanwarren
Reviews.Content: A good hotel -- excellent service -- but a bit too adorned for the holiday -- a Ritz Carlton should be a bit more refined and subdued, but each morning the hotel seemed to add more decorations and louder music. There needs to be some discretion in a hotel of this caliber. The hotel must fix its key card system. If your room key goes anywhere near your mobile phone or pda, it deactivates, and while the front desk staff will cheerfully replace it, this process gets tiring after a while. Had trouble with the room wifi -- and was put on phone with a call center off site. Took an hour or so of prodding to get it fixed. Hotel staff wasn't as helpful as could be -- nor did they check up on progress. Finally, the hotel has a new ad campaign which they play on the in room television (set during turn down service). The campaign -- which is quite good -- doesn't match the reality of the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: anaussietourist
Reviews.Content: Stunning- beautiful renovation and exquisite chandeliers. Must stay when you're in new Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: jami674
Reviews.Content: We were able to get a great deal on a room here for the weekend from GetARoom.com so we decided to stay at the Ritz. It was a perfect location, just on the edge of the French Quarter, within close walking distance of most of the FQ sites, Harrah's, the river, as well as across the street from the trolley service. The service was fantastic and we enjoyed the later than usual check-out time of noon. The lounge on the 3rd floor offered a great bar and fantastic nightly music. There is also a VIP lounge on the 4th floor that had complimentary breakfast starting at 7am and snacks and drinks (alcohol included) until 10pm. We just asked at the front desk to gain access. The concierge and front desk were very helpful in planning excursions and for directions. The hotel is about 1 block from Bourbon street, but far enough away that it is still very quiet. Our room was very spacious, clean, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Spa and Great People”
Reviews.Author: PlanoJay
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a quick trip to NOLA to celebrate the anniversary and could not have picked a better place to stay for a romantic getaway.
