The highlights - very quiet room (away from the noise on Bourbon St), very comfortable bed, clean restroom, etc. etc. I informed the staff that we were celebrating our anniversary and we were greeted with champagne in our room - very classy touch. Although the flowers I ordered from a local florist arrived about an hour late, everything else was in place for the start of a great weekend. The spa - no complaints at all. We had a couples massage and we both came away very refreshed and relaxed. The facilities are top rate with plenty of quiet areas to sit and relax, shower, get dressed and be pampered if you are so inclined. We were short on time and did not take advantage of everything that was available to us. If we ever do it again, we will take a few hours and enjoy the facilites more (which they recommended to begin with). A must do - go to Louisianna Bistro on Daphine street - just a short walk from the hotel. The place is very small and only seats about 30-40 people. However, the food was excellent and a great place to celebrate with a loved one. They offer what is called "Feed Me", which is a chef's selection of whatever he wants to bring you. You choose between 3, 4 or 5 courses and then sit back and enjoy the evening. The chef comes out and explains every course to you and gives you the opportunity to ask how it was prepared. I won't go into detail about the final course that was prepared for us, but it was something I would have never ordered from a menu. However, I ate the entire plate.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: Gpvtxgirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the club level. The room showed wear - chipped paint, black in grout lines in the corners of the shower. The window in it was tiny and the view was of a parking garage. However, the common spaces on the club level were very, very nice. There was a never ending quantity of food and limitless liquor. If you're a big drinker (which I'm not) you'll save a ton of money by eating and drinking right there. One concierge wasn't particular helpful until pushed into doing his job. All the other staff I encountered at the hotel was truly wonderful. They make this hotel what it is. The location is great. Using the club level entrance made the hotel smaller, more manageable, less maze-like. The in house entertainment (Jeremy Davenport?) is extremely good. Wish we'd had more time to just stay there and listen to him.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Luxury”
Reviews.Author: gda141
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Ritz. Had a great time, and didn't really have any complaints about this property. Our recently renovated room, which faced the courtyard was well appointed, spacious, and had a very comfortable bed. All of the staff that we encountered were very friendly and accomodating. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Just Like a JW Marriott”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom526
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at this property and were very unimpressed. We have stayed in about half of the Ritz Carlton properties and this one does not even compare to Ritz Carlton's in Atlanta, Palm Beach, Boston or New York. The property is visually nice, and conveniently located, but is starting to show wear and tear. We felt that the biggest disappointment was the lack of attention to details and customer service. Upon check in...nobody knew our name, a Ritz Carlton trademark in almost all locations. We were never greeted by name or recognized in any way. The gentleman that checked us in gave us inaccurate information regarding our room, stating that we had a view of the downtown when we had a view of the building and inner courtyard. The room was large with two queen size beds which is always a plus with a family. The concierge was very nice via e-mail and set us up with dinner and brunch and tour reservations, but never followed up upon our arrival. In addition, all the recommendations were just average. We had dinner at Pelican Club and the service and food was just okay. We had brunch at Mr. B's and the jazz was almost non existent and the food awful ( stay away). The VIP tour was a two hour bus ride with a walk through a graveyard. No other tour options were presented to us via email so we assumed that this was a great quick overview. Wrong, don't waste your time! The best things we did in New Orleans (this was our second trip) were things we picked out on our own. The World War ll Museum is not to be missed! The concierge did not mention that one at all! The Jazz at the hotel was as good if not better than the places we were sent, so start there if you are looking for music and dancing, as you should be in New Orleans. The spa was the other great disappointment. We just came back from the Ritz Carlton Cancun and that was a first class spa, as is The Ritz Carlton Palm Beach. My hair appointment with Kim was excellent, but the actual spa services were average at best as are the accommodations. The tranquility room was without any special seating or hot neck rings or warm blankets. The magazines were months old and the massage( a special cafe ole massage, not only had no special aroma, but was just mediocre). The main reason that we booked this hotel and not the JW was because the spa was so highly rated. I am telling you, I go to a lot of world class spas, and this was not in the big leagues. The worst part about the averageness of the hotel, was that management did not seem to care when we spoke up about some of these issues. If you enjoy staying in Marriott Hotels, which we do, this is a fine hotel. However, it is a Ritz Carlton and it needs to outshine it's sister hotels as it does in most major cities. We would never stay here again, there are too many other interesting properties in New Orleans to bother with one that lost it's lustre.

Reviews.Title: “This is kind of funny.........”
Reviews.Author: Sally G
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay at the Ritz-Carlton but we did meet a friend there for brunch and ended up having Thanksgiving dinner there in the restaurant. There was a small jazz band and dinner was wonderful! The staff was attentive and gave us whatever we wanted. The chef even came out to meet us and squeeze us in for Thanksgiving dinner. The manager of the restaurant was very nice to us and our waiter was excellent. I wish we stayed there instead of another hotel, but we were already booked. The wait staff even came over to move our table because there was a column blocking or view of the band and they lifted our table and moved it so we could see. The larger tables had flowers and our table for 2 hadn't any and as soon as we inquired about this a vase of beautiful fall flowers appeared. They will do practically anything to make you happy.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful & clean, great location”
Reviews.Author: laurensmiked
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stated at the Ritz this past weekend for the Giants/Saints game at the superdome. We stayed for 3 days and had a great time. The hotel/our room were beautiful. We were able to check in early with no problem at all. We forgot toothpaste so had them bring toothpaste to the room and they did so with no charge. We used the gym and it was clean and had a decent amount of equipment. There wasnt anyone in there on either of the days we went so it was nice and quiet. The room had a beautiful/clean bathroom and a very large flat screen tv. There are taxis waiting outside the hotels from doors all day/night long so if you need to go somewhere you know it wont be a problem getting a ride which was also convenient. The location couldnt have been better. its a block from bourbon street and close enough to walk but far enough away that you dont hear all the noise when youre ready to go to bed. The only thing i would recommend is that if you are a very light sleeper and you will be staying on a weekend, you may want to ask for a room that is not directly overlooking Canal street as you may hear some noise. We didnt eat at the restaurant at all or use the spa services because there is so much to do around town that we didnt want to waste our time inside a hotel room. Overall, i would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You are guaranteed to be comfortable at a Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: travelbugslc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. You get everything you expect from the Ritz-Carlton hotels - efficient helpful service, clean comfortable rooms, and beautiful common areas. The location is great, being only a short walk to the French Quarter and other places of interest. It was always nice to return to our comfortable room and bed after a long day of exploring. There is live entertainment (Jeremy Davenport) from Thurs-Sat night and this band is excellent. My husband and I also treated ourselves at their luxurious spa which has won a few awards - we got the Voodoo couples bath and massage. We have done similar treatments everywhere but felt so relaxed and pampered when we left this spa. Only ate at the premise once and that was on the last morning - breakfast in the courtyard. Delicious but you certainly pay abit more being at the Ritz. Also, valet parking is $42 per night so unless you are driving into New Orleans, you really dont need a car because everything is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay, But Had Billing Annoyances Afterwards”
Reviews.Author: suzetdk
Reviews.Content: We had six in our party in three rooms for two evenings during Thanksgiving. The room was spacious with very comfortable beds and clean bathrooms. Housekeeping was exceptional, and provided additional towels within 5 minutes of our request. The breakfast buffet at M Bistro had a good variety of cheeses, pastries, smoked salmon, fruit and an omlette station. Our server was attentive and had impeccable timing. The front desk staff in general could be friendier and more knowledgeable, but the concierge and doormen were very friendly and provided helpful information. I noticed billing issues after the stay. My reservation included Breakfast, but I was erronously charged for it. The Accounting department acknowledged the mishap, and they have processed the refund. Later, I noticed that an additional night of valet parking was incorrectly billed. I have spent 20 minutes on the phone with no resolution. I contacted the front desk, who transfered me an impolite valet attendant - on hold for 8 minutes - who transfered me to the on-duty manager, who researched this charge for 10 minutes, and informed that he recognizes the error, but unfortunately he will be unable to assist me. He recommends contacting the Accounting department in the morning. How inefficient! It is annoying to have multiple billing problems after a great Thanksgiving holiday with family. I will have to reconsider whether to stay at this particular Ritz Carlton again.

Reviews.Title: “Begniets and rooms”
Reviews.Author: FreeholdDMS
Reviews.Content: No reason to go to cafe du monde. The begniets at the ritz are better and come with 3 little sauces to try. Yummy

Reviews.Title: “Ritz always delivers...”
Reviews.Author: Lauryssa1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. Room was elegant and very clean. Turn down service is in the early evening. The service at the Ritz was above and beyond. If we needed an extra towel it was at our door within five minutes. They also have complimentary shoe shines. Concierge was helpful -- got us into a popular restaurant last minute. Hotel is about 2 long blocks away from Bourbon Street, which is nice because you are away from the noise. Although the Ritz was great, next time we want to stay in an old hotel in the heart of the French Quarter to truly experience New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: KrisnSteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in a suite on bed and breakfast rate.Staff all extremely friendly and helpful from the moment we drove in to the parking area.My wife left her phone in the car and after calling the desk it was in the room within five minutes.The suite according to the bell boy was freshly decorated and it certainly was a very nice room with a large lounge area, a huge bathroom and a very comfortable bed.The room was serviced twice a day and the maids made sure we had plenty of bathroom supplies etc. The concierge desk was very helpful with maps and directions etc. The breakfast was excellent each morning, although we did have to wait one morning for 5 minutes while they made a table up.For a large hotel the breakfast area not very big. I never did understand the breakfast charging although they tried to explain it to me twice, I'd paid for b & b but a small charge was made each morning for breakfast. I guess there must be a limit and we went over it.Anyway the food was plentiful,freshly cooked and very good.Try the New Orleans hash!! When I got home about two weeks later I had been charged for Room bar items to my credit card which we had not had. I never buy things from hotel room bars,too expensive. Anyway after I contacted the hotel billing department this charge was refunded to my card with no argument. A very nice three days in a great city, thank you we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jemetta
Reviews.Content: I stayed there nights and never had to ask for anything. Are rooms were very nice with turn down service every night. Had a problem with the light fixtures and maitainence was there to fix it within the hour. The restraunt was lovely and the service there was wonderful. My only complaint was that there was no free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: lb331
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel,rooms were very roomy. Housing keeping was alittle lax.Out of our stay of 5 nights our room was never made up and when told lead keeper still wasnt done even though he said it would. Also make sure you ask for additional towels and shampoos. Ok now for the noisy guests. We were on the 11th floor and seemed to be the busiest. From about 12 Midnight till about 4:30am all I heard was people yelling and laughing up and down our hall. Dont know where the secuirty was but guess not around there. As for the restuaruant on site the food was okay. Very pricey..for ex. 2 egg with toast and potatoes $20. a glass of OJ $6. Also for breakfast there arent that many places to go to for breakfast except IHOP so just keep that in mind. For the most part the hotel was okay would we stay there again not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place tonStay”
Reviews.Author: MCCTyler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with the service and amenities you expect at the Ritz. Good location, near, but not in the French Quarter. The Club Level is very nice and probably saves money in the end. Davenport Lounge is nice as well

Reviews.Title: “very dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stopped in New Orleans unexpectedly and after paying almost $500 for one night on the club floor, we found the service to be lacking for what we've come to expect from a Ritz Carlton hotel. We asked the concierge at check in to recommend a good cajun eatery within walking distance. I guess walking distance to them is 14 blocks. My wife ruined a pair of bruno maglis and we finally gave up and went back to the hotel. After complaining to the manager he offered us free drinks at the bar. Hello. We're staying on the club floor, all of our drinks are free. So he offered free room service. We ordered and both meals (filet for me, flounder for her) arrived cold. When the manager called our room to make sure we were happy and I told him the meals were cold he offered us..wait for it..free drinks. We've stayed in numerous Ritz Carltons and my cousin is a concierge at one and after this experience we will be staying at the W. It may not have the old world charm that I love about the Ritz but the service is bar none.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie17
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for a conference, that just happened to be in the Ritz. The accommodations were very comfortable...bedding, seating and desk area. It is an old hotel, so don't expect modern decor. It fits in with the French Quarter. Very ornate, and very pleasant. I liked the ability to sit outside in a courtyard. Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, (though the desk did give out some misinformation when I was looking for transportation back to the airport). Everyone was courteous...the maidstaff, restaurant staff, etc. They acknowledge you whenever they see you and make sure that you get everything you need. The hotel restaurant had very good food. It was pretty expensive, though. I had breakfast there one day and the cost was $25 + for the buffet. There wasn't anything out of the ordinary for breakfast, so I thought that was a bit steep. After that, my colleagues chose to go to the iHOP that was down the street. The Ritz catered our conference meals and they were very satisfactory. As a whole, if you are planning a visit here, bring lots of money or credit cards. Everything is expensive, from your first cab ride to the last! But everyone should experience New Orleans once in their life!

Reviews.Title: “Uneven”
Reviews.Author: Freak77
Reviews.Content: The good: Bar and restaurant are great. The servers are very friendly. The spa and gym are good. Room is clean. The bad: Layout is impossible to understand. The club area is through multiple key controlled doors. Over half the time the key they give you doesn't work meaning you either get stranded somewhere OR... have to trek back to the main desk for a new key. This ends up becoming both annoying and boring. The wireless is useless and if you are in town for business, as I am, this becomes a deal breaker. I'd stay here again, largely because the competition in New Orleans is so dreadful. Still this isn't an impressive operation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ritz I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: KCTraveler44535
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz for a conference November 10-13th. The hotel is beautiful and located right by the French Quarter. Let me start with the positives: My room was clean. The Davenport Lounge and M Bistro both had great food and great service. Meeting space on second floor was nice as well. Negatives: The wireless internet in my room was not working, nor was it working for any of my colleagues attending the conference. A bellman tried to enter my room at 11:30 p.m. to drop off a gift basket my first night there. I was in bed! A maid also tried to enter my room early the morning I checked out. I called for a rollaway bed at 7pm on Saturday and when I got back to my room ready for bed after 11pm, the bed was still not there. It took 2 more calls to finally get it. I arrived around noon and my room was not ready, which was fine, but they never called to notify me when it was ready. A co-worker had a remote that did not work and it took 7! calls to get a new one. Another co-worker did not have hot water. From your room you can hear everything going on in the halls which makes it hard to sleep. Overall, I will be staying elsewhere on my next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.”
Reviews.Author: jpaq68
Reviews.Content: It's like walking into another world when you step through the doors. The Lobby is immacualte and the staff is friendly and very, very helpful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else in New Orleans. Drinks in the bar are a little pricey, but not as bad as they are on Burboun Street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: LordLightLady
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our time at the Ritz Carlton. The room was quite large and comfortable. The staff was the friendliest I have ever had the pleasure to experience. From check in to housekeeping, everyone was cheerful and asked how our stay was and was the anything they could do? Never have I felt more welcomed and cared for. I wish all hotels were so nice. We even had a few extra requests that were handled promptly and cheerfully. I can't say enough good things about the people.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: bettykid
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel. My husband and I celebrated our 15 year anniversary with a 6 day trip to the New Orleans Ritz. The concierge had great suggestions for exploring the town and restaurants. Bubba, the doorman, always had a great smile and a friendly word. The bar was great and had good service. The room was roomy with a larger bathroom - plenty of room for two people to get ready in the morning. The location was great - two short blocks off of Bourbon Street. It was at the beginning of the business district, which is where many up and coming restaurants are located. I also liked the spa - it was pricy but the services were definately worth the price (and I am picky!) I would highly recommend this hotel for any adult needs (we had no kids with us so I cannot speak for kid needs)

Reviews.Title: “Canal street room at ritz and cab”
Reviews.Author: booklover11
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay at this property. While another hotel is more conveniently located for my business, I prefer Ritz. My last stay, I was put on third floor, facing Canal. At check in, I was assured the room would be quiet. It was one of worst in terms of noise of anywhere I have ever stayed and it was a week night. After not sleeping all night, called for hotel manager at four a.m. Spent next thirty minutes on hold. Not worth changing rooms at that hour with early business meeting. Not what I would expect at the Ritz. As an aside, night before, got cab at Ritz with client to business meeting. Should have been 5 minute ride and we rode around bad neighborhoods for over hour. Tried callIng concierge for directions but no answer.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Dustin T
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed in most of the hotels in New Orleans and I must say that the Ritz-Carlton is among the best. The only negative is that I once had to wait an hour passed check-in for my room to be available, had I not had other guests with me that night, I guess I would have been expected to stay in the lobby or courtyard, which wouldnâ€™t have been much of a problem because the courtyard is great, and in their defense, it was a busy weekend. Other visits to the hotel have made up for my one negative experience. Rooms are decent sized, clean with nice bedding, and the Davenport Lounge is a great place to grab a drink. I recommend this hotel for locals and tourist alike.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Ritz " A Class Act"”
Reviews.Author: E D
Reviews.Content: This hotel knows service. From the front desk to the bellman , it is absolutly wonderful. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Yeti249
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you would expect from a R-C property. Beautiful rooms, nice beds/sheets, great service and even the bathroom is worth mentioning. Location is awesome. The maid even picked up my dirty clothes from the floor of the closet and placed them in a bag. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ackee
Reviews.Content: The past two years Lisa and I have stayed at this property in December. Everything first-rate. The hotel is conveniently located on Canal Street at the edge of the French Quarter. Over the Christmas holiday the property boasts decorations galore. We stayed on the Club Level and give top scores to the food and beverage offerings and the warm service of the staff. We look forward to returning this year.

Reviews.Title: “No key?”
Reviews.Author: LoveQuietPlaces
Reviews.Content: Half an hour after they went off to get our keys at check in, they said the key machine wasn't working correctly and they would bring us our keys. The keys they brought didn't work, so they moved us to a different floor (said all the keys on the 4th floor weren't working). First room was quite small, and two lamps were broken, so requested a room similar to the one we had been given originally. They sent us to another room on 5 that was even smaller and on the Canal Street side. We asked if they couldn't do better. Eventually they sent us to an Executive Suite, great size, excellent bed, hideous decor (flocked upholstery--remember flocking from the sixties?). But can live with ugly for 3 nights. Trouble was the sitting room part reeked. Carpet cleaner? Moldy carpet? Hard to tell. Both of us need the desk and that is where it is located. The bright spot in all this was a porter named Johnny who was the soul of comfort, solicitude and patience. If they give employee of the year awards, he should get it.

Reviews.Title: “A sanctuary in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: keldes
Reviews.Content: You must stay on the club level, it is worth every dime. The club level is accessed by a separate elevator, includes free cocktails, and food all day long. The rooms are what you expect at a Ritz and the service was very good. I will stay here every time I visit NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but lacking”
Reviews.Author: lcmg71
Reviews.Content: Room was a bit small but bed comfortable. Amenities not up to other Ritz Carltons where I have stayed. Room safe very small and hotel could not acccomodate us except to say put the "do not disturb" sign on the door. Really? An attempt to have a late breakfast on the outdoor courtyard was an exercise in patience. Even though we (and another couple) made repeated visits to the hostess and the front desk, service took forever. Very disorganized. Parking very expensive at $42/day with tax. Overall all staff very friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, terrible housekeeping service ....”
Reviews.Author: GLMARTIN_PR
Reviews.Content: This is a beatiful property with all the atributes for a wonderful vacation. Excellent location, beautiful decoration. Having said that, the service at this property is not at Ritz Carlton level. Our room was not ready when we arrived so we had to wait for about an hour. When we got to the room we notices many things missing like TV remote controls, trash cans, iron, and minibar. We requested all of them by phone and went out for dinner. When we returned, only the minibar was fixed. i then called the Manager on Duty (MOD) who very politely promissed to fix everything the next morning (I was too tired to wait late at night). Next day we went out again and returned to the Hotel around 6pm to find everything still missing (remotes, iron, trash cans). I went down to front desk around 7pm and spoke in person with the MOD who said he was not aware of issues and promissed to fix everything. Came back from dinner that night around 11pm to find everything still missing. Called the MOD and he told me that he had just started his shift and he did not knew anything about my room. I explained it all over again and he promissed to fix it. 10 minutes later it was fixed. On a positive note, they gave me a credit for one night (offered upon check in troubles). However, I had to go down to request it because they conveniently "forgot" about it. Finally, our room faced Canal Street and it was very noisy outside at night. Everuthing that happens in the street was heard loud and clear in our room. We were in the 5th floor. Sound insulation could be really improved. Next time in New Orleans I think I will stay at the Four Seasons......

Reviews.Title: “First rate place to stay in great location”
Reviews.Author: ventureforth
Reviews.Content: Have stayed plenty of times in NO but this is the best place I've found. It is higher end than my usual place to stay (though certainly not the first time I've stayed at a top end hotel), but the location and comfort are top notch for the purposes of the small firm retreat we were having. The courtyard was a great place to meet and have drinks before heading out! Staff is very friendly and helpful, and the rooms were dead quiet right on the edge of everything you want to do in NO.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Imagine a Better Place in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: CalHobbes
Reviews.Content: Wow, wow, wow! Great experience from start to finish. We had a group attending for a long weekend and there was a last minute problem with getting a couple of the suites we had reserved. Prior to arrival that day all of our guests received emails indicating the issue and suggesting that they would be happy to upgrade us the the Club level to make up for the inconvenience and provide a place for our group to get together since we no longer had suites. They had everything done before anyone even checked in. Fantastic fix to the problem and the proactiveness in providing a solution was very much appreciated. All of our party was extremely happy with the service and rooms. I will say that if you are staying in the Club Level (they actually call is something entirely different - Maison Orleans) get a porter...if you do not you will be mightily lost. Maison Orleans is basically a cozy little boutique hotel within the immensity of the Ritz Carlton. No less that three elevators are required to get to your room from the valet stand. There is a private entrance along Iberville where you can avoid going through the whole hotel...but you figure that out later. Check in was warm and welcoming, the room was beautiful with hardwood floors and a canopied bed. It also had fantastic views of the french quarter roofs, the St. Louis Cathedral, and the River. Could not ask for more. We were very near the elevators which worried me, but I didn't hear a thing from the hallway or the elevators. The food, service and drinks in the club lounge were lovely and while the hotel tries to maintain some sort of dress code for the lounge I was a bit put off by the assorted flip flops and tank tops wandering through (this was on the men) acting a bit like it was a frat house. The rooms in the lounge were far too elegant for these guys. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't stuffy, I just enjoyed a little less drunken revelry in the lounge than what was going on two blocks away on Bourbon. Not that big a deal. Anyway, the staff in the lounge were amazing, engaging and full of helpful information. They even retrieved the 6 hours new iPhone I was foolish enough to leave there as we took off for dinner. I am extremely grateful for that! I could go on and on, but basically this place was pretty near perfect on every front. We had a fantastic time in New Orleans and at the Ritz Carlton's Maison Orleans. Even ran in to Al Roker in the lounge on Sunday morning. My husband is from New Orleans and I know he felt very proud to be able to show our friends his hometown from such a lovely "base of operations." We will be visiting and staying at the Maison Orleans as frequently as possible from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappytravelsCanberra
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton in September at the beginning of a 6 week drive tour of south, east and north USA. This hotel was the best we stayed in for the whole tour. A beautiful hotel, located in the French Quarter. The Club level is excellent value and is definitely worth the extra dollars. The level of service in this hotel is first class. Can't speak highly enough of it. Many thanks to the management and staff for making our stay so enjoyable. Couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level the way to go”
Reviews.Author: HowFtLaud
Reviews.Content: I had posted a previous review about this hotel back in June. In August we stayed on the club level and it was like staying at a different hotel. The club level staff is excellent and attentive. The food presentations are delicious. The rooms are big and real nice.

Reviews.Title: “OUSTANDING WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: brentef
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to New Orleans about 12 times in the past 12 years. Often we stay at "just a hotel"! That might be a Marriott, a Sheraton or a Courtyard but the Ritz was an experience. From the check in at the reception desk the staff only wants their guests to be pleased. Housekeeping was great and the room was furnished and decorated like a home away from home. Howard at the front door was always there and had a smile on his face. Jerry at the Valet was always available to talk to , ask and answer a question and wish you a great day. The club services and the staff was completely outstandingly outstanding. The food, the drink, the selection, the quality the people, the services were phenomenal! I travel and have been on the road in hotels around 70 days year to date this year alone and I will tell you that nothing I have ever experienced with the exception of the Four Seasons Hotel has come close! Thank you to the staff, the management, the Club team and everyone for making this an absolutely, positively stay and experience to remember!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expect from a Ritz Carlton property”
Reviews.Author: paulinias
Reviews.Content: I really hate to have such a bad experience at a Ritz Carlton, as I've come to love the brand and level of service at every other property I've stayed at. Unfortunately, this Ritz just didn't live up to its brother and sister properties. That said, lets start with the positives: -Great Location close to Bourbon street but far enough away not to be in the thick of things. -Beautiful interior courtyard. -Comfortable beds!!! Now, for the bad: -It was my partner's birthday and I requested a bottle of champagne online the day before we arrived but got no response. At check in I was able to say something to the front desk person who promised a bottle of champagne -- nothing ever came! I called a manager the next day who apologized and asked my partner's name. Later that day we got a bottle of champagne awkwardly handed to us with no note, no use of his name even though they asked. -LOUD rooms! We could hear ever conversation in the hallway, and unfortunately had a housekeeping staff meeting right outside our room at 9am on a weekend. -When paying for a five star property, one can expect complimentary morning coffee in the lobby, unfortunately this property charged $4 for a cup of coffee! Outrageous and tacky! You can do better Ritz Carlton!

Reviews.Title: “Great In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: gatorcane
Reviews.Content: The fastest check-in ever. Beautiful, standard Ritz quality room. The property has been remodeled and carpets, paint, furnishings are all new and fresh. Everything at this location is Fast. Room service, valet for the car, housekeeping, bellmen are all fast. This hotel has great staffing. Who ever is hiring for this hotel knows how to get great people. We had a room service burger and it was perfectly cooked. A spinach salad with Gulf shrimp was good(someone missed cleaning a couple of shrimp, kind of disgusting). Coffee and breakfast were very good. The location is excellent and I enjoyed this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Service and Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Seanmage
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights here on a business trip and the experience was very good. I really liked the fact that with the lobby and Bistro Bar on the 3rd floor one is comfortably isolated from the hustle on Canal Street yet you are an easy walk to everything you need to see and do in the French Quarter. The room was excellent and the service great.

Reviews.Title: “SPA Review....Amazing massage and facilities!”
Reviews.Author: msspungen
Reviews.Content: I had a TravelZoo voucher for a massage and glass of champagne here. WOW. The best spa I have ever visited outside those in Las Vegas. The staff was pleasant, nice, and professional. The robes and sandals are comfy and the waiting 'relaxation room' is clean and serene. The champagne was delicious and they have coffee and tea as well for patrons to drink. The hot stone massage I received from Marilyn was GREAT. Super-relaxing and well-done. She was amazing. I felt so relaxed. I could then visit the sauna and steam rooms, which I did. Both amazing. The showers on-site are fully equipped with soap, shampoo, shave gel, etc and they have shower caps and razors available. My fave part was mixing the free sugar they provide with the shower gel for a wonderful exfoliating shower. Ahhhh! So blissful. They have hair dryers, combs, hairspray, and deodorant for you to use too. I loved every moment of it. A+++++ Best spa visit in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Less than Impressed”
Reviews.Author: sehpm
Reviews.Content: I just completed a four night stay at the Ritz. First, there were many individuals who provided excellent service - the waiter who delivered room service was great. The lady who provided turndown service and other wait staff in the hotel were all very nice. However, at a management level and in other key areas, the hotel doesn't live up to the reputation they advertise. I arrived early the first day and knew that my room probably wouldn't be ready. Instead of welcoming me and others at the front desk, we had to stand there a ridiculous amount of time with no acknowledgement from the clerk that we wanted to check in. I've never seen a hotel at this level who did not have individuals ready to personally greet their guests as they waited to check in. That experience at the front desk was horrible, and set the tone for the rest of my stay. Management should recognize how important first impresssions are. I reserved an 80 minute massage at the spa. They were advertising the recent Travel and Leisure #1 ranking that they received, but again, I just don't get it. The facilities were not that elaborate. In fact, when I went to the relaxation area it was extremely messy - obviously others had been there before me and no one had cleaned up behind them. I was very surprised - you would expect pristine conditions. The masseuse did a nice job, but again, the staff at the entrance to the spa was mediocre. They had trouble confirming my appointment and were certainly not very friendly considering the amount of money that I was about to spend with their service. In July I utilized the spa at the Four Seasons in Vail - by comparison, that was a first class facility. Head and shoulders above the Ritz in New Orleans. Service and friendliness are why I choose one hotel over another. This hotel doesn't measure up.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Josh C
Reviews.Content: The Ritz as I came to know it was a great place! A little too upscale for me, but then again I am pretty satisfied with the econolodge as long as the sheets are clean. I was there for four nights and the service was everything you'd expect from a 5 star establishment. The hotel was aesthetically pleasing and seemed to be located at the heart of the French Quarters although it lies on the edge. Bourbon Street is literally right around the corner and there are tons of great restaurants that offer tons of New Orleans style food. Overall, assuming you can afford the rates, I would highly suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and beautiful elegance”
Reviews.Author: Mitchesh
Reviews.Content: Situates on the edge of the french quarter the Ritz Carlton New Orleans is ideally suited for a visit to this wonderful city. Even Katrina was unable to dampen the enthusiasm of the people of New Orleans and with Bourbon street right on your door step its easy to get into the thick of it. On the other hand walk into the hotel and the beauty and elegance takes you to a wonderful relaxing place with great service and a calm relaxing charm.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel with Local Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: TripTex
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with spacious finely appointed rooms well situated on the edge of the French Quarter. I stayed in a "standard room" with a nice work area and a spacious bathroom. The hotel is true to the feel of the French Quarter with a nice courtyard at the lobby level. I only stayed for one evening, therefore, I was unable to experience all the amenities of the property. However, the atmosphere is so nice that the hotel seems to induce a good feeling by merely walking around. I love this place and highly recommend. The hotel personnel are some of the most friendly and service oriented I've ever experienced. This is obviously a well managed property.

Reviews.Title: “I like the consierge floor. Business center a living area atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: wwwlilys
Reviews.Content: The rooms are excellent. I enjoyed the decor and the floor plan. This hotel is pleasant. If you like to drink, they have a lively lounge area and friendly staff. Take a stroll around the premises of the hotel. If you like the night tlife, there is a lot to do outside, and downtown. However, be warned that the downtown area in New Orleans is not a safe at night. The consierge floor is my favorite. Pleasant and comforting business center in a living area setting. Lots of yummy goodies for snacks and drink. Breakfast is a healthy spread of salmon, fruits, vegetables and eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Will return to the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: SUNandSANDLOVER77
Reviews.Content: Two of my girlfriends and I recently stayed at the ritz new Orleans for a couple nights on a girls trip before taking off on a cruise. Upon arrival we were enveloped by the luscious scent of gardenia floating through the air and the staff instantly welcomed us with their Southern hospitality. We came in pretty early on a Friday morning and figured we would drop our luggage off until our room was ready so we could walk around and explore. Much to our delight we found our room was ready and we were quickly and smoothly checked in, before 11am. We were a little worried about the room after reading some other reviews. However, we were pleasantly surprised to find a clean, very spacious and well appointed room with large windows overlooking New Orleans. The bathroom had a separate toilet area which was great for 3 girls! Â The products in the bathroom were not lacking either, they provide q-tips, cotton swabs, makeup remover, mouthwash, shower cap and shower gel, in addition to the typical shampoo, conditioner and lotion. The room did not have a coffee maker. When we called to inquire about this they said it did not come standard in the rooms but that they would be happy to bring one up, complimentary of course! The coffee maker arrived immediately and was delivered in a beautiful wooden box made specially for the coffee maker, these are the details that I would expect from a Ritz, delivered. The staff was phenomenal and treated us very well. The concierge was spot on with dining recommendations which were always fantastic. The lobby and lounging areas were really relaxing and serene and there was plenty of space to find a quiet spot alone or to enjoy a coffee or drink with friends. The only complaint we had was the Internet in the business center which was ridiculously overcharged at around $8 for 15 minutes and a dollar a page to print. The free wireless in the lobby was so slow it was excruciating, and we were never able to hook up to the wifi in our Â room because it just wouldn't work. In addition while we did not receive services at the spa we did check it and the fitness center/pool/hot tub area out. The entire spa and fitness center area was very nice. It had small details one would expect and appreciate such as cold cucumber infused hand towels for refreshment and revitalization as well as calming music. The fitness center was pretty big for a hotel in New Orleans where space is a premium. After our cruise when we returned to New Orleans and had a few hours to kill, they let us keep our bags at the Ritz while we made a last trip to the French quarter. This is the kind of thing that is well above and beyond and will not be forgotten. All three of us agreed that this hotel was well worth the price (which by the way was actually quite reasonable and comparable to much lesser hotels in the area) and if any of us return to New Orleans, we all agreed we would be returning to the Ritz Tip: checkout Bloody Marys Tours for a great time while you are in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Ritz experience”
Reviews.Author: Ticder
Reviews.Content: Wonderful customer service! The club level was wonderful, and very friendly. The rooms were nice, not very roomy, but considering the area we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was within walking distance tO everything, very centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “M bistro was fabulous- Concierge service is terrible.”
Reviews.Author: 288AlwaysOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and, as always, lovely rooms. m bistro is wonderful- hats off to the chef! However, the concierge service is terrible. Multiple calls in prior to our stay with a return call. Finally, when I was able to get someone on the phone, the concierge, Ryan, was rude and seemed irratated. Not what you expect from The Ritz, unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: kitschy
Reviews.Content: As you'd expect, superior customer service -- I had let them know it was my first visit, and they left me a great goodie bag of local foods. Convenient location, great bars (it IS New Orleans...). Nice place to be that feels central but not right on Bourbon in the excitement. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite for Business”
Reviews.Author: kaldonia
Reviews.Content: The New Orleans Ritz-Carlton is my first choice for business travel in The Big Easy. From the second you enter, you are brought back to a time where luxury and comfort ruled. From the bar to the restaurant, every detail is in place. I love jazz and you get as much as you can handle here. Just a short stroll to all the entertainment New Orleans and the French Quarter has to offer, with a room that offers a peaceful respite. The rooms and amenities match any luxury hotel I've ever stayed. The staff pays attention to your needs and are always friendly and helpful. There is way more to the Ritz-Carlton here in New Orleans. Every time I step in, I know that I am going to be productive with everything I need under one roof. The best place to stay in NO.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level Truly Ritzy”
Reviews.Author: TVDad
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Club level of this wonderful hotel between Christmas and New Years, 2010. The Club Level truly is a hotel within a hotel. I highly recommend splurging on the club if you stay here. The hotel is located on the outer edge of the French Quarter. Close enough to walk to everything, yet far enough away so you won't be distracted by noise. The lobby is a flight up from the street level and actually not easy to find. Getting to the club level from the lobby is another hike. The main restaurant was just average, in my mind. We ate lunch there twice and were not impressed either time. Very unusual for a Ritz. Service was slow and a burger was prepared so poorly one time, the staff comped it. Speaking of the staff, all were fantastic and had a "Let's make it special" attitude. We did not drink at the main bar, as the club level has drinks included. The rooms were nice, but smaller than most Ritz Carltons I've stayed at. Now on to the Club/Concierge Level. I cannot say enough about the pampering, service, food, friendship of the staff. It was quite clearly the most wonderful hotel experience of my life. From pouring drinks, to making dinner and tour reservations and offering suggestions for spa treatments, the ladies and gentlemen of the club level rocked our universe. The spa was great, as was the exercise room. You pay a ton to stay in the club level of the Ritz, but it was a HECK of a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Travels84
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Ritz-Carlton New Orleans while in town for a business conference. The service was outstanding. All staff members were very attentive. The room was nice decorated and was very large. Hard wood floors, half-canopied bed, fireplace hearth, flat screen, huge bathtub with separate shower. I had access to the Club Level as well, which included a private concierge, food service throughout the day, computer access, and the area was decorated in a classic French style. Very luxurious. The food provided in the Club Level and during the conference was all very good. The best conference food I have had by far. They did an outstanding job! The location is very convenient as well as it sits right on the edge of the French Quarter. I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Oh wow!”
Reviews.Author: GoEagles323
Reviews.Content: The Ritz was the location of a conference I attended for work. The hotel gave us a great group rate for rooms, so I was excited about my trip. The staff could not be more wonderful or accommodating. I got there early, so my room was not ready. I decided to hang out in the library and catch a football game, since the game was not on in the bar area due to live entertainment. The staff waited on me hand and foot and even brought me lunch in the library. I ordered lunch, dinner and room service once. All of which were very good and delivered much sooner than promised. The food served at the conference was possibly the best conference food I have ever had. I think that I most likely gained 5 pounds during my stay. The room was immaculate and very nicely decorated. The room was also incredibly quite. With a very comfortable bed as well, I can honestly say that I slept very well for being on the road. I did not visit the spa, but did use the health club facilities, which were wonderful as well. I would very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant stay on edge of Quarter”
Reviews.Author: missgrl
Reviews.Content: The RC is beautiful, service is wonderful and the amenities are amazing. Valet service is superquick too, unlike some other French Quarter area hotels. Davenport Lounge is great funand there is lovely terrace seating. It is a luxurious place to stay. It is on the edge of the French Quarter - walking distance to all of downtown, but away from the noisy hustle and bustle if that is a concern of yours. Is it a necessary expense? Maybe not. There are a lot of great hotels in New Orleans. But it certainly is a treat!

Reviews.Title: “You won't want to leave this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Semi-retired1
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this wonderful and beautiful hotel, and it was as great or better the second time around. You can't beat the service, the ambience, or the accomodations. You feel as if you are staying in an elegant old mansion in Europe. The rooms are large and beautifully decorated. Every area of the hotel is lush and comfortable. There is a spa, a restaurant, and a lounge w/live music on the weekends. We also were fortunate to be staying in the "club" level part of the hotel, so we had access to the food and drinks available practically all day, plus the concierge service that was so friendly and helpful. The hotel is right next to the French Quarter and easy walking to Bourbon Street or to Cafe Dumonde. But, it is also a very quiet hotel. I don't know if I could afford to stay here had we not been with a group here for a conference, but I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are coming to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “The reputation speaks for itself”
Reviews.Author: sexyrexy35
Reviews.Content: This was the best time we have ever had. Out Suite was immaculant, well and beautifully appointed. The bathroom was a religious experience. Service was unparralled. Our housekeeper went the extra mile by even placing our dirty laundry into a bag and storing it in a closet! Room ser4vice was fast and delicious! i highly recommend the BBQ burger and the shrimp cocktail. Delivered quickly and with style! Of note, this hotel smells absolutely incredible! They have a signature fragrance and the candles are eveywhere. Fresh flowers also abound and are so beautiful! Can't beat the location, on Canal a block from Bourbon. Close enough to be conveinent, but away enough to be serene. Please go and enjoy all the amenities...Spa, gym, lounge, public areas...are all top-notch. Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Putting on the Ritz.”
Reviews.Author: ctgama
Reviews.Content: Attending a conference so we were able to get an affordable group rate. Never stayed at a Ritz before and I love it. The hotel staff are wonderful the location is close to the center of action but not close enough to bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious accomodations but a few bumps along the road”
Reviews.Author: belleview9480
Reviews.Content: Overall I am very pleased with our trip to the Ritz Carlton New Orleans in August 2011. The hotel is right on Canal Street and in a great location "within" the French Quarter but also very close to the Central Business District. I was about 7.5 months pregnant, so although we booked a room with double beds we asked once we got there if they could put us in a room with a king or even queen bed, which they immediately said was not possible - I would guess it was because we were staying for 5 nights and they didn't want to give up a premium room. They said they were totally booked, but we rarely saw a single person coming out of a hotel room or out of the elevator... so I'm guessing they were not booked. A double bed is tight for two people. The rooms and hotel lobby were gorgeously appointed, and we also really liked the courtyard, though the chairs were very hard to move and were not very comfortable in the courtyard. It also seemed like the place guests went to smoke, there was rarely anyone there who wasn't smoking. The hotel was able to get us into our room early, as we had arrived at around 11 AM and just had to grab some lunch before our room was ready. They asked us if we wanted to switch rooms halfway through our trip, which was awkward--we declined--because they were remodeling in our wing and said it might be noisy. We didn't notice any noise, but we did notice our wing was fairly empty. We did make one complaint about housekeeping, and it was immediately resolved and the housekeeping staff brought a plate of cookies and called to make sure we were satisfied, which was nice. Water was always well stocked in our room and the room itself was well cleaned always. The bathrooms are really gorgeous and comfortable, and there is a separate enclosure for the toilet, which is an amenity I loved. The website says there is no pool, but there is a pool! It is a small pool and it's not for swimming laps or anything, but there is a switch to turn on a resistance wave if you are interested in exercising. However, it would have been nice to know that you can use the pool without the resistance switch turned on if you're just looking to cool off, and there is also a hot tub. Adjoining the pool is a terrific exercise room too! I hadn't stayed at a Ritz Carlton before, and I would say my expectations were partially met. It was a beautiful place, but the service could use a little bit of improvement. That being said, they responded well to the minor complaint we had and I would go back. If there was any lack of excellence it would be in service--they responded great once there was a problem, but the minor problems shouldn't have really existed in the first place... if you're the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “A mess”
Reviews.Author: DeniseRagan
Reviews.Content: Once again we gave the Ritz Carlton a chance BUT it proved that it will never be as impressive at the other RC's we have stayed in. Our stay was one night but we had three different rooms. The third room was given to us at 3 am because we had not air conditioning. It could be a wonderful hotel, it needs to be run like a Ritz Carlton. Does not ccompare to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: floatyourboatToronto
Reviews.Content: Very nice facility - the room was gorgeous, as was the center courtyard and main lobby. The concierge and doorman were a great help too. Bourban was just around the corner and we could walk or catch the streetcar very easily from here. We were a group of 18 and the organizer got a great rate making our stay an amazing value...I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. We had lunch at Deannies kitty corner to the hotel and it was a great value... We also enjoyed the Ruby Slipper for breakfast (On Magazine St. just off Canal), a nice alternative to the IHOP down the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Worthy Experience”
Reviews.Author: finestdiner
Reviews.Content: We usually stay down closer into the quarter, so when our usual place was booked we initially were put off by the extra few blocks we had to walk when staying here. However, the room was superb, the view was even better, and the staff lived up to the ritz standard. I had been to restaurant before and found it mediocre. This last visit though was excellent. Pricey, but very well done and the jazz lounge afterward is a must see. Very enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “So Good, So Elegant!”
Reviews.Author: Family_Travel_Guy_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic, 20 people for my wifes birthday and NO problems. Staff was the friendliest that I have ever seen. Courtyard for drinks and snacks great! Rooms, elegant and spacious and all within walking distance to everything! Rooms just renovated and like new. Stay here for sure! Special thanks for Courtney for her help!

Reviews.Title: “omg difficult to go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: mailehudson
Reviews.Content: stayed in club level lounge for 3 days had an absolute amazing service experience with these folks. Brought back cooler loaded with food from home and they even kept it in their freezer for us till we left. They knew us by name from the minute we pulled up, the lounge is loaded with food and snacks all day and dessert till 11 pm and all beverages and alcohol included in room stay. It was difficult to leave this hotel to see the surroundings. The decor so french and fabulous and rich culture. The Club Level Lounge is so special I would recommend paying the little extra to stay there. The concierge was enormously helpful and was peaceful atmosphere! Do it! No regrets!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: ejlindah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to N.O. for my birthday. We booked 2 rooms with a 3rd party carrier. We canceled one of the rooms when our friends couldn't make it. When we arrived, we were told that both rooms had been canceled. When I explained that I had only canceled one room, the hotel not only honored our reservation, it upgraded us to a junior suite with a balcony overlooking the quarter! This set the tone for a fantastic stay. We will definitely be back and I applaud the Ritz for such outstanding customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great bar with great service!”
Reviews.Author: stonesmith55
Reviews.Content: We traveled to New Orleans with another couple early this month. We didn't stay at the Ritz, but we did visit the bar on the afternoon of the 7th. The bar has a warm atmosphere and great drinks and munchies. I wanted to be sure and note the excellent service of our waitress, Jeanne-Marie and our bartender, Walter. They were both extremely friendly and knowledgable and made sure we were well taken care of. We'll definitely consider staying at the Ritz next time!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Club Level!”
Reviews.Author: gdelson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a terrific vacation in N.O. The upgrade to the Club Level was well worth the price, as we received outstanding customer service! We enjoyed the "free" breakfasts and snacks, and received excellent advice from the concierges on restaurants and local attractions. We particularly enjoyed the jazz clubs on Frenchmen Street. My only critique of the hotel is that there was not a regular-sized pool (just a small resistance pool), that would have been refreshing in light of the hot temperatures. Nonetheless, we had a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Words cannot begin to explain...”
Reviews.Author: aarrtt
Reviews.Content: ...our fantastic 6th wedding anniversary stay here. My husband and I came to NOLA to celebrate another year of putting up with each other. I initially booked the Royal Sonesta but when I thought I'd be doing a solo trip I changed my plans to the Ritz. Best decision I could have made. I did not like Bourbon St. and would not have liked staying in that area in the least. I booked a regular room at the AAA rate but when we early-checked in were told we'd gotten a free upgrade to the Executive Suite. SERIOUSLY?? This was too good to be true! The room was not quite ready so we left for lunch. The whole time I'm thinking is the ES really a full-fledged suite? I had my doubts all through lunch thinking this is too good to be true. We returned to the hotel an hour later at 1 p.m. and the rooms were ready. I confirmed that we'd be getting a suite at the regular room rate. It was confirmed. We opened the door to the suite and we almost fell out. How BEAUTIFUL! There's an entrance way. Off the entrance is a half bath. Then you walk into this huge living room with a huge picture window looking right down on Canal St. Connected by French doors was the huge bedroom and connected to that was the spacious bathroom with a glass enclosed shower, a second shower & deep bath tub, 2 vanity sinks and a separate room for the commode with a phone on the wall, and all of this enclosed in marble. I still could not believe our luck so while in the commode room I called the front desk and confirmed that I would pay the rate for the regular room. Once I got this third confirmation the celebration was on. The suite has 2 flat screens, mini bar, desk, chaise lounge, sofa and wing chairs, coffee pot w/accessories and an amazing gardenia fresh scent. Spotlessly clean with turndown service and towel changes twice daily. The bed was heavenly with big fluffy pillows. I requested feather pillows. Once we came into the room and the ice bucket had been filled for us after we'd been partying. I always looked forward to returning to the hotel where we were greeted by wonderful gardenia scented candles in the foyer. I had to buy one for the house in their signature store. The public rooms are all exquisite with antique furnishings and there are many public rooms throughout the first and third floors. The courtyard is very cozy with a fountain, all types of seating/tables, gazebo and lush vegetation all around. We went into Davenport Lounge one evening after being disappointed with Sweet Lorraineâ€™s Jazz Club. This band really helped to lift my spirits and put me back into a good mood. Plus we only had to go upstairs and we were in our room. I wish I would have saved my money from the disappointing entertainment, and outrageous cover of Sweet Lorraine's and taxi fare to and from this venue and just enjoyed the comfort of the Davenport Lounge and the band that evening. The doormen were the greatest! Hello to Terrance and the young man who bought our vehicle to us every day (sorry I forgot your name). They always had a smile on their faces and were so willing to help with directions, bringing us bottled water and conversing with us. I utilized the fitness room once and we wanted to get into the resistance pool but it was too cold and cloudy and the whirlpool was being occupied at the time. The fitness room always had a full bowl of fruit for the taking and the treadmill have their own personal TV w/satellite channels to take the mind off of the task at hand. The swimming pool gets only 2 marks b/c it's really not for swimming and it was too cloudy. Just for relaxing. They should have a bigger pool area somewhere on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Wknd ever..”
Reviews.Author: Antony T
Reviews.Content: The staff at this property, from the front desk, to the valet service, to the housekeeping team, were all wonderful. After enduring the nightmare of airline delays and the prospective of spending my birthday weekend without my girlfriend (who had been re-routed to chicago), alone at the RC, Mr. Ben, the front office manager truly made what was left of our weekend carefree, enjoyable, and ultimately a trip to New Orleans that we will never forget. Great location, well appointed and did i mention the fact that the staff worked cohesively as a team, to make us feel genuinely at home throughout our trip to NOLA. They've even got their own lounge complete with the Mr. Jeremy Davenport, not to mention one of the most beautiful spa's in the nation, you couple all of this with warmth and personal attention provided by the staff here and it'd be hard to imagine ever wanting to stay anywhere else while visiting the big easy.. ps. if you need a drink i'd recommend a makers a ginger :-)

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton New Orleans-Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Valerie77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in Febraury 2011 for a conference. I was very disappointed. First, on every instance I interacted with the staff, they called me Ms. Jones, rather than Dr. Jones. I thought the staff at the Ritz would be a little more attentive to detail. The hotel was large and beautifully decorated, and well located. There were these candles in the lobby area with what I guessed to be their signature scent, which were pleasant at first, then seemed to become too cloying. The room was average in size, it was fine, nicely decorated. Bed and pillows were great. When I first arrived at the room, there was this housekeeper there who was bringing in a mini refirgerator. I am not sure why. She plugged it in next to the bed and I found the whole scene to be very curious. I had to wait for her to finish before I could come into the room and put my things down, as she was in the way. On the morning after the first night, I had gotten up very early to attend a conference....and the hairdryer was not working. I called housekeeping to request another hairdryer. Fifteen minutes later I called housekeeping again. I had to leave to catch the shuttle to the conference, WITH A WET HEAD. I stopped at the front desk to point this out, and they just gave excuses (We were looking for an empty room that had another haridryer, Ms. Jones). Since I had to get up very early and leave by 6:30 every morning, I placed the completed breakfast menu card outside my door in the evenings. Every single day, the menu card was not replaced, so I had to stop by the front desk and ask for one. Every day. Stupid. Since this was a business trip, I really just wanted a nice place to stay and did not expect to have to ask for this and that repeatedly. I noticed a long hair in the bathtub, which could have been mine. It was there for three days, which means that they did not clean the bathtub daily. To top it all off, I have a milk allergy. I advised the front desk of this when I checked in, and wrote it on the breakfast menu card every time. On my last morning, room service called me at the time the breakfast should have been delivered to tell me that they make their oatmeal with milk, Ms. Jones. This was the third time that week that I had had the oatmeal. Apparently it did not cross their minds on this occasion, to make a bowl of oatmeal with water instead of milk. Absolutely stupid. And I had to wait for the breakfast, which was now late, and hardly got to eat it as I had to be out of the room and catch my shuttle to the conference. The atmosphere was very relaxed, almost too relaxed (maybe it is a New Orleans thing). At one point I was passing through the lobby and the people behind the front desk were joking around, almost knee-slapping. I must say that they did refund one nights' stay after I complained on check out. I really would have preferred to have had better service as I was willing and planning to pay for the full week. My conference was very intense and I wished that I did not have to contact housekeeping and the front of the house so much (would rather not at all, really). I had had dinner one night at one of the nearby W hotels, and I felt more welcomed there than at this hotel. This was my first stay at a Ritz-Carlton, and I am not sure I would stay at another one of this chain's hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay for Business”
Reviews.Author: WillPwr
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying at the Ritz-Carlton New Orleans. This was my first time staying at this hotel. It is really clean and the rooms are very spacious. The beds and pillows were very comfortable as well. Every day I asked house keeping for additional lotion and soap and they politely fulfilled my request. The hotel is right off of Canal and two blocks from Bourbon St. If you like luxury hotels instead of Loews are the W next time opts for the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Truly great experience”
Reviews.Author: annar76
Reviews.Content: My husband was on a business trip and I tagged along. First time in New Orleans for me. Second time for him. Loved the Ritz-Carlton. Convenient to so many great activities. Our room was nicely appointed. Housekeeping was great. Very quiet within our room. Concierge was awesome at arranging tours, dinner reservations, etc. Best service ever!! Did a great deal of our meals off-site, but had breakfast and one dinner at the Ritz and both meals were very good. Stayed 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my fiance this spring. It was my first time in NOLA and I plan to return and would stay here again. Having stayed at the Ritz in Grand Cayman we found this Ritz to be not quite as luxurious, but it was still a higher end hotel with comfortable rooms and good service. The location on Canal Street is blocks from the French Quarter and a quick cab ride to the Warehouse District, Frenchman Street, and other areas for nightlife. We enjoyed the snacks and drinks in the bar which is packed with people enjoying live music on Saturdays.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Leisha M
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I recently had a weekend get-together and met in New Orleans. We stayed at the Ritz Carlton on the Club level and I HIGHLY recommend this. Our room was fantastic. The service and personnel were top notch. The Club level was worth every extra cent. We hung out in the Club level lounge area having the free wine and nibbles and enjoyed every minute of it. We also ate at Fins, Emeril's and Galatoire's - each of which I would highly recommend as well. We were able to get a good discount through AAA at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans...a trashy dump. But this hotel....WOW - Simply spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: GregorySeven
Reviews.Content: Although we found New Orleans to be a dirty, smelly, and tawdry bar-crawl kind of town which probably lost it's authentic Cajun character decades ago, we did love this incredible hotel. Although the property was full because of the Essence Music Festival, the spectacular rooms, restaurants, and staff was outstanding in every way. It's the small luxuries that stand out, and the delicious ice-cold lemonade in the lobby every afternoon is the tip of the Ritz-Carlton iceberg Simply said - you can't do better anywhere else in New Orleans provided your budget is highly expandable.

Reviews.Title: “Davenport lounge is not to be missed!”
Reviews.Author: mudpuppy_17
Reviews.Content: Sure, you'll spend a small fortune on drinks here, but Jeremy Davenport and his band are not to be missed. An evening here is like traveling back in time to the era of cool kat lounges and jazz at its best. Amazing music, fun dancing, and a truly sublime atmosphere make this a place we will hit every time we're back in the city.

Reviews.Title: “This Palacial Treat Is Probably One Of New Orleans' Best”
Reviews.Author: malioil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is grand in scope, with a grand loby, and French Louis XVII styling across the board. It takes that classic Lousiana just on a greater scale. The room I had was one of the larger ones, with two king beds, and it was very quite, comfortable, the bathroom being the size of most Manhatten hotel rooms, solid marble, a seperate shower, oversized bathtub, and another room within the bathroom with the WC, as is common with most Ritz-Carltons. Service was very friendly and outgoing, the New Orleans standard, if slightily disorganized and unpolished. The staff where very accomodating and willing throughout, yet I didn't give this hotel a five star rating simply because the service across the board, from the bistro, housekeeping, frontdesk all the way to the bellman always was faulty- the staff would accidently make mistakes (which is ofcourse fine) then genuinlly apologize for it. Yet so many mistakes, in a property of this scale shoudln't be so common. This hotel ticked all the boxes that a five star property, esspically a Ritz should- abliet the experience didn't go beyond the call of duty, and although not a requirement, at the rates one would be paying to stay at this property, it is required to make a place really shine. I however, would full heartdly reccomend this hotel, and would stay here again. The location is brilliant, a penny drop from Bourbon St. and all the action, yet the place it occupies on Canal St. is a lot quiter, making for a much more refined atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: EatPrayLoveLady
Reviews.Content: Stayed over New Year's Eve for my birthday & had great service. They even delivered birthday balloons to our room & we never mentioned it was my birthday but THEY KNOW! It's a bit difficult to find the lobby with it being on the 2nd floor & should be marked better. Had a wonderful pedi/mani at the spa. Very convenient to Bourbon Street & the trolley. For a girls' weekend, it was worth the extra $$$ to book the giant room we had with 2 king beds (comfort!) each with it's own TV, a giant bath with 2 sinks, large tub & huge walkin shower & walkin closet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cianadoll
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is beautiful, yet traditional. And the staff handled the influx of guests for the music festival really well. Everyone was hospitable. And the rooms and common areas were very nice. The location of the hotel couldn't be more perfect. It is a mere block from Bourbon Street and half way to the Convention Center and the SuperDome where the music festival events were held. Both a good walk. The late night food sold in the lobby left a lot to be desired. However, the breakfast buffet at M Bistro more than made up for it. It was delicious. So much so, I'd return for breakfast even if I were not staying in the hotel. However, having gone to New Orleans a couple of times already and stayed in other hotels, it's safe to say I will be returning to the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “The quietest room ever!”
Reviews.Author: ducs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Room 751 for three nights the last week of July 2011. I requested a quiet room and this was the quietest room I have ever had in any hotel. It was all the way down a hallway, then you turned right and there was a little alcove with this room and one other room as the only two rooms down that little hallway. The best part was there was a door to that little hallway and, when I went to sleep, I would close that exterior door. I slept until 10 am one day as you could not even hear the housekeeping staff with that door closed. The other room in the alcove was occupied at least one night as I noticed a privacy sign on their door, but I never heard a peep from that room. Room 751 also had a great view of the Mississippi, which was a bonus for me. A very spacious room as well. I would highly recommend requesting this room. I paid only $119 per night, but it was the low season. Housekeeping staff was exceptional at this hotel; bringing ice, chocolates, and extra bottles of water all for free, along with keeping the room spotlessly clean. Some minor downsides to this facility: saw a cockroach in the atrium on two different occasions; no slippers; no coffee in the room and they charge $12 for two cups of coffee from room service; and two different elevators in two different locations to get out to the street or to the motor court. A major upside to this hotel though was the friendly and helpful staff encountered throughout the facility. Order the beignets with chocolate, caramel, and vanilla dipping sauces for breakfast even though they are on the desert menu. So many beignets, I ate three for breakfast and saved the other three for desert that evening. Room service was fast and seafood alfredo ordered for dinner one night was delicious, huge, and hot on arrival. One of the best hotel stays ever and I stay in hotels extensively for business.

Reviews.Title: “What More Can I Say About the Ritz?”
Reviews.Author: bluedesert
Reviews.Content: I don't get the opportunity to stay at very many luxury hotels, but while making a stop in New Orleans on a cross-country, I had to splurge on the Ritz. What a great choice! The service couldn't be better, the property was well appointed (as you would expect at a Ritz Carlton), and the room was very comfortable, spacious, and quiet. Having only spent one night in town, it was in the perfect location to walk to all the sights and it was a refreshing refuge after the craziness of Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise. Beautiful Classic New Orleans hotel.”
Reviews.Author: samjust08
Reviews.Content: I've Visited New Orleans more times than I can count. But as with most tourists I usually stayed in the heart of the French Quarter. This time traveling with a younger child we elected to stay just outside the quarter on Canal and chose the Ritz Carlton. The rates were exceptional for a property like that, and the rooms were large, comfortable, clean and well appointed. The staff was top notch and though parking was pricy, overall the cost of staying there was cheaper than other properties we have stayed at in the Quarter, and much nicer. We were a short walk from the heart of the quarter (Bourbon St and Royal St) yet far enough away that we didn't get the late night party noise either. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Be a tourist in your on town”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGent77
Reviews.Content: What a way to spend a graduation and birthday! Top notch staff, clean rooms and close enough to all that New Orleans has to offer. I mean, it's the Ritz, so what would one expect! SG77

Reviews.Title: “The reason we keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: kathyhouston
Reviews.Content: Arrived early on Thursday for a 3 day stay. As always, a very gracious welcome at the front desk. In fact, Ellie remembered me from my last stay and introduced me to everyone at the desk. Room wasn't ready (11:00 am) so they took my cell number so they could call when it was ready for check-in. They called within 30 minutes and we were able to complete lunch and return to the hotel. I had requested my favorite room and they had blocked it for me. I had received an email from the Concierge service earlier in the week asking if there was anything they could do in advance of my arrival. I provided the room number and asked if there was anything they could do about securing it for me. Apparently that helped - what a great way to take care of thinks ahead of time. Room, as always, was super clean and fresh. I have never had a bad night's sleep in this hotel as the new windows installed some time ago have cut out all street noise. Even though the hotel was close to 100% occupancy, it never felt crowded, loud or unruly.
