Apparently there was a conference checking out and another checking in but the staff handled everything smoothly. The value for the room rate is outstanding. Top quality surroundings, informed staff, great bed and lots of pillows. When you visit any of the other hotels on Canal Street and compare, hands down, Ritz-Carlton is in a totally different league.

Reviews.Title: “Great time with our 7 yr old”
Reviews.Author: cartyco
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at the Ritz in New Orleans. This is the first time we stayed with our 7 yr old daughter. We decided to get a one bedroom suite since we had a baby sitter coming one night and thought it would be more comfortable to rent a movie or whatever. It was perfect. There were one and 1/2 baths so the sitter never had to come in to the main bedroom, except to put our D to bed. The Ritz suggested the sitter service, Dependable Kid Care, and they were great! The lady was older, having worked for the company for many years and our daughter loved her! She brought games to play and was really sweet and we felt extremely comfortable leaving our child with her. When you call and request anything, towels, room service, help with anything, you are taken care of immediately. One afternoon someone from housekeeping brought us towels and when she met our daughter, she came back with a plate full of wonderful cookies and fruit! The mac and cheese from Room service is to die for, pizza not good! I have reviewed how wonderful this hotel is for adults, happy to say great with kids too!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!!!”
Reviews.Author: StephieGYA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel while coming to attend a Saints game!!! Great location and we were able just to walk to stadium from there!!! Very clean, staff was great, huge rooms/bathrooms, and very good location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: baltimorefamily4
Reviews.Content: Two night business trip to New Orleans. Super comfortable room and bath. Perfect and relaxing. Conceirge was great. French quarter within walking distance as was business district. Definitely five star!

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Edgewater3
Reviews.Content: The hotel was Beautiful!! THe rooms were lovely and spacious! bathrooms huge and gorgeous!! Def. stay in conceirge floor - Utterly amazing!!! Hotel location was in the heart of everything - and staff was so nice and friendly!

Reviews.Title: “5th stay and looking forward to my 6th!”
Reviews.Author: KGBBatonRouge
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton New Orleans is a completely refreshing hotel. Every year I visit the Ritz Carlton New Orleans to attend a business banking conference. This hotel is such a beautiful and charming escape from the hustle and bustle of the New Orleans streets. The Ritz Carlton New Orleans is always clean and decorated very tasteful. The fresh flowers that are all over the hotel give it a very fresh appearance. The staff at this hotel always go the extra mile and if you have any issues they not only fix the issue they always have a manager follow up with you to make sure you are satisfied with how it issue was handled.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: imeldamks
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, but not what I was expecting from the Ritz. I've stayed at nicer hotels that cost far less. The chair in our room was torn and the hotel was a little bare. Also, there was no pool. I was very disappointed in that. All in all, it was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, housekeeping and even chocolates at bedtime :)”
Reviews.Author: eatsleeptour
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the weekend at the Ritz-Carlton and were very pleased. The maid was outstanding, cleaning our room twice a day! She even turned down the bed, put soft music on the TV and left chocolates on our nightstand. Service at the front desk was very professional and friendly. Doorman was great at getting taxis and holding the door and holding umbrella over us during the rain. Room even included an umbrella which was a really nice touch! We also enjoyed the jazz band in the club downstairs. Decor in hotel is a bit "dated", but classic. No pool, which was disappointing. Nice bedding and quiet A/C...some street noise from the 5th floor, but it is New Orleans?!?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice low end Ritz Carlton hotel”
Reviews.Author: pattayainsider
Reviews.Content: Great location, very friendly staff throughout. Suprisingly, only a little bit more expensive than very ordinary nearby hotels, so i would call it a good value. No outdoor swimming pool, but one indoors in the health club. Room was very nice, great bedding, but lots of party people in the hallways at night, but I guess that's just New Orleans. Room was spacious, and they have staff in front to help hotel guests get taxis. Lots of 24 hour restaurants, drugstores etc. in immediate area. One short block to Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Louisiana charm at it's best”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTed
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews prior to booking and was a little concerned... too much "slow or absent service".... in the reviews. The room rate was pretty good and the upcharge for Club Level was certainly fair so that is where we stayed. Fingers crossed! For one, remember you are in the South. People in general do move and talk a little bit slower. That doesn't mean they are dumb - it just means they might not jump at attention and run for your request. However, as we found with the Ritz employees, they help you make your trip very enjoyable with great tidbits of local information that will make your trip special. A group of physicians from New Jersey probably didn't have as much fun there...they were too busy running their mouths and running the club level staffers around in circles. Have you seen Jersey Shore? Imagine 20 physicians and their wives. That was a side show....but the club level staffers were very gracious to them. Amazing restraint!! The hotel is very nice too - everything is updated and very comfortable. My only complaint is that you have a lot of walking around to get from one side of the hotel to the club level - no just going down the hall - like other club levels. Location - perfect for the french quarter. Not too close. Not too far. Bellmen - awesome, helpful and accomodating. I will never stay anywhere else when travelling to NOLA

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top Again”
Reviews.Author: dlively
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in a non-suite room, did have club level access. Room was very nice for my wife and I, plenty of space and nice view. The Club lounge is the Best I have seen at any property, the staff are of course exceptional. The property in a great location in town and offers a great spa. The property is a conversion, so there are a lot of step up/downs and elevators to get around. Will return

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: julibean8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king suite with club level access and it was absolutely fantastic. Rooms were well decorated and very clean-loved having a bath and a half. Club level lounge was also amazing-delicious snacks offered throughout the day, champagne from noon on, and the most beautiful furnishings. Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. Location was also great. Just a block and a half off of Bourbon-we felt safe walking back to the hotel, even at night. Just excellent all around!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: 1middleclassfamily
Reviews.Content: When staying at the Ritz there is no comparison, except other Ritz hotels. The customer service is second to none. The location is excellent, right around the corner from Bourbon Street. The staff was great, the Spa was nice and the gym was good too. Our room was spacious and what you would expect from the Ritz. I would suggest to get a room with a view of the atrium. We stayed on a Friday night and the hotel had a great Jazz musician playing. Weâ€™ll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome respite”
Reviews.Author: Nuts4TravelSeattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Memorial Day weekend. The location is great and is an easy walk to the sites in the French Quarter. The room was immaculate as were the common areas. There was great jazz in the lounge. Overall, it was a lovely hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: tdplano
Reviews.Content: Great location and comparable prices to other upscale hotels in the area....we stay here every year because it's just off Bourbon but far enough for it not to be noisy. We heard great things about Royal Sonesta, but apparently you have to stay more than 3 nights and we didn't have that long to stays we opte for old faithful Ritz and it was just as great as the 3 years prior! Next we'll be staying at the Ritz Grand Cayman again for the location and the consistency!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, if you can get in the room”
Reviews.Author: MNtravelman
Reviews.Content: I normally go out of my way to stay at a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons and on a recent trip to New Orleans stayed at the Ritz Carlton on Canal Street. It's a wonderful place with the service you would come to expect from Ritz Carlton. The room was very nice, the health club is an excellent facility, and of course the staff is very accommodating. The one complaint I had was with the key card system used to access the room. We repeatedly had problems with the card entry system and had to go to the lobby twice to get new cards, which then only worked after multiple attempts to enter the room. Other than that small inconvenience, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: RalphYoung
Reviews.Content: Congratulations to the Ritz Carlton. We've stayed several time but this was our first post-katrina. I've had some issues in the past but they were all addressed this visit. First, front desk staffing was both plentiful and helpful. Never a wait and they were quick with solutions. The room was top-notch and everything was exceptional. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “perfect in aranging conference meals”
Reviews.Author: cosmopolitan19
Reviews.Content: I was ver impressed about the conference dinner for the IEEE conference on evolutionary computation in June 2011. As a vegetarian, they cared for me with providing special food. Also, serving food was "calabrated" in a manner like a "military" reception of high ranked diplomates. The room was perfect as well, as it could be expectable by Ritz-Carlon hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: nakslomo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days 6/2 to 6/4. I was given an corner room facing canal and dauphine streets. The views were great. The service couldn't have been better. Everyone is always smiling and making sure you have a great stay. The location is awesome as its walking distance to most popular places in the French quarter.

Reviews.Title: “the most amazing stay ever”
Reviews.Author: SusieC3333
Reviews.Content: my girlfriends and I experienced the most amazing hospitality by the staff at the Ritz Carlton, New Orleans. We opted for the club level and and it was the most incredible service and food/drink quality. We were celebrating my birthday and when staff discovered that, I was showered with gifts and balloons and so were my friends. The ambiance was gorgeous French Antique and when I get the chance to return to NOLA I will book the Ritz again in a heartbeat...actually can't wait to take my husband next time I go back...maybe a bring a bunch of couples this time!!!...Southern Hospitality at the Rtiz was beyond belief!

Reviews.Title: “Our new Favorite!”
Reviews.Author: kysma03
Reviews.Content: Literally just checked out of the RCNO this morning after a weekend long getaways with my husband. Though we didn't take the time to experience all of the things offered by the hotel (ie spa, gym, pool,etc) i must say our experience was fabulous. We got a terrific deal through getaroom.com. After reading some reviews about getaroom.com I was a little hesitant that either something would fall through or we'd be left in one of the less desirable rooms but this was not the case. The check in process was quick, easy and the employee checking us in was absolutely delightful. The elevator situation does take some getting used but no biggie. Davenports was great on Saturday night and I must say the Valet guys are AWESOME! very nice! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Ritz in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: JulieW1231
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent Memorial day weekend at the Ritz and were so pleased with everything about the hotel and the staff. The location was perfect, you weren't right in the middle of the crowds of the French Quarter but still close to everything. We were upgraded to the club level, our room was tucked away and very quiet. The club level lounge was beautiful with a great selection of food and drinks available most of the day and evening. The staff was superb, what you would expect from a Ritz. My husband and I have stayed at several Ritz's across the country, and this Ritz lived up to all our expectations and even went beyond. They checked us in early at Noon (which we never expected). We had a wonderful waitress at M bistro named Pinky who brought me a blanket when she saw me rubbing my shoulders from being cold! It just doesn't get any better then that. Thank you to everyone at the Ritz who made our first trip to New Orleans an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally friendly service”
Reviews.Author: TouringLawyer
Reviews.Content: We spent the Memorial Day weekend on NO taking advantage of a bar association discount rate at the Ritz-Carlton. Our standard room was comfortable with a large bathroom and the usual amenities. The front desk staff, bellmen, hosts and servers in Bistro M were exceptionally friendly (something we haven't always found at other Ritz-Cartlon properties). Sunday brunch at Bistro M was very good--noted trumpeter Jeremy Davenport plays in the lounge. Be aware that the lounge has very limited seating and much of it is obstructed by pillars--not the best venue although you can hear the music. The hotel has a handy rear exit into the French Quarter allowing guests to avoid the crowds on canal Street. For a large hotel, it seemed surprisingly intimate. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to enjoy the city,top notch staff”
Reviews.Author: J2PTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: We've recently enjoyed a stay at the Ritz Carlton on Canal st. The staff and the property were amazing. Karen the Concierge was most helpful. Also the staff and the food at M Bistro were great. Must mention Jason at the bar, he hand wrote 5-6 attactions and restaurants in the area that my wife and I could enjoy. Will return on our next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Manager Saved the Day”
Reviews.Author: mventura6
Reviews.Content: I went to New Orleans to celebrate my 40th birthday with a four day trip with my sister. We checked into the hotel and stayed in a beautiful king double suite. I had a spa appointment scheduled for the next day a month in advance. I called that morning to confirm and was told the computers were down for the past two days and they couldn't confirm the time or type of service. I gave them our appointment time and type of service. We checked in at the spa and waited. After a half an hour we asked about out appointment. We waited another half hour before being seen. Turns out after waiting an hour, my sister didn't even get the special massage I booked for both of us. I let the spa manager Crystal know what happened and she took care of it well beyond what I expected. She didn't charge us for the service, which I never expected. I said I would tip the staff, she said she would take care of it. She offered me a gift from the Spa and suggested a spa robe. During the conversation, she asked what our dinner plans were. I told her we were eating at Mr. B's that night. When we got to the restaurant, there were birthday balloons and our first round of drinks were on the Ritz. When we got back to the room there was the best red velvet cake personalized with a happy birthday message to me. I am a manager in the customer service industry and what Crystal did was well above and beyond my expectations. I will always be impressed by how she handled the situation. I've stayed at many Ritz Carlton's across the country and will continue because of the customer service I received.

Reviews.Title: “If you have stayed at a Ritz before, you are going to notice this is not up to par..”
Reviews.Author: guess2
Reviews.Content: After having stayed at several other Ritz properties, I chose this hotel based on my past experience with their customer service. While the property is very nice, the level of customer service is simply lacking in comparison with other Ritz locations. If you have not stayed at a Ritz before, perhaps it would not be noticeable. We booked a club level double room (travelling with friend), and upon arriving in our room we discovered it smelled strongly of cigarette smoke although this is supposed to be a non-smoking property. We called to front desk and asked to be moved to any other room in hotel, club floor or not and gentleman said he would "talk to someone" and call back. 20 minutes later and no phone call so we haul our luggage down to front desk. Fortunately the girl who checked us in immediately resolved the problem and moved us to another level. The club lounge had a nice display of food and wine and champagne for self service, while beer and cocktails were to be ordered and served. One time in our 5 day stay did anyone manning that lounge ever ask us if we would like to order a drink. One time I walked up to an attendant and asked her if I could order a drink and she said sure but was in middle of setting up dessert. When she finished, even though we were sitting 10 feet away, she never came and took our drink order. Not quite satisfied that the money we spent on club level was worth the frustration. When checking our luggage on last day, bell man did not even say thank you when tipped. Our room (king deluxe) was huge and very nice. In any case, I will not stay here on my next visit. I plan to try one of the boutique hotels instead.

Reviews.Title: “Kids Not Allowed in Pool”
Reviews.Author: jooltman
Reviews.Content: Our otherwise stellar stay at the Ritz was basically devastated by their anti-child pool policy. When I booked the room through their 800 number, the reservationist mentioned that there was an indoor pool. (She failed to mention that it is the size of a whirlpool.) Undaunted, my family planned to enjoy it our first (hot!) afternoon in New Orleans, only to be told by the spa staff that children are not allowed except for at the crack of dawn and after their bedtime. I will leave it to your imagination to picture the tears of injustice spilled by our two young boys, and the subsequent unpleasant days trudging a half mile up and down Canal Street (which was blistering hot, home to many unsavory street people, and smells of human waste) to an inferior hotel to use their pool -- a place where we had no facilities and no services. All to please the children and ruin our vacation in the meantime! This was certainly not what we had in mind when we booked at the Ritz, and we do truly resent being made to feel like second class guests just because we were traveling with our children -- especially since their company goes out of its way to make it appear that their properties are family-friendly. I notice that even after expressing my displeasure to the staff member in question, she clearly did not communicate this to the manager, because there is still no indication on the Ritz Web site that the pool is off-limits to children. It is so obvious that families plan their vacations, especially in warm climates, around pool access. It was all terribly disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Just another hotel...”
Reviews.Author: happycamperNewYork
Reviews.Content: The room was lovely and the property was clean but that should be the norm, not the exception. Maybe if I had stayed longer I would have discovered the property's charms but it seemed like any other mid-market hotel catering to conventions and groups.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, oasis next to the bustle of the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: GinaInNYC
Reviews.Content: After reading many mixed reviews of it online, I did not know what to expect of the RC NO. I had a terrific stay - great location just outside of the heart of the quarter - next to the streetcar lines. Service was more relaxed than what I've seen at other Ritz properties, but still very attentive and helpful. The Spa is fantastic and a great value - don't miss it. My room was clean and quiet - bed was fantastic. Pretty courtyard and library space are both great areas to read the paper in a welcoming,quiet environment. I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay for Mardi Gras!”
Reviews.Author: Vnyrdr
Reviews.Content: Second visit to this property, although the first was back when what is now the club floors was called the Maison House. The location is perfect for mardi gras, as you can walk right out the front door and watch all the parades pass. Because of this, security is very tight, with guards checking to be sure you have a Ritz Carlton wristband on in order to enter; my wife forgot hers once and she couldn't get back in until I came to 'claim' her! The club floor rooms are very elegant, with dark hardwood floors and fireplaces, although they are not very large. The club lounge itself was magnificent, with an omelet chef in addition to the usual RC breakfast fare, a dedicated bartender in the afternoon and evening, and more impressive appetizers than the usual RC lounge; numerous hot items in addition to the usual cold items. The staff was very friendly and attentive. Overall another great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaFreeze
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff and a nice location make this a perfect spot for your business trip to NOLA. Excellent fitness center but it is not open 24 hours. WiFi was very expensive so I didn't use it. Nice nightly turn down with water and chocolate. The staff was great. Always saying hello and offering assistance. Housekeeping was great. I am not sure why the ratings are so low. I went into a few other hotels and they were quite awful. I think the Ritz Carlton was excellent. It was not the nicest Ritz-Carlton I have every visited but for NOLA it should be 2 or 3. Then again, I think Windsor Court should be number 1. Spa was A+. Separate locker room for men with dry sauna, steam room, and a fully stocked grooming area with razors and such.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the Ritz-Carlton brand we've come to know.”
Reviews.Author: kminohio
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many Ritz-Carltons and appreciate their attention to detail and impeccable service. This one simply doesn't measure up. Even getting ice to the room was a chore for this place. And absolutely DO NOT pay for the club level service! We arrived at the Club Room at 10:05 on a Friday night, just as the recorded music was being turned off? We asked that the music be left on while we enjoyed our cocktail and were tod to read the guest pamphlet. Honest to God...."read the guest pamphlet" so we'd understand why the MUSAK had to be turned off at 10:00. We went downstairs to pay for our drinks at the lobby bar only to learn a third of the bar had been rented out to a private party and sitting down was not an option...for over an hour! Seriously, stay elsewhere, people! This place is not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: SolarT
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to Mardi Gras at the last minute and found out that hotels near the French Quarter were fully booked. To my surprise I found a room at the Ritz Carlton for $260/night. It is located on Canal St at the Northwestern edge of the French Quarter. A great location to watch the Uptown parades and stumble back from the Quarter after too many Hand Grenades or Hurricanes. It is only the second time I stayed at a Ritz Carlton, so I cannot compare to others but I was happy. The rooms and facilities were very nice and the service was excellent. In fact, I made a strategic rookie Mardi Gras mistake and book a 7pm flight back home on Mardi Gras Tuesday. The problem, Canel St is shutdown for parades and all the French Quarter roads are closed during Mardi Gras. So traffic is a nightmare and no taxis want to venture in this area. I was extremely fortunate to meet one of the hotel managers in the elevator and mentioned my dilema of having a problem getting a taxi and will probably miss my flight. He told one of the doormen my dilema and asked him to take my luggage and help me find a taxi. The doorman (I wish I could remember his name) took my bag and we walked about six blocks before finding an open taxi. I was very lucky because a lot of people were trying to catch a taxi. I would stay at the Rtiz NOLA again:-)

Reviews.Title: “One of the few clean things about New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: FastidiousZoe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and the rooms are nice. The location is good except during Mardi Gras. It can be a bit of a problem during Mardi Gras, as all of the parades go by the hotel and it is difficult to get around. It is central to many of the finer restaurants. The concierge was not much help, but the rest of the staff was fine. The only other disappointment was that you had to pay for WiFi. Most of the hotels I stay at now offer it for free.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Mardi Gras Stay”
Reviews.Author: walker-roamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Ritz Carlton Club Level the Monday and Tuesday of Carnival. Great location only 1 block from Bourbon Street. The hotel fronts Canal St. where all the major parades pass by. The Club level is a huge convenience on Tuesday since alot of the restaurants in NO are closed that day and the ones that are open could be suspect. The Ritz offers a buffet/continental breakfast, lunch and light supper plus soft drinks, cocktails, beer and wine included in the room price. For the 2 days we were there they kept the wine bucket full of decent wine and champagne with a bottle of Skyy always on the bar table with mixers and to-go glasses. The staff was always polite and attentive. The rooms were elegantly nice, roomy and clean. We where on the 4th floor and the room was amazingly quiet. Extra large tub in the bathroom with a separate glassed-in shower. If there were any drawbacks I'd say the lack of a small refrigerator was one, although they had a coffee maker and a room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz at its best in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: tubby1751
Reviews.Content: After reading several not so great reviews I was concerned about staying at the Ritz NOLA, my concerns were unnecessary! The rooms and lobby were clean and lovely and the location is great, a quick walk to Bourbon Street and many, many outstanding restaurants. The concierge's were all very knowledgeable and gave us some very stellar advice for driving to the Plantations as well as somewhere (delicious) to eat by the airport. They also recommended a walking tour of the Garden District and Cemetery which we enjoyed quite a bit. As always the Ritz lived up to our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Wish this hotel was 100% non-smoking.”
Reviews.Author: miltowntraveler
Reviews.Content: This is my first time at this hotel and overall I think it's fantastic, but as I write this, I'm lying here in bed inhaling what I know is cigarette smoke. I can only assume its coming from the room next door to me and it's awful. Please consider making this a 100% non-smoking hotel. It's the only thing that prevents this hotel from being a total 5 star property. I give it a 3 for cleanliness not because housekeeping is bad, it's for the stale smoky air in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: happiestwhenhome
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton during the last week of February. We had originally checked in to a famous old hotel in the French Quarter but were disappointed in the generaly tired atomosphere. The Ritz made every effort to accomodate us on short notice and the rate we were offered was not meaningfully different from the rate where we had originally planned to stay. The hotel, though, was a night-and-day difference. It was spotlessly clean and well-maintained. It has beautiful public spaces. Our room was spacious, luxurious and quiet and, most importantly, extremely clean. The service we received at the front desk and the bar and restaurant was friendly without being overly familiar. The fitness center and spa are impressive. The location is excellent, on the edge of the French Quarter and near the central business district. The hotel made our vacation extraordinary and we would make every effort to stay there again. It was a terrific bargain for the quality of the experience it provided. A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely all the way around! Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: JennMeyer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a few days in NOLA. We were looking for a nice little getaway and wanted a luxurious place to say. The Ritz Carlton lived up to its name in every respect. The hotel lobby is beautiful and smells just delicious (gardenia candles). We booked through getaroom.com and got a great deal, but they had put us in a room with two beds. No worries, the lady at check-in quickly found us a king size room without much hassle. She offered us the club level for $90/night, but we declined as we came to New Orleans to eat and drink in the city restaurants, not the hotel. We had a lovely room on the third floor which avoided the problem of multiple elevators that other mentioned. It was great and I would recommend to others to request the 3rd floor for that reason. We took advantage of the resistance pool and hot tub on the first floor spa. It was really quite lovely. Small, but offered us what we needed. The staff was all great! Special thanks to our concierge, Rudy. He's fantastic. As well as Michael at the front desk that really went above and beyond. My shoe broke on our first night and Micheal found a glue gun and glued it back together for me! Guess that's why you stay at the Ritz. My only complaint is that an espresso coffee cost $6.50. That's a bit too much, even for the Ritz. We opted for breakfast on the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, worth taking club level”
Reviews.Author: mumila
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I was weary of all the bad reviews on the standard of hotels in New Orleans. I thought a big group could not go wrong and it did . I chose the club level upgrade, in the end the price was the same as if you added up the breakfast to a simple room. Our rooms were clean and well maintained but we had no view whatsoever. The rooms overlooked an empty courtyard surrounded by other rooms. It could have been anywhere. The club lounge always had something good to eat and drink. The only thing is you have to pay for the internet. It seems absurd in this day and age!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: BaileyandBella
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz in New Orleans, which was also the venue for our friends' wedding. The wedding in the courtyard was beautiful, as was the reception. Kudos to the wedding planners at the hotel. We spent an extended weekend at the hotel and it was a great experience all around. It is close enough to Bourbon Street (2 blocks) that it made walking around really easy, but it is just far away enough to not hear all the noise that goes on all night long on Bourbon Street. The hotel is spotlessly clean, and the staff is very accommodating. The BEST part? I reserved our room through WhataHotel and paid $200 a night LESS than our friends who reserved directly through the hotel. Our room overlooked the courtyard (I'd asked for a room with a view when I booked through WhataHotel). PLUS, by booking through WhataHotel, we got 2 full breakfasts each morning for each day of our stay and a $50 spa credit (which I used). That gave us an extra $200 each day to stimulate the New Orleans economy! Great trip and great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: USAbluegirl
Reviews.Content: We go down to the Ritz in New Orleans every 3-4 months and we have never had a bad stay. We usually stay on the club level and it is great, especially because my husband is a "social drinker" and the club level has unlimited beverages. My kids love playing games in the library and they love the cookie and candy area. I really like not having to worry about things to eat because all of the meal presentations are enough to fill up on (and are very tasty as well). I look forward to our next trip in April. The spa is also absolutely wonderful. The Ritz also has one of the best Tea services I have experienced. The pool is really tiny so my kids and I are not to over joyed about that one tiny aspect of our stays.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Excellent Staff. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: KEWLBEANS
Reviews.Content: As some of the previous reviews stated, hotel is older, not perfect but very nice, very comfortable. The lobby, indoor public space and courtyard were a pleasant surprise. Restaurant was exceptional, wait staff top notch. High cost for internet service, no coffee maker in room, no pressure in shower could be addressed. Great location, short walk to several very good restaurants and Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Tarted up 4-star for the convention crowd, abhorrent service and staff”
Reviews.Author: RRH_Panta_Rei
Reviews.Content: I'm a 30-something high end traveler, frequently travelling for work and leisure in the US, Europe, and Middle and Far East. I work hard and love to party, and was excited to take a few days off from a trip to NYC to head to New Orleans for great food, music, and some of the most genuine, friendly people you'll ever meet. The City delivered on all three; it's a wonderful place and my only regret is that I'm not able to return to that wonderful city more often. The Ritz Carleton brand, has always had a storied reputation among Les Grandes Dames of the hotel world - Ritz Place Vendome is beyond awesome (with a price tag to match). I've stayed at a few other Ritz locations in the US and Middle East though, and they always felt like tarted up 4 stars. The Ritz New Orleans fell to the bottom of the later characterization. She's an old showgirl, tired and worn, the pain from her massive bunions becoming unbearable as her old routine teeters on, turning to progressively down market crowds in her efforts to make a buck. Enough of the rambling analogies, I know New Orleans is a City where there are no open container laws and even this "sophisticated gentlemen" could be seen bouncing down Bourbon with a 'hand grenade', but in the Ritz I had the pleasure of finding discarded cans of beer in the halls, in the elevators, in the lobby. Not cool guys, this isn't Animal House. The Hotel that week was hosting a convention of, I believe, Gift Fruit store owners, distributors, and suppliers. Not the crowd I normally hang with but very nice, hard working people who I'm sure contribute to an important part of the American economy. However... but there's something about wading through crowds of half-price conventioners every time I walk through the lobby on my way up from or to my $400/ night hotel room that detracts from the whole experience. I know there's not always going to be a gift fruit convention, but clearly they're working the convention crowd angle, which is fine, if youâ€™re the Holiday Inn. The concierge and hotel management were terrible. So bad, in fact, that just thinking about my experience with them makes me want to â€˜bazooka-pukeâ€™ all over my keyboard. Intrusive, disruptive, going so far as to suggest I find another hotel when I strongly objected to being disturbed four times in the course of an hour over a mix-up on check out times. Common' really - just apologize and stop knocking on my door when I'm sleeping; it's that easy. ("Greg, what is the worst fraternity on this campus?") The room was large, but nondescript, the view was of a parking lot, the entire experience lacked any trace of either elegance of â€˜cool factorâ€™. The lobby was nice, but not overwhelming; the marble on the stairs from the front entrance is chipped; the door men were very nice, but seem to be part time employees because they were never there. The only positive aspect was the location, right on the edge of the French Quarter, close enough to be on top of the action, far enough not to be stuck in it. Overall, if you get a half-price room, maybe $200 or less a night, then go for it- you can't beat the location. If you're in town for a leisurely trip and looking for a more genuine New Orleans feel, with pleasant staff and real style, then go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “RCNOLA met and sometimes exceeded our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Bigger32
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Club Level. Very nice! Elegant and private, with separate entrance from the rest of the hotel guests. Food was excellent on club level, but, we stayed for a week, and the repeated offering became somewhat tedious. But, food was abundant, and liquor and beverages, and snacks were endless. I really enjoyed the antiques, like the cheese cart, and the excellent gumbo. Our suite was one of the most beautiful I have ever seen, with fireplaces, canopied beds, and marble everywhere. While I do not expect things to always be brand new, I do expect them to be clean and not stained--the Ritz can do better in this department, especially at the rates they collect. We had Thanksgiving Brunch in the Main dining room on Thanksgiving Day--this was the most expensive brunch I have ever been to. I believe the bill was approaching $200 or more for 2. HOWEVER, it was also the very nicest brunch I have ever experienced! There were so many different types of foods that you could not possibly try everything. Nonetheless, it was the absolute most impressive spread I have personally ever seen. We sometimes went down to have breakfast in the dining room. This was my only complaint. The food was sometimes poor. Sometimes the service was even worse. One morning, the waiter took about 45 minutes to bring an order of waffles. His attitude was very sullen and dismissive in the first place. The waffles arrived cold and hard like bricks, like they had been sitting around for awhile. Needless to say, we complained. I was more insulted over the waiters attitude towards us than the poor quality of the food. The Ritz did their best to make it up to us by inviting us to a "special" dinner which we accepted. They pulled out all the RC stops for this dinner, and I must say, I was impressed. Eventhough I am not a big wine drinker, they served a different premium wine with each course of this meal. I simply do not care about wines that much, but, I knew they were going first class with each offering--so I certainly appreciated the jesture. There were probably 10 or 12 courses to the meal, by the way. Frankly, they seerved us so many things, I can't even recall what all we had, except, I do remember the trio of gumbos which was impressive and very good. The manager of the restaurant came over and spent a great deal of time with us, and also apologized for our poor experience in the hotel dining room. We were very happy that they bent over to make things right with us--after all, while not high rollers, we are very regular visitors to the RC hotel chain, and I do EXPECT things to be right. Frankly this level of service and caring is the difference between the Ritz and the Marriott, for example...and we are willing to pay for that. When things aren't right, we EXPECT that the Ritz will fix it, not just say: "too bad". So, things were mostly as expected--excellent. When they weren't, I believe the RC stepped up to fix it. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It's The Ritz - What else do you expect!”
Reviews.Author: Yarmas
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. The only thing that was less than great was the arrangement of the lobby - on level 3. Became a bit of a pain getting to the street and back to the room (change elevators at level 3)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trespequitas
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton New Orleans for New Years for three nights. You could tell the hotel was full but this did not affect the service. We stayed in standard rooms, which is the most basic rooms you can get, and we found the decor to be classic. Wood furniture, comfortable beds, beautiful upholstered fabrics. Ritz Carlton's are usually decorated classic vs modern but they still have all the modern amenities, some people may consider this dated but I certainly don't! The room was always cleaned in a timely manner. Room service was good and had fast service, even on January 1st, you can imagine how many people were choosing to order breakfast in their room after a long night. The hotel is a block and half away from Bourbon. The only reason why I give it a four star on service is because the concierge service wasn't the best. I guess the concierge felt we were asking too many questions and after our third question to cut us off she answered a questions and went into a back room, leaving us standing there. Also we took a walking tour at the recommendation of the concierge, we thought we were taking it with a serious company and it turns out the meeting point was on the sidewalk in front of a restaurant and the tour guide took cash only. It was just a little weird...didn't expect that from a concierge recommendation. Overall great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but very dirty”
Reviews.Author: cfdnyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a convenient location near the French Quarter, the building is quite nice, and the staff are uniformly pleasant, friendly and helpful. However, the guest rooms feel very dirty and dated. Carpets, upholstery, wall coverings and curtains in our "executive suite" were grubby and needed replacing, housekeeping tidied but did not seriously clean the rooms daily (i.e., no vacuuming), fresh bedding did not always seem clean, and we were fairly certain that there were bedbugs in our first room (the hotel promptly changed us...but it was very unsettling).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, amazing place.”
Reviews.Author: tallgirlonatrip
Reviews.Content: First of all, they were filming a movie next door and besides giving guests everything they expect from the Ritz, Jeremy Piven, Luke Wilson and a ton of pro basketball players were wondering around. If working out next to Luke Wilson isn't reason enough to stay here, I don't know what is. The bar is great, the atmosphere classy, and my maid did an extraordinary job every day. She even picked up my dirty clothes and kept them in a bag for me so when I check out, voila, dirty clothes in one place! She also folded all of my other clothes, which was above and beyond. I also ordered room service one morning for breakfast and the grits and eggs hit the spot after a night of partying. It was $40 grits and eggs, but still, it was heaven in my waffel robe. Love the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else again!”
Reviews.Author: cartyco
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Concierge level of the hotel which is the old Maison New Orleans and it was amazing. My husband and I stayed in original Ritz building in 2004, and it was absolutely wonderful, but this beat it by a mile! The room had hardwood floors, huge marble bathroom with a very large tub, great stereo system, most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! The concierge level has a full breakfast and lunch buffet as well as a cheese presentation and champaign and wine during the day (champaign at breakfast too!). It was set up in a beautiful room connected to a comfortable library with tables. This side of the hotel has its own entrance, but I will say that if you want to go to the main lobby of the Ritz, it is confusing and you have to switch elevators. Well worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level - Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: TrueTexanin409
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the club level and were treated like royalty! All day food and beverages were available. It was worth the extra expense!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER, EVER CHOOSE THE RITZ CARLTON NEW ORLEANS”
Reviews.Author: NeverChooseRitzNola
Reviews.Content: The hotel stay was mediocre, but fine. The problem began when I went to check out. Upon arrival, the valet left my headlights on which, of course, drained my battery. I waited for over an hour to have them bring my car around. Eventually, they compensated my $40 parking fee, with an apology, I was on my way. I live 10 hours from New Orleans. I proceeded to stall approx. 4 hrs into my trip, leaving me stranded in Mississippi. I had to walk through the dark, cold, rain and mud to a store to purchase jumper cables, ruining a very expensive pair of shoes in the process. Also, I had to leave my car running when I filled my car with gas, so I wouldn't be stranded in the middle of nowhere, again. When I got home, I immediately contacted the Ritz, assuming they would be extremely apologetic and offer to pay for any and all expenses incurred. How wrong I was. After several hours of phone calls and emails, I was eventually directly the customer service manager in charge of reimbursement who ensured that she would look into the matter and get back to me. A couple of months, yes MONTHS later, I received a letter in the mail notifying me that their so called 'investigation' of my claim had concluded and they determined that I self-parked my car so they weren't responsible. I called this woman, I was understandably furious that the hotel was blaming ME for their negligence, and let her know that I had the valet ticket to prove that they had parked my car. She hardly let me get a word out before she requested that I fax her a copy of the valet ticket and practically forced me off the phone within just a couple of minutes, with no apology. I obliged, as I'm out of hundreds of dollars at this point, and faxed her the info she needed. Only to received nothing, no phone call, email, fax, letter in response. I never heard from the Ritz Carlton again. Never stay at this hotel, consider yourself warned. BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Club level soooo worth it!!!! Loved out stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cp0tter
Reviews.Content: We splurged for New Year's weekend and stayed on the concierge level for the extra cost. It exceeded our expectations! The wine and champagne flowed throughout the day and night; breakfast was hot with multiple options as well as with lunch, cocktail hour and evening sweets. Janis and John were exceptionally attentive to our needs. Our room at this level was 5 star.......entry way, large bedroom with great bedding, flat-screen, furniture. Bath was exceptionally large with separate tub and show, all marble... Yes, we loved our weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “5 Power Outages in one night”
Reviews.Author: WDW011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for New Year's weekend - on New Year's Eve night, the power went out 5 times. The satellite service went out on Saturday, so there was no television, there were only cordless phones in the room, so no way to dial out in case of emergency... They only allow one towel in the double bathroom. Our room was almost $400/night and we were charged $40 for two bowls of oatmeal for breakfast!!! The parking is $39/day and we had to wait at least 30-45 minutes for our vehicle to be brought around.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Hiccups but STILL the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: LATaz
Reviews.Content: The purpose of our trip was a second try at the Papa Noel celebration in New Orleans, being rained out last year. This time still rainy, but mission accomplished-don't miss City Park-just incredible, especially the Dripping Snow tree. I attemped to obtain the special Papa Noel rates for the Ritz, but the New Orleans shopping weekend rate was even better, giving us a $50.00 room credit which we used to cover the $39.00/ night parking fee, then second night moved the car to a garage around the corner for $24.00 -just know that there are extra charges if you take your car in and out. However valet at the Ritz is SLOW and who needs a car in the French Quarter? Anyway-the hotel is showing signs of wear in the guest rooms-faded carpet, the commode seat was cracked in two. There was no coffee pot in the room, and the blow dryer did not work. However, as soon as I asked for a coffee pot, one was delivered as was the blow dryer(still in the box). Service is excellent-always with a smile. The Davenport lounge is great-the most happening place in the quarter for the well-heeled crowd. Champange by the glass is a reasonable $9.00 per glass, and they serve all of the New Orleans classic drinks-great bartenders. Jeremy Davenport is a classic and classy trumpet player-mixing in Christmas songs with jazz. Be sure to snag a table early or you won't be sitting. The hotel had wonderful things going on if you have kids-decorating your own gingerbread man, the Teddy Bear Tea, and everything was beautifully decorated. The enormous Christmas tree in the courtyard was gorgeous, however, this is also where people smoke. The gym has plenty of treadmills, all with individual TV's, and a separate weight room-towels and fruit/water are provided. I would definitely consider this hotel if there are special rates-some small irritations, but still wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE IN THE SPA”
Reviews.Author: carlosbeto
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel chain is the Ritz Carlton. I wanted a nice weekend in New Orleans, away from my busy medical practice in Miami. We registered at the hotel and we went to the Spa to check it out and to have a nice treatment. Unfortunately we had the worst experience with one of the employees, she was so rude, aggressive and had a tremendous degree of hostility, difficult to find in todayâ€™s costumer oriented hotel Business. She made us feel so unwelcome. Another employee was nicer and gave us a tour of the facilities but we just wanted to get out of there as soon as possible, we did not schedule the appointment, went back to the room and made phone calls , check the net and were advised about spas in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: dcdozen
Reviews.Content: Bellman was memorable. Room was clean and nicely appointed. Quiet mid-week, without lounge entertainment. Fair for a Ritz, but nice compared to hotels in general. Room service breakfast was OK on two mornings. Spa is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect except for check in”
Reviews.Author: golfbob
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel except they make no effort to expite check in. Expect to wait like a holiday inn. The club level is the best I've seen

Reviews.Title: “You're on you own. Don't expect any assistance for anything and you'll be fine!”
Reviews.Author: Sodapop2010
Reviews.Content: Whenever we travel to some place new I generally consider the Ritz Carlton chain unless I learn of better options. Thus, for our first trip to New Orleans I selected the Ritz Carlton thinking it would provide the most comfortable/predictable home away from home for our family. While the accomodations were clean and adequate the service was unexpectedly horrendous. I really could go on and on with instances where we were just floored by the staffs inability to do their job. Many times we considered a conversation with the supervisors but for all we knew they were among the numerous staff that was always standing around in clusters talking away as we: set our own table, asked if we could please place our order, got our own luggage cart and loaded our own luggage, made all our own reservations because the concierge was never there, (especially if it was lunch or dinner time as he was then off having lunch or dinner.)... ....... Whenever we were forced to rely on the staff, such as placing an order in the restaurant or trying to get some information, we found them to be unreliable. Bad information ("no, we don't have a jacuzzi or whirlpool" and botched orders (7 out of the 8 meals eaten in the restaurant) Even more frustrating was how long it took to get the bad information or botched order. Over promise and under deliver was the motto. "I'll get right back to you on that," became our joke for the week as we heard this all the time (in one instance 3 times from 3 seperate phone calls to the same department which still never got back to us.) but never heard back from the individuals. Honestly, I could go on. We still had a wonderful time in New Orleans and aside from the lack of service the Ritz was a comfortable accomodation for our exploring.

Reviews.Title: “Club level is the only way”
Reviews.Author: Manchesternicky
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ritz Carlton Club Level for 3 nights and i could not find fault with any of it!! the room was fantastic the club level lounge area was cozy and inviting with some sort of snacks on all day! Ryan went above the call of duty to look after us and also spending time chatting to us telling us the best places to see and eat he was a delight! the hotel is minutes walk from Bourbon Street so its perfect to park your car and forget about it! had a fantastic time at the Ritz and would go again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oasis at the club-level”
Reviews.Author: trvlr76
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a quiet corner room, in the Club-level. We could not have been happier with the choice to stay at the Ritz. I would suggest that if you cannot stay in the club-level, consider staying somewhere else for a cheaper cost. The lounge in the club level is inviting and charming. The catering they provide throughout the day is of very high quality. On the weekend, we found the arrangements to be a bit more substantial than the weekdays. The bottomless wine glass was enough to make my husband laugh in a state of continuous glee. I loved the baked goodies that were lined up all day in glass jars ready for the taking. You could make meals out of the selections if you wanted to. The bed was amazing. The linens were superior as was the mattress. We both slept like babies. We had a separate tub and shower in the large, modern bathroom. The tub was HUGE with candles surrounding it. It was very romantic. The TV had a large entertainment package. The Ritz itself has a wonderful, peaceful courtyard in which we spent a lot of time. It's beautifully landscaped, and we often drank coffee there, or had lunch. The staff is very attentive. We saw the J Davenport show one night. It was nice. The Ritz also offers high tea. I cannot say enough about our stay, other than I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “don't try to book a block of rooms there for a wedding!”
Reviews.Author: ldtc2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz last Halloween (09) and had a great room for a much cheaper price than we paid this year. So, when my daughter decided that she wanted to get married down there, we had good memories of the hotel- and tried to book out a block of rooms for all the people that were flying in to attend the wedding. We communicated with reservations via phone and email. We really wanted our immediate family and the bridal party in adjoining rooms or at least close to one another on the same floor..Since they had a good two months to arrange the rooms - I was flabbergasted when I arrived and the bridal party were in rooms on different levels of the hotel. When I checked in I asked "Liam" at the front desk to make sure that my 88 year old father's room was either next to mine or my brother's ( due to his age) . That didn't happen either - he was alone at the opposite end of the hotel. The rooms were just ordinary, common rooms that could be found at any typical 3 star hotel. They failed on two occasions to give us wake up calls. And I asked twice to have my pillows changed from feather to non feather- it never happened. Bathrooms are small and not well lit. And, there happened to be two murders outside the hotel Halloween weekend. I will not be staying at the Ritz in New Orleans again - and it's a shame that it is not run with the same Ritz efficiency and attention to detail as their other hotels ( Ritz chain).

Reviews.Title: “Club Level Is Worth It”
Reviews.Author: Skifree619
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay over Halloween weekend. Thought the setup of the Club part of the hotel was wonderful - gorgeous common areas, and nice wood floors in the Club Level rooms. The location is fantastically convenient (about a block and a half) to the Bourbon St area but far enough away to be quiet. Only downsides are that many of the rooms have absolutely no enviable views and the sink/vanity area on the Club Level was smaller than I would've expected. Also was not impressed by the level of service by the concierge we encountered, so you may want to do your own homework about restaurants and the like. Wonderful stay, definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star in EVERY way!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bogeyboi
Reviews.Content: Spent five days here on business and from my first welcome from "Cory" the bellman to everyone at the Ritz, Ive not enjoyed any stay at any hotel more! Rooms were very well appointed, location can't be beat, excellent food, comfortable beds and quality amenities........all what you'd expect from a five-star hotel. If there was any drawback, it was the Internet service which seemed to work better in the meeting room and registration areas than in the room. I highly recommend this hotel for visitors to NOLA and plan to do so again when I return. There was an added bonus....had the pleasure of seeing and sharing an elevator ride with the Miami Heat (D-Wade, Bosh, Jawan Howard, and King James himself - who took a different elevator) who were also staying at the Ritz for their game with the Hornets. Nice guys and great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: NCTraveler-56
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week for 4 days including Halloween and Saints game day. This is far enough from the revelers for sleep, but close enough to get anywhere in the FQ on foot. Very comforable rooms with a nice courtyard for coffee, breakfast, nice bar with jazz. It was what we expected from a RC. Didn't use the spa but it looked nice.

Reviews.Title: “We never wanted to leave”
Reviews.Author: pjmpls
Reviews.Content: I was so pleased with our stay at the Ritz in New Orleans. The room was large, the bed was incredibly comfortable, the staff was attentive and we really enjoyed the Davenport Lounge. Some reviewers noted the noise level. I can assure you we heard absolutely nothing from our room. It was a lovely oasis away from the madness of Bourbon Street. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: happilydisplaced
Reviews.Content: Convenient location. Quiet and comfortable rooms. Club level is worth the upgrade. Hotel layout a bit confusing; often had to go down to go up. Restaurant service was slow for the one meal we ate there.

Reviews.Title: “Sonata Awards at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: chad1991
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the courteous staff at the Ritz Carlton. From the moment that I arrived at the hotel, I have never felt more welcomed. The magazine that I work for had our Sonata design awards ceremony at the hotel on October 9th. All of our 40+ guests had a pleasant time drinking and networking with others. The dining room, Jeremy Davenport, and the Spa treatment the following morning was the most fun and relaxing experience that I have had in New Orleans. The staff at the Spa was incredibly cordial and the treatment was out of this world. I plan on returning as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel fit for a goddess”
Reviews.Author: goddess40248
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Ritz Carlton for our annual "Sister Weekend". The room was very pretty. The bed was soft. The spa was heavenly. I had the carotene treatment & I am loving it. (Kim was my hairdresser.) We did go out into the city during the day, but went to the lounge in the hotel to hear Jeremy Davenport in the evening. This was good as we did not want to be out after dark. One sister has a bad hip so she was able to do the spa, go to the lounge, shop, etc. without leaving the hotel. It was perfect for us....we were treated like the goddesses that we believe we are. We will definitely go back & will stay at other Ritz Carlron properties wherever we may land.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Stay...”
Reviews.Author: windycitytravelgal
Reviews.Content: I heard that you always book a hotel near the French Quarter, but didn't understand why until my recent visit to the Big Easy. Everything is in walking distance- food, music, bars, retail stores, etc. We stayed at this beautiful hotel when it first opened 10 years ago and it feels brighter and fresher than it did back then, if that's possible. We checked in for a romantic weekend and even treated ourselves to some spa time. This is the perfect hotel in the perfect city to enjoy a perfect stay. We walked to some of the most famous restaurants in New Orleans, like Galatoire's and Arnaud's and then went out in the French Quarter to some jazz clubs. We didn't have to worry about renting a car or getting a taxi. We walked everywhere. I heard the Garden District and Magazine Street are great, but we were happy just enjoying the French Quarter. The hotel smells of gardenias and when I asked the lovely girl at the front desk about the scent, she told me that I could buy the candles in the hotel's retail store. I did and when I unpacked my bags, the scent of gardenias reminded me our romantic weekend! What a treat! We will be back to New Orleans and we will stay at this pristine hotel. It was all that we remembered and more.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: CultureVulture88
Reviews.Content: We booked with the Ritz because we wanted the service. It's not the cheapest but we all know that. We booked into the club rooms which had a lounge with drinks and snacks at all hours and a concierge who were so wonderfully helpful. I don't believe you can beat the service offered in America and the Ritz certainly lives up to the expectations of class and luxury. Beautiful room, large bathroom, they even gave me hair straighteners to borrow when I realised my UK ones wouldn't work. Best bit for me ... 24hour candy and cookie bar in the club lounge. What more do you want?!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable but need knowledgable concierges”
Reviews.Author: unicare58
Reviews.Content: This was a leisure trip with another couple; we had adjoining "deluxe" rooms on an upper floor facing Canal St. We were awakened several times each night of our 4-night stay, in the hours after midnight, due to sirens from various emergency vehicles and from what sounded like drag-racing engines or unmuffled Harleys nearby. Service was always excellent, especially in the Davenport lounge/restaurant where the food was excellent, far better than some of the high-end meals we ate at some restaurants in the French Quarter. There was usually a doorman to hold the Canal St. door open, but about 10-20% of the time, he wasn't there. There is no revolving door at this spot. The regular help at the restaurants, the maids, the doormen and bellmen were very friendly and pleasant. The heating/air conditioning system worked very well in our room. There was a 42 inch (guess at size) LCD tv with several HD channels. The room was attractively decorated (only two quarter-sized black stains on the carpet), but much more light would've been greatly appreciated - the light is from lamps - no overhead lighting in the main section. The bathroom had marble floors and had a bathtub with shower rather than a glass-enclosure shower; water pressure was just adequate. The bathroom itself could've used some lights over the large mirror - it was relatively dark standing at the sink when looking in the mirror. There was also no venting fan in the bathroom which made for some easily heard embarrassing noises and odors! The feather bed was soft and so comfortable - it made our firm mattress at home seem like concrete in comparison. The pillows were comfortable too. Our room was a deluxe as was our friends' room, but their room was a few square feet larger. There is an ethernet connection for internet; our friends said it cost them to use it. There is a small room near registration with several computers; it costs $7.50 for the first 15 minutes. Parking is expensive - with tax it's about $42.50 per 24 hour period. I asked for subtotaled bills during our stay and kept getting charged the parking fee (we had NO car and just used taxis). I'd show it to the registration clerks and the fee would get removed (without the clerks saying they were sorry), then added back on for the next day! Our friends did not get charged the parking fee, but were charged for other services they had not used. So check your bill carefully and ask for a subtotal every few days. The concierge desk offers tips, but doesn't seem to know the good tours. The city tour we got saw mostly things like the outside of a graveyard (not the streets inside it) and areas where already wretched houses in seedy areas had been wiped out by Katrina as we heard diatribes about the gov't handling of the aftermath. The swamp airboat tour ($90 pp) we also booked thru the concierge desk was terrible compared to one we took a few years ago. The boat barely moved as we sat looking at swamp plants. How unexciting. Finally, the concierge recommendation of shopping along Magazine Ave was WAY overrated; I would skip this area entirely (and hire a new concierge staff).

Reviews.Title: “Personal Service - great location - beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: jonisb
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Ritz Carlton in New Orleans on several occasions. One occasion was for my daughter's wedding. The guest rooms were beautiful and the staff always helpful. We needed a steamer ASAP - no problem. Everyone enjoyed the jazz music and dancing in the main bar. The concierge service went above and beyond. On another occasion we were upgraded to a Club Room. The decor was gorgeous and the club level breakfast, cocktails and late night snacks plentiful. If you are going to stay in New Orleans - The Ritz Carlton is the only hotel I would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alsgalny
Reviews.Content: Great, classy hotel within walking distance to everything. The only downside? It needs an outdoor pool!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Gets It Right”
Reviews.Author: kathyhouston
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel numerous times, I am always nervous about which Ritz Carlton I will see upon arrival. Several stays in the past were marred by poor service, staff needing an attitude adjustment, poorly run spa. This time something drastic has changed at the hotel -- everything is perfect. Friendly greeting by car valet. Extremely friendly welcome at front desk with a very well informed desk clerk who could tell me exactly where the room was located (specifically asked for our Executive One Bedroom Suite not to face Canal Street). Room was extremely large, one full bath, parlor and additional 1/2 bath. Extremely clean, QUIET, well maintained, fresh. Every staff member welcomed us in the hallways and lobby, bell stand and concierge worked as they should -- and have not in the past. I was extremely pleased to see that the spa is now being run more professionally than I have seen in the past 5 years. The facilities are always well kept but it appears additional training has taken place so the staff understand their tasks. In the past no one would recommend that as soon as you enter there is no cell phone usage and to lower your voice so others can enjoy the facilities. I have had to leave on occasion in the past due to loud conversations both on phones and among staff. I am also excited to see some additions to the massage offerings such as Thai massage. Both my husband and I had excellent masseuses (Angel is very highly trained and I would recommend her to everyone). I don't know what has happened but the improvements have brought this hotel back where it started - the top hotel in New Orleans. I plan to write Simon Cooper, President & CEO my thoughts so he can be aware that improvements have been made.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good but not Best”
Reviews.Author: zuzu35
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for the weekend in July. The rooms are comfortable, not large, but we were too close to Canal street. We woke to what sounded like a mass murder on the street below us. It sounded like the sirens were in our room. We had requested rooms on a higher floor. All the furnishings were new, comfortable, clean so anyone would be safe staying here. We did buy coffee in the lobby in the morning, and had to return it because it was such poor quality. You do expect good strong coffee in New Orleans. Have stayed at the Windsor Court and Westin recently and for the money would have to choose one of the others.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KarmelDST
Reviews.Content: This trip to New Orleans was for business and pleasure. I took my husband, son, and mom with me. My reason for choosing this hotel is because I had my family with me and I wanted them to be as comfortable as possible. I have to say, the staff at this hotel is fabulous! From the ladies and gentlemen at the check in desk, the valet parking attendants, bellmen, housekeepers, to the manager in the restaurant, everyone showed us nothing but southern hospitality. What I loved the most was that the valets and bellmen remembered our names and were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: 1molinda
Reviews.Content: While in NOLA for the FEW Conference, I enjoyed my stay immensely at The Ritz. The competition cannot compare to the wonderful rooms, cleanliness of the entire hotel, comfortable mattress, and the friendliness of all the staff. The room was large and the bathroom was very nicely appointed -- in marble -- with a magnifying mirror (a must-have for me). Every evening I could hardly WAIT to go back to my room. The location is excellent -- I walked everywhere I had to go (even to the aquarium). LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: jodimacip
Reviews.Content: Never mind the hotel is simply luxurious, the service at this hotel is impeccable. Really all I can say is WOW. Can't wait to book my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “I think I expected more from a Ritz.”
Reviews.Author: hehobbie
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel common areas were very nice, and the hotel itself was in a good location (a couple of blocks from Bourbon St.). The rooms were spacious and well appointed. Here is where the "I expected more" comment stems from. My room was on the 4th floor and overlooked the lobby roof and air conditioning unit. While I'm sure that was probably better than hearing Canal St traffic all night, it isn't what I thought I would find in a hotel of that caliber. Also, I've heard about the exception service that the Ritz offers. Other collegues have stayed at other properties across the country and raved about how they were treated. I have honestly received better guest service at the Quality Inn in Mocksville, NC. Not to say that anyone was exceptionly rude or unfriendly, but again I've seen better service at hotels with fewer stars. Also, the hotel did not offer things that you see at other properties for a much lower rate. Valet parking was outrageous. At $36/day + tax, it was well over the price other French Quarter hotels charge. I don't mind paying for valet, but what makes the Ritz' parking $10 more expensive than the Omni which is 4 blocks away? Another key point is internet access. In the digital age, I expect either free high speed access or free wi-fi. Not at the Ritz. Expect to pay over $35 for 5 days worth of access. My suggestion, bring an aircard or walk down the block to Starbucks where it's free. I am not swearing off the Ritz brand, but I definitely will not be staying at the Ritz in New Orleans again. Unfortunate for them, as I tend to be very loyal and will be traveling to New Orleans frequently over the next year.

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL WAY TO STAY IN THE BIG EASY”
Reviews.Author: mizzjoy
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Ritz Carlton in New Orleans. The Ritz was my bastion while I waited for my lost luggage. My rooms was spacious, well-conditioned and comfortable. I stayed on the 7th floor in a suite; it was quiet and the bathroom was luxurious. Friday evenings they have good jazz and the boutique sells sensational locally made gardenia candles in large jam jars (great for gifts-and they ship them to you). This is also a great place to buy a waffled summer robe :) Everything you need is here... The in room internet connection is easy to use and staff are gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: tomdenverDenverCO
Reviews.Content: The Ritz New Orleans has a wonderful feel. In a historic building with appropriate and perfect matching classic and timeless decoration. I loved my stay. The hotel is on Canal Street,so you avoid the rowdyness and noise of the French Quarter but you can slip out the East entrance and are just steps away from the French Quarter. The decoration could not be more perfect and classic. Just wonderful! True quality and a wonderfual place to stay. I will be back. ps the Ritz Club lounge feels like a classic center hall home and is a wonderful place to grab a cocktail or wind down from a long day of sightseeing. Bravo.

Reviews.Title: “hotel lobby great, rooms just average”
Reviews.Author: mhammond
Reviews.Content: we rented 2 executive suites this past weekend in NOLA. I have to say I'm disappointed. The hotel rooms do not meet the Ritz' luxury standards. While the lobby was great. The hotel bar (with live jazz on the weekend) terrific, the rooms were no more nice than most Marriott's I stay in for work. The rooms were big. The bathrooms nice, but the actual bedroom and living room furniture, carpet, walls were just average. Next time I'll try the Roosevelt or the Farimont in Nola. Staff was not great. It took 30 minutes to get the car and calling in advance didn't seem to ever make them actually go get it before you came down. Sorry. I wish I would have known. FYI

Reviews.Title: “Now I don't want to stay anywhere else but The Ritz Carlton!”
Reviews.Author: gcmjjm
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room on the Ritz Club Level (Maison Orleans) for our anniversary. From the second we pulled into this beautiful hotel, we were treated as if our arrival had been anticipated and as if they were truly happy to see us. Everyone greeted us, asked if they could help and several knew our names. The reservation clerk had even made note of the fact that it was our anniversary, how many kids we have and the desk clerk asked about them! The Club Level was an experience that I truly don't think I could describe in just a few words. If I had to try..."absolutely amazing" would be the first thing that comes to mind. Our room with hard wood floors, book shelves (with real books), king sized bed with a half canopy over it, just made us feel like we were in an elaborate guest room of an old mansion. When we went down to the Club area to have the food that they offered during different times of the day, we were met with kind staff that welcomed us, visited with us and assured us that they would be happy to help us with anything that we might need. The food was absolutely fabulous and even the hors d'oeuvres were garnished to perfection! I could go on and on about how much we enjoyed this place. Our only regrets were that we had to leave so soon and didn't get to use the services at the Spa or eat at the M Bistro. We have those on our list for when we go back! My advice is that if you are looking for a really nice place to stay, try the Ritz. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller20203
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton is an excellent example of what a high end hotel should be. It is a wonderful place to stay. The staff is professional and courteous. The food is wonderful. I wish the menu still offered mufalleta b/c it was the tastiest mufalleta sandwich I ever had. The rooms are well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is conveniently located near Bourbon and Canal. You can't ask for a better overall hotel experience in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Peerless”
Reviews.Author: parkerlsmith
Reviews.Content: As a preface, the two hotels my wife and I were considering booking for our recent trip to New Orleans were the Ritz and the Le Pavillion. If these are your two choices, you don't need to read any other reviews, just go with the Ritz. We stayed on the club level, which is outstanding in every way, and enjoyed being able to simply walk out of the hotel, down a view blocks on Iberville and be right in the middle of the Quarter. Just far enough away and just close enough. But as we were touring around the city, we saw Le Pavillion and popped in to see if we had made the right choice. Yes, yes, a thousand times yes. Nothing really wrong with the Belle of New Orleans hotel, but everything about the Ritz was one or two steps up from the Le Pavillion experience. Bedding, cleanliness, freshness of the hotel. Again, Le Pavillion is a great hotel and my point here isn't to bash it, just to point out that (as always) the Ritz is just at a different level. I read reviews that this Ritz wasn't like others, which I didn't pick up on at all. Just a great experience all the way around. Music in the Davenport Lounge was outstanding. Chris, the bartender from Jamaica, was outstanding and made the best mojito I've ever had. You just can't go wrong. Jerry, the head of the front office at the Ritz is also my new best friend. If you read these reviews, Jerry. Thank you again for all your help and for making our stay special!

Reviews.Title: “can i just live here?”
Reviews.Author: moonspies
Reviews.Content: full disclosure--i came here with a wedding party and thus received a discounted rate, but i am trying to review the Ritz as if i had paid a few hundred bucks more. when i got home to atlanta yesterday, i was so sad that no one was coming to clean my room and make my bed, that the view out my window was just trees and houses instead of a bustling city, that i couldn't just go downstairs and expect a buffet of delicious snacks waiting for me... this Ritz is beautiful. the staff was friendly. the bartender was...turtle-slow, but hey! this is nola, and everything moves at its own pace, right? the king bed was divine and the lead curtains kept out the morning sunshine when we wanted them to. granted, the room was only 6 floors above canal so it was noisy at times, just from the street being so close. the place is HUGE, and if you're tired of your room but don't want to head out on the town there are plenty of other options--the amazing patio, the lounge, the smoking room, the club level snack haven...you name it. great stay!

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this Hotel & so will you!”
Reviews.Author: CLFowler
