Reviews.Content: This was my first time to stay at the Ritz-Carlton in New Orleans. I have been to New Orleans multiple times and this trip was the best by far. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was so friendly and helpful! But best of all was the bed. From the feather bed to the crisp white linens, it was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The second best thing about this hotel is that you can crank down the temperature in your room as low as you want and the air conditioner actually works! The hotel night life was great. They had a wonderful jazz band and singer who had everyone up and dancing. The food was a little pricey, for what you get, but there are plenty of other great places to eat in New Orleans. Needless to say, I will never stay in another hotel in New Orleans. Our entire group was completely satisfied with the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Class & Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit93
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in New Orleans and my first Ritz Carlton - definitely not the last time for either. The Ritz Carlton was everything I expected and more. Fabulous room - large corner room with lots of light. Fabulous beds, great service. The staff is incredibly friendly, helpful and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceptional service, super Club Level”
Reviews.Author: Trev01_10
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I visited New Orleans and stayed here on their Club Level. The room was pretty, well appointed and large. The Concierge service was friendly, helpful and enthusiastic. The Club food was timely, varied and truly delicious. New Orleans was fine, but the hotel was the highlight!

Reviews.Title: “A dissapointing stay”
Reviews.Author: kjve9876
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many Ritz's with none making a bad impression! This one on the other hand messed up my reservation twice, didn't correct the problem and continued to make mistakes. We stayed at the "club level" of the hotel where we were told there would be food and drink all day. The food portions were so small most were one small bite. The drinks were served warm and the coffee was very bad. Finally the hotel is a maze and is extremely hard to find your way around.

Reviews.Title: “Le confort suprÃªme dans la Nouvelle-OrlÃ©ans”
Reviews.Author: Bose2
Reviews.Content: As my title indicates, the comfort here is supreme. I was taken aback by some of the reviews on tripadvisor, boy was I wrong. I don't know where these bad reviews are coming from, but this place is the epitome of luxury and nothing less. The staff is very nice; always ready to help and please. The hotel itself is very luxurious, impeccably clean & comfortable, I can be very picky, but I was not able to find anything to complain about. I looked everywhere in my room for dirt, dust, signs of mouse/rats or mold as mentioned in some previous reviews and nothing, everything was spotless. I was given a room exactly to my liking. Rooms are large, very clean, comfortable & quiet, the bed is pure comfort. You will feel pampered here. Yes, the decor is old world & traditional, but this is a Ritz-Carlton and it absolutely fits in New Orleans. If you want edgy and cool, go stay at the W Hotel. The hotel location is good to visit New Orleans, however the hotel is located not too far from an iffy & dilapidated area... keep that in mind, but I can't see why tourists would wander in that area anyhow. If you are just curious, take the Canal streetcar going towards the cemeteries and you will see what I mean. I would return at the Ritz-Carlton New Orleans in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maison Orleans, which is the club within the Ritz Carlton. It was FANTASTIC. It was our 5th wedding anniversary and all of the staff, from the concierge to the housekeeping was intent on treating us royally. There were champagne and chocolates upon our arrival (and not just regular chocolates--handpainted goodies and strawberries dipped to look like they were wearing miniature tuxedos) and our room was gorgeous. We actually had a view with 3 large windows overlooking Iberville down to the French Quarter. Our room was on the 8th floor. The bathroom was spacious (tub fit myself and my 6'-5" husband), the room was spacious and unlike previous reviewers, I thought housekeeping did a really great job keeping us well stocked with fresh towels, toiletries etc. The bed was very comfy too and I love turn down service when it is done properly, which this was...including putting our slippers on each side of the bed. The staff was very friendly and forthcoming with recommendations and pointers. Jaoul (at the desk), Anne and Andrea were so helpful. When you stay in the "club" at Maison Orleans, there is food and beverage available 24 hours a day. The breakfasts were considered continental but too me they were more than that. Lox, fresh fruit, homemade oatmeal, omellette station, French pastry and cereals etc were wonderful to choose from. The buffet of goodies at the elevators (chocolate chip and other cookies, French Macaroons, hand painted toffee pieces and taffy) were especially welcoming after a long day traipsing around the city. Also, the cafe au lait was delish. And I thought the facility itself was well appointed with French bergere chairs, old paintings and beautiful chandeliers. You can sit in the library or a living room setting to have cheese and crackers and a glass of wine in the afternoon as well. My husband and I have traveled quite a bit and we tend to be underimpressed....However, this place really charmed us. That being said, I would DEFINITELY go back and stay here and I was sad to go.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the 4 stars, wish I had stayed somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: GetALife56
Reviews.Content: This was my first Ritz-Carlton. I got a too-good-to-refuse rate of $179 a night to try it out. The service was great, and the room was wonderful with a big-screen HD TV and a cozy pillow-laden king bed. It's on the edge of the French Quarter, a block from the end of Bourbon Street. So what's the problem? Nothing, really. They turned off the water from 9 p.m. Sunday to 6 a.m. Monday for repairs and of course I forgot in the middle of the night. Any food items were priced ridiculously out of reach for someone on a government expense account. I just saw a lot of smaller, quaint, New Orleans-y hotels that seemed more my style. It's my own fault for getting caught up in the Ritz-Carlton hoity-toity. I was out of place among the black ties and evening wear.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not as nice as a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: namila
Reviews.Content: Nice size room, good location, great staff but the whole atmosphere was slightly lower than a regular Ritz-Carlton hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Calm in the French Quarter Storm”
Reviews.Author: PucksterColorado
Reviews.Content: Lovely, safe, convenient, charming; just steps into the French Quarter. Also across the street from the green trolley that goes to the garden district and Tulane/Aubdon Park area. The spa was nice, especially the mimosa champagne massage. Hot stone pedicure fine, but maybe not worth all the money. Food, only sampled during big company dinners, was very good. Jeremy Davenport, who plays in the Davenport Lounge most nights, is great jazz with a Big Band sound. It would be my choice to stay here again unless I found a nice boutique hotel instead. But thoroughly enjoyed the experience, and loved how it was calm, clean and civiliized but also in the midst of the insanity of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, stately, old world hotel”
Reviews.Author: MKK10
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel for a conference and upgraded to a suite which was very spacious and lovely. The bathroom was large, however, the lighting was very poor. The makeup mirror wasn't much better. I had to go to a window with a hand mirror to put on makeup. The suite, in general, was dark because of its location in the hotel. The workout room is well appointed with good equipment. I didn't have time to enjoy the spa which did look very nice. Bellmen were very efficient. The courtyard was a good gathering place.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the Ritz Name”
Reviews.Author: dawoz
Reviews.Content: Although I've been to this hotel several times, usually for drinks or to meet someone, I've only stayed here once. The location is ideal just two blocks from Bourbon Street. The service was great... but I remember the room to be nice, but nothing that really made you go "OMG". I'm usually there around New Years and they always have great Xmas decorations... Their public areas are really nice. As with most Ritz properties, they are a bit out of my price range... We splurged one year and it was a nice treat. I'm actually a big fan of the Iberville Suites (Shares the same building). You get all the perks of the Ritz at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.”
Reviews.Author: gotigersgo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for one night, after deciding at the last minute to extend our Christmas/New Year's trip to New Orleans. The room rate was affordable, especially for how nice the hotel is, cheaper than the rooms we had been staying in at the W French Quarter. The service was impeccable. They arranged massages and use of the spa for each member of the family in the morning for that afternoon. The rooms? Clean, large, very comfortable beds. At night, after returning from restaurant/Bourbon street, the bar at the hotel was hopping with people watching football games. The crowd and bartender were friendly. Only spent one night there, so not a great deal to say, besides the stay was flawless- with awesome service, comfortable rooms, luxurious spa, and great atmosphere. Definitely recommend to anyone looking for a nice hotel in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “First and last stay at the Ritz: service appalling”
Reviews.Author: d2d2
Reviews.Content: First problem before checkin. Travel agent called while we were in cab from airport to say hotel had contacted her to say we'd been bumped from Club Level due to a held over conference. Upon check in offered room on 10th floor facing Canal St. Told wait for different room was 40 plus guests long so took it. Street noise even at that level, although told there wouldn't be (knew better from experience living in NYC and street noise not an issue for us but shows the misinformation started early). Was given club level amenity access (first and last "xtra" although verbally quoted new room rate $20 lower than what ended up on our bill, so guess we did end up paying for that too). When tried to use it had to return to the front desk to have key reprogrammed as initially had not been programmed with access as promised. Hotel room a bit dated but clean as were lobby areas (more updated). Stale smoke smell throughout hallways on our floor but thankfully not in our non smoking room. Had to call front desk again after settling into room as discovered bath linens not fully stocked. Club area also very nice. Food so so but free drinks. Service ok. Got there at time "lunch" ending and told to grab food we wanted quickly as they were cleaning up. Had person in club lounge make reservations for dinner and lunch the next day via concierge. Told concierge would have map/reservation for dinner printed out and slipped under our door as we had mentioned wanting to rest before dinner and she said that way we wouldn't be disturbed. Instead about 2 hours before our dinner reservation the concierge called our room to say she had indeed confirmed the dinner reservation and didn't give directions before hanging up. Googled directions ourselves just before leaving for dinner. Walked the 6 blocks or so to the restaurant only to find a private party that had rented out the whole restaurant still winding down with the hostess telling us on our inquiring about our reservation, "I told her (concierge) we wouldn't have an opening until at least 10pm". Walked back to the hotel to talk with concierge and figure out where to eat (now 10pm) and first thing she says is not "sorry" but "who did you talk to". I guess we were supposed to ignore the annoyed stares of the party guests and the hostess and demand the manager?! Next she asked us to walk back and try again as was now 10pm?!! (We had just left the restaurant 10 minutes before and there was no indication they would be ready even at 10pm and no offer from them to just come back). Finally she said she was sorry and what did we want to do then. We said we wanted to eat! She ended up recommending a restaurant just around the corner (GW Fins). Food only so so but passable but service horrible and decor dated/overdone. Waiter insisted on pushing certain menu items (one recommendation excellent, one poor and two others so so) and inattentive. Bread arrived after the appetizer, etc. Lunch the next day wonderful as we had had the reservation made to one of our favorite restaurants, Bayona, ie we did NOT leave it up to the concierge. Should have just done the same with dinner the night before but thought we might try something different. Next day at the spa: overall the most positive experience at the hotel but still with issues. Upon checking in and going to the women's changing area, asked by two different staff about slipper size but slippers never brought to room. Heard name being called to go to first treatment and I informed massage therapist I didn't have slippers. Told to just walk to massage room barefoot and he would get my slippers after. Also, no music in massage treatment room. Massage, facial, mani/pedi all excellent though. Next issue: in town and staying at this hotel for a wedding. Spouse asked several times of different staff about getting to the offsite wedding and how much time to allow, etc. Inquired about needing limo service vs trolley vs walking vs taxi and told taxi would be the best option (too far to walk/trolley didn't go that far on Canal/no need for limo as taxi easy to get and fast) and to allow 10 minutes. Did that only to find taxi line of 40 plus people and no cabs in sight. Tried to talk to staff that were flagging down cabs (most people in line going to concert starting 30 minutes after the wedding start time) and told just to get in back of the line. Spouse spoke with person inside and told the hotel vehicle was on its way down from the garage to take us. Left the taxi line to wait for hotel vehicle. When hotel vehicle showed up 5 minutes later, told by driver (who was supposedly a manager) that he had to make a run to the concert first and took off. Staff member who had told us to wait clearly surprised too and very apologetic but told there was nothing to do but wait and try to flag down a cab for us. Went back to taxi line, now clearly late for wedding and again at back of line. another 15 minutes and finally got taxi to arrive at wedding 1/2 hour late and nearly over. Next day needed extra towels for room and called housekeeping. Told they'd be sent right up. half hour later finally noticed housekeeping cart on our hallway and just asked that person for towels. Half hour after that finally someone knocked with more towels. An hour for towels? No way to just contact your staff already on the floor and have them respond to guest request? Other comments: staff rarely made eye contact; had exactly two staff greet us the entire stay; only occasionally saw staff at main and back entrance doors and never once had them opened for us. all pretty small details but details we've not seen overlook at other supposedly comparable properties. We never demanded anything for the above and numerous service snafus but in past experiences with much less inconveniences at other again supposedly comparable properties have been offered small things like champagne sent to room or spa discount to compensate No mention of anything of the sort at the Ritz, just an occasional "sorry" by harried staff. Overall: nice common areas and spa ok; rooms adequate but a bit dated; service terrible, ie don't rely on staff for ANYTHING. We visit New Orleans at least once a year. Our first and last time at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: knuckleup1986
Reviews.Content: Gangsta views, perfect location, awesome service, great booze, with enough money you can stay like a king

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Service Needs Work”
Reviews.Author: zarc
Reviews.Content: We visited New Orleans primarily to visit Tulane as a potential school for my son. We figured we would catch some Mardi Gras as well. The Hotel is beautiful, clean, and there is great attention to detail in all the common areas as well as the rooms. The staff and everyone in New Orleans for that matter were very friendly. We were two adults and two teenagers and we had a corner room overlooking Canal St. You should know that Canal St. is like the Times Square New York of New Orleans. It was loud for very much of the night even after Mardi Gras. Sleep was an issue. It is only a few blocks from Bourbon and Royal Streets and two blocks from the St Charles Street Car so that was nice. Here are the issues we had with the hotel. The Ritz charges for internet service, $12.95 a day. This is ridiculous. We have not had to pay for internet service at a hotel or resort for quite a few yrs now. Even the Holiday Inn we stay at in upstate NY when we visit our son at camp has free internet. I had trouble getting online and after 20 minutes on the phone, the outsourced tech said he was having a new Ethernet cable sent to the room. It never arrived. I finally realized the line from the wall into the modem was never connected. We also asked for additional bath towels when we arrived at 6:00pm. When we got back to the room after dinner around 9:30, no towels. We called again and they were brought up. We ate in the hotel restaurant the first night. The space is beautiful and the food was good. The service not so much. It took 40 minutes to get 1 soup and an order of crab cakes, another 20 minutes for dinner. My daughters order was wrong. The dining room was not crowded. The breakfast service was much better and the food was very good. They have a buffet for $25 per person which makes no sense to me because they have awesome stuff on the menu for a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, some issues”
Reviews.Author: joelizard
Reviews.Content: The Ritz New Orleans was a nice looking hotel, and was a in good location. All the Mardi Gras action was at walking distance. Overall it was a good experience. The down side of it is that they charge you for everything including the internet, pastries, some room services, and the use of the bar in the room. They also promised us a roller bed, and when we got there they put us on a waiting list and we never got that bed. Also, security is over the top. Only people with wristbands can come in, and you might know that in Mardi Gras that's an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Years”
Reviews.Author: RichardSE3
Reviews.Content: Next to Burbon street and the Quarter. Great food, pampering and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Great Place-in the Club Rooms”
Reviews.Author: GB51
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Club rooms for a 2010 Mardi Gras weekend. The room was very nice with a good bed, hardwood floors, separate tub & shower, HD TV. The Club amenities were invaluable with a good breakfast including omelets, light food, water, wine all day and open bar in the evenings. The common areas were beautiful & relaxing and only crowded at the end of breakfast hours. The service was very good and very friendly. With 75 Club rooms it felt like a small hotel,m which is what we like. The Ritz Carlton with 450 rooms was much more crowded and less relaxing in the common areas. The big parades go right past the Ritz on Canal St. and the back entrance to the Club is on Iberville right in the Quarter and 1 block from Bourbon. We used to stay at the Sonesta in NO, but no more.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Ritz Carlton Club Level”
Reviews.Author: Seektravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton New Orleans for 4 nights over New Years Dec 2009 into Jan 2010. I am a Ritz Carlton return guest. I have been to Ritz Carlton Battery Park, Ritz Carlton Amelia Island, Ritz Carlton Philly, Ritz Carlton South Beach and the Ritz Carlton New Orleans â€“ I stay in Club level and highly recommend this area as a choice. Ritz Carlton New Orleans â€“ Club Level Maison Orleans is my FAVORITE so far! The Club Level rooms are in a special area called Maison Orleans. This part of the hotel gives a boutique hotel feel. They have a separate area to check in though we arrived very late and check in the main area. The club level area is just so cozy and beautiful with 3 parlor rooms, some with fire places nice comfy couches and table and chairs. Food is presented almost all day long, with a break between 11-12noon and 4-5pm and ends at 10pm. It was a great place to hang out after running around all day. After checking in and getting to our room we were pleasantly surprised because the rooms in this part of the hotel are not your typical Ritz Carlton rooms. There were beautiful dark hardwood floors, and a canopy type bed. (see my photo) The location was great, easy access to walk around the French Quarter. We visited the spa two times during our stay. There is a decent exercise room, indoor co-ed whirlpool and small pool and we enjoyed all our spa treatments. I can not vouch for the mens locker room, but the relaxing area in the ladies locker room had beds to rest on and was VERY relaxing before and after my professional quality massage. Every employee during our stay was friendly and professional and aimed to please. When I go back to New Orleans (which I am sure I will I just love it there) in my opinion this is the ONLY place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Godeh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in the middle of the French Quarter near to the Superdome, quality restaurants, shops, Harrahs and scenic sites. Valet parking and check in were smooth and quick. Parking: a challenge and there was no free parking. The room was well appointed with all the expected items including a safe. The bed was comfortable and we received a complimentary fruit platter and drinks on our arrival. We reported that one light bulb was blown to the front desk and then went to dinner. On our return, we found that it had been changed. No noise in the room but we were on a high floor. The room service was good as meals were sent up in 40 mins at 1am. Check out was also quick and without difficulty. Service: courteous, prompt yet unobtrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Henry86
Reviews.Content: I can't speak for the regular portion of the Hotel. We were upgraded to the Club Level which is essentially a separate hotel in the same structure. We have stayed in numerous top hotels around the world and this stay definitely ranks the the best we have experienced. Room was first class--hardwood floors, great bath, etc. Staff service and cheerfullness was best we have experienced from the moment we walked in to the moment we departed. The Club Level staff were incredible and the free Breakfasts, Lunch Snacks, Evening and Late Night food, wines, champagne, cocktails, etc were outstanding. Whatever we wanted, they would find a way to get it for you. The location is incredible, as well, in that it is across the street from the French Quarter and one block from the Royal Street Antique Shops. Definitely, the high point of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LouisvilleLinda
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Christmas. Just about everything was disappointing and not up to what one expects from a Ritz. I've had better luck at 3 star hotels (although perhaps the Ritz recognized it since we paid a 3-star price). The room was on the small side and the decor was drab and "tired" looking. The service in almost all departments was confused or careless. The hotel was clearly understaffed. Concierge service was truly amazing: After waiting 2 days (and after more than one reminder), Concierge No. 1 still had not gotten our Christmas Eve reservations, nor the sitting we requested for the Ritz's Christmas Brunch. Spotting a different concierge on duty, we tried our luck again. Within 5 minutes, Concierge No. 2 got our dinner reservations plus the seating we wanted for brunch. Clearly the previous poster who complained about concierge services got Concierge No. 1. The restaurant food was quite good overall, but service was haphazard and slow. The one dining disaster was the Christmas Brunch. We had the 12:00 seating. Unfortunately, the food appeared and tasted like it was left over from the 10:30 seating. Everything except the carving station tasted like it had been sitting in the chafing dishes for ages. At $75 a piece, plus INCLUDED 20% tip (for worthless service), we left feeling genuinely ripped off. I've been to many $75 or more brunches before, and this was by far the worst I've ever encountered. The last straw came at checkout. Our package included breakfasts and free internet services. The bill included charges for both, plus tax on valet parking which we hadn't even used. (Mind you, no charge for the valet parking, just the tax.) Each charge was accompanied by state tax, plus local tax, so by the time they straightened out the bill and each charge and tax item removed (which took an ridiculous length of time), the total was reduced by $300! The one shining spot was the spa. Received great treatment there and would definitely use the spa when next in New Orleans. Overall, was it a horrible experience? No. Would I ever go back to this hotel? No. Would I ever stay in another Ritz? Maybe, but their star is a bit less shiny now.

Reviews.Title: “Prefer the Monteleon”
Reviews.Author: SallyB1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at other Ritz and experienced the highest quality service. The Ritz in NOLA did not achieve the same.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: andersod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the location as good. However, the service needs improvement. Our first issue was with the mini bar. It took three requests over 24 hours to get it cleaned out (previous guests left items in there) and restocked, something extremely important as a diabetic. The worst problem was that when we checked out to leave, the valet had lost my car keys. After no action by the parking manager for over an hour, I went to the hotel manager. She was at least proactive in try to search for them, and did provide complimentary lunch and spa services while we waited, but the end result was that my car had to be towed to a dealership and rekeyed. This delayed our departure from New Orleans about 6 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbugtoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Club level for four wonderful nights! The furniture here is just beautiful. Wish I could have shipped it back home. The rooms are beautiful. Really stunning! The service is wonderful. I think this would have been one of our best hotel experiences. REALLY love the Ritz! As an added bonus, Mickey Rooney was staying here too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at a bargain price in a great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kernhills
Reviews.Content: The absolute best part about this hotel is the amazing location right at the end of Bourbon Street. The rooms were of average quality. There were some stains on the carpet and the bathroom and vanity were very small. The TV was also beautiful but there wasn't any place inside the room to plug an Ipod in to play. One of the best features of this hotel was the amazing gym. The equipment was top notch and there wasn't any additional charge on top of your normal stay. We booked four nights for $125 a night which is an unbelievable price for any hotel of this overall quality in the location that it is. We would definitely recommend staying here as long as your expectations don't exceed a slightly above average room in an amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: redmanfloridapvb
Reviews.Content: Staff was great ,check in easy, room service on time,concierge got reservation to cuvee restaurant, and 1 bedroom suite was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: BillO4
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton is in its own league. They always go above and beyond the call. I really enjoy going to all different Ritz Carltons.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, creepy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Iloveyoga123
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly and eager to please, but I was very uncomfortable walking around the hotel's neighborhood at night. While the Ritz is located on the edge of the French Quarter, it is literally the seedy side of town. It's location is unfortunate because it requires you to walk at least 10 to 15 minutes to get anywhere. We had numerous problems with housekeeping. Upon arrival, our room had a visible layer of dust covering most surfaces. The last night of our stay, the maid forgot to give us a top sheet. There was a rat trap located underneath our bed. As a long time devotee of Ritz Hotels, I would advise you to stay somewhere else in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “club level is well worth the extra expense”
Reviews.Author: jerseytravelfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a much needed week of relaxation. Reading previous reviews, I opted for club level accommodations and was not disappointed. The club level (indeed an entire separate wing of the hotel) is beautiful with larger rooms and great bathrooms. Yes the bathtubs are huge, but unfortunately I was unable to enjoy as the hot water was not quite hot enough for my liking. The shower was very good with plenty of hot water and good water pressure. I had a total of 3 spa treatments. The cafe au lait scrub and hot stone massage were both great. The vichy shower experience with the scrub was phenomenal! Unfortunately, the signature facial was just average. All treatments allow for access to the spa sauna and jacuzzi. The spa staff were fantastic offering mimosas/champagne quite often- a nice touch. I never felt rushed and one can literally stay for hours. Regarding the club lounge, the offerings were good (the gumbo was excellent) and the staff attentive without being intrusive. The wine/champagne was present from lunch onward. I felt very comfortable just sitting and reading while sipping a nice glass of cabernet. A quick word about room service- the bread pudding came with a pecan praline which was absolutely fantastic. The entree was good and the service prompt. I would definitely stay here again (club level), but note that the walk to Jackson square area in the heat/humidity is a bit of stretch from this location. If you want to be close to Bourbon street, than this location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: TNDiamond
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton on Canal Street is the place to stay when visiting New Orleans! From the time that I arrived to the end of the stay was great! When I arrived at the Ritz Carlton, the bailsmen immediately opened my door with a greeting; they tagged my luggage and stated that they would be up to my room shortly. I went to the check-in counter, it was a smooth process. As you walk any where in this prestigious hotel, everyone.. I mean everyone greets you! The atmosphere is so clean, beautiful, and extravagant! I felt like I was a queen in a palace the entire stay. When you call for anything, they always greet you by your name (the name that the reservation is under) and always glad to assist you. We always needed extra towels, etc.. and they were very prompt in bringing those things up very quickly. Also, we were offered "Turn Down" service every night. The package we booked for the Ritz was called "A Piece Of Mind" which included the All American Breakfast for $24. We had breakfast every morning; the hotel staff in the dining area made the trip that much more relaxing. We always tipped and was taken care of after each experience. I would like to give a special shout out to William and Le Salle, they made sure that our breakfast experience was one that we would always remember. When you entered in the dining area, they seated you by pulling out your chairs and placing a napkin in your lap. The food was always hot and delicious! We jad a minor / major problem -- one morning before we left we asked for our room to be cleaned, the housekeeper said ok. We left and returned many hours later to find our room was opened & unlocked. We immediately checked our laptops, aircards, camaras, money, etc.. We called down to the front desk to speak to a manager, we were transferred to her cell. We stated to the manager what happened and she apologized and promised us that this was a mistake and will not happen again. She also wanted to know what time tomorrow would we like our rooms to be cleaned, we stated to her a time. She didn't offer any type if compusation, so I stated to her that this is a prestigous luxury hotel that we are paying $200 per night and our room was left wide open, we need to be compusated besides "it want happen again." So I requested a credit to be used in the restaurant; she issued a $50 credit plus drinks on them. I felt like that if I hadn't persued that we need to be compusated, that they would have did nothing! That minor incident didn't make the stay worse, it was a little glitch! Also, I would recommend that if you drink alot of water, please go to the Wal-Greens or the store down the street to purchase some water and drinks. Of Course hotel food, items are more expensive than regular prices. The location is very accessible to Bourbon Street, the trolleys, only blocks away from other tourist attractions. Also, we booked a tour at the Riverwalk called "The Rebirth of New Orleans" this was the best $50 you can spend to see outside of the toursit areas, this tour will show you the areas that were most effected by Hurricane Katrina, you can see the water levels that stood for days on end, the signs/markings from the National Gaurds, the actual levey that broke, the cemetary, etc. So, this is a must go! Also, we went to Emerils New Orleans Restaurant, French Quarters, St. Charles area, etc. I would recommend anyone visiting New Orleans to stay at The Ritz Carlton on Canal Street.

Reviews.Title: “Mice in our room”
Reviews.Author: n0lagirl
Reviews.Content: Yep, you read that correctly. During our weekend stay at the Ritz, we were treated to some extra guests in our adjoining rooms. After returning to our rooms during the second night of our stay, we saw not one, but at least two mice. This is something that I would find unacceptable at any hotel, and I am still in shock that we experienced this problem at a place that bills itself as a luxury property. The hotel partially compensated us for our stay. While I appreciate the gesture, I will be staying elsewhere on my next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Below par for Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: RallyMonkey
Reviews.Content: Mixed review for his hotel I'm afraid. This is a busy hotel on the edge of the French Quarter. The rooms were decorated to Ritz Carlton standard, everything worked, and was to a high standard. We arrived at 6pm on Friday by car, valet parking and check in was very efficient, we were in our room within 20 mins. No problems with the room or room service. So the hotel ticks most boxes. Breakfast on Saturday morning was disappointment. Only half the dining room was in use, and we had to wait 30 mins for a table. Not acceptable in a hotel of this standard. A number of other guess were very annoyed by this, and with a few more staff it could easily be avoided. I would not stay here again for that reason, in other respects it was a reasonable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what everyone is complaining about”
Reviews.Author: cjford
Reviews.Content: I can't help but think that the people who posted the review right before this one stayed at a different property. I was just there last weekend and thought that everything was spectacular - from the room to the room service to the staff overall. We will definitely stay there again on future trips to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our vacation”
Reviews.Author: eekthetripsinaweek
Reviews.Content: Before writing this review, I was searching for vacation packages because I want to go on vacation -- again. I just came from one several days ago, and I'm still stressed. I was wondering why, when I realized, it's the Ritz, the EVIL staff at Ritz Carlton New Orleans and their cruddy rooms!!! Let me backtrack a bit. I booked a 3 night, extended weekend stay at the Ritz. We paid for a package, and paid extra to stay at the Ritz because I have stayed at many, many a Ritz Carlton and the quality I was expecting, so I thought, is pretty much the same at all properties. Wrong, oh so wrong! We were booked into a standard room. I really didn't care to see a view or anything out the window because the Ritz is located at Canal Street, and what am I really going to look at, street traffic? No thanks! If I was in Hawaii and staying at an oceanfront hotel, I would have opted for a completely category. Since this was New Orleans, I'm focusing my vacation time mostly on Bourbon, Royal and Magazine Streets. No time for looking at street traffic. Of course, the room category is where my living hell began. We arrived at the hotel at night since we came from San Francisco. Even with a direct flight, it's 5 hours minimum. The room we were given reeked of smoke. Couldn't deal with that so my husband phoned the front desk for another room. We were told that a king bed is not available because we checked-in so late. Also, the room about 4 doors down from the elevator and extra hangers I requested when booking the hotel were completely forgotten too. The lady said they only had 2 doubles left if we wanted non-smoking. After more dickering, they upgraded us to a room with 2 kings, semantics, grr!!! We thought everything was ok, until after we quickly unpacked and went out for dinner at 12 midnight (remember, we wasted 2 hours moving rooms already), it was time to sleep. Except I couldn't, all night long, because there was a weird noise coming from the ceiling. After wasting 1 sleepless night of my 3 night "relaxing" getaway, I called for maintenance to try and fix that noise. A couple of more hours wasted waiting for the guy, we were told that we'd have to move rooms because he'll pretty much have to rip open the ceiling before he could figure out what's wrong. I called the front desk again and was told that no rooms were available at the time, but wait 2 more hours and they'll see what they could do. We go out for lunch and came back to the front desk, where we were shown another room in the same floor as their spa. This one now had the sound of running water. "Constantly" running water. And then another room, the 1 king bed as usual, nowhere near the elevator. After all the he-- we've been through so far and the sleepless night, they have the chutzpah to dump us onto the same room. We promptly checked-out, because we have wasted 1-1/2 days of our very short vacation so far switching rooms thanks to the Ritz. While checking-out by the way, my husband overheard another person complaining at the front desk that there's a RAT in his room. Not a mouse, but a RAT!!! This is the Ritz? Well, the price certainly reflected it (like $36 a day for valet service). That's not so bad if they delivered though, but didn't. It certainly didn't feel like a 5* property, not even 3* by a long shot.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect romantic get-away”
Reviews.Author: trippermcgee
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I had a phenomenal weekend at the Ritz-Carlton. The management made an extra effort to celebrate our engagement by sending flowers and champagne to the room where we were staying, and the music by Jeremy Davenport and the evening entertainment (it was Mardi Gras time, and there were parades rolling by the front of the hotel!) made it a very memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4-Star, But Not Five. NOT What a Ritz-Carlton Should Be.”
Reviews.Author: EastHuron
Reviews.Content: Most people who stay at a Ritz Carlton property fall into one of two camps: Camp 1: There is NOTHING the hotel can do wrong. These people are so blown away by the name on the door and the lion logo on the bath mat that everything is just perfect, no matter what. Camp 2: There is NOTHING the hotel can do right. These people nitpick the tiniest details, demand utter perfection, pitch fits, complain, and won't settle for anything less than the warped idea of luxury that resides only in their own minds. We don't fall into either of those groups. Rather, we're totally reasonable people who travel three or four times a year, purely for enjoyment, and stay in 4, 4.5, and 5-star establishments. We have definite reasonable expectations, preferring not to complain, but willing to do so if something's really amiss. We stayed four nights, so we had plenty of time to evaluate. In summary, while this is a nice hotel, it is certainly NOT in the league of other 5-star places we've experienced in Chicago, Vegas, and Boston. Here's why: 1. STAINED LINENS BECAUSE OF A HOUSEKEEPING MISHAP. After checking in at 2:00 a.m. due to a late flight, we unpacked everything, took quick showers, and got ready to crash for the night. Upon pulling back the bedding, a nasty brownish stain was right there in the middle of the bed. And crumbs. And some colorful glitter. The bedding obviously hadn't been changed. Rather, the housekeeping staff mistakenly "freshened up" the room, as they typically do with turndown service. We called the front desk. The staff was apologetic and responded immediately, so we stood awkwardly (in our PJ's) in the bathroom for about 20 minutes as the bed linens were changed. It was an honest mistake, but not a good way to begin. Nothing was offered to us for our trouble. 2. TIRED DECOR. While nothing was obviously worn out or abused, the room decor just isn't on par with true 5-star establishments. A wrinkled dust ruffle. A pillowtop for the mattress that didn't quite fit. Outdated wallpaper. Uninteresting photos. Typical window treatments. Small rooms. 3. OLD BATHROOM. In terms of 5-star properties, the bathroom here doesn't cut it. Traditional bathtubs with straight shower rods (not even the easily installable curved ones) with fabric shower curtains and a $15 shower head provide a 1980's shower experience. A big pedestal sink and virtually no counter space looks OK, but provides no functionality. Towels that don't impress in the least. One (not two) marginal bathrobe. You get the point. In contrast, the bathrooms should be redone with glass shower stalls, higher-end fixtures, better towels, lots of counter space and beautifully lit mirrors. 4. THE LITTLE THINGS. One of our two room keys didn't work and had to wait at the desk twice to get it replaced. (They were having key problems, according to the staff member at the desk.) Trays from room service sat in the hallways a little too long. The door handles were worn. The housekeeping--while very good--was inconsistent. The windows were dirty. The lighting and the operation of room lights was outdated. Old phones and an outdated voicemail system. An unsolicited offer (via a voicemail message and flashing red light) to save 20% at the spa seemed a little tacky. The desk attendant--albeit 2:00 a.m.--wasn't particularly friendly or welcoming, particularly to two weary travelers who booked four nights at the R.C. In all, we would recommend the Ritz Carlton, particularly if an internet special comes around. And the location is great if you want to spend a lot of time in the French Quarter. If you go in expecting a 4-star experience, you'll get it. If you're expecting a 5-star one, you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “NIcve hotel, with a nice location”
Reviews.Author: BrentD
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Ritz in Cleveland( nasty) and the Ritz in Battery Park New York(wonderful) I chose this hotel due to it's reviews by others, and the other hotel choices were not really what I was looking for. Taxi ride from MSY to Ritz is a fixed $33.00($40.00 with tip). Upon entering the hotel, you are warmly greeted by the bell man, and doorman. Very friendly and what you expect from a Ritz . The first level is that of french, marble and an english feel. I know it sounds weird, but it was the genre in which I saw and felt. Nice, and not over done. You must then take an elevator(all were very fast throughout our stay) to the third level reception. There are 3 or 4 check in lines, and because of our early arrival, we were checked in very fast. Took the elevator up with the bell hop and were let into the room. Nice 42 inch plasma, very ornate bedding and furniture. Medium size room overlooking the courtyard. Heavy window treatments and sheers to keep the light out during nap time. The bath has upper end products, soaps, shoe shine and sewing kits. Towels are plentiful, and the marble shower and bath were nice. Hot water and pressure were nice. There is a nice big bar with entertainment each night we were there, along with the "library" is a nice private cigar bar opened to guests of the Ritz and members. Nice cigar menu. Price of cigars range from $25.00 for a Fuente to $120.00 for a Fuente Opus X. I feel wayyyyyyy over priced, as I brought my Opus X's from home, and only paid $30.00 a piece for mine at the cigar shop back home. The mark up on the Opus X is sinful. Wife and I enjoyed a bottle of champagne from a nice list, and our cigars. Everyone at this hotel very friendly, as too...the patrons.Wife got a massage and stated that the spa was very nice. Didnt really eat here, as ate at Bourbon Shop one night and GW Finns another. Went to Bombay Club for a drink and apps one evening, but seemed too old and velvety there, so we walked through Bourbon Street on the way home and sat at the Ritz bar and enjoyed a nice evening there. Took a taxi to Jackson square the next morning, about 8 blocks, and had to try Cafe de Monde(?) as everyone said you must try it. It was ok. Nice to people watch, but powered donuts and coffee and being pecked by birds high on sugar....not my cup of tea. Did enjoy a nice stroll through Jackson Park, the Canal Shopping area, and we walked back to the hotel from there. Tried Boubon street again that night, made it half way through, and even though it is what it is......it is not for me. Nice to say we did it, but we got to experience it, but too many drunks. reminded me of spring break for 40 year olds. Not knocking it...but just not my choice of having a good time with my wife. All in all, I must say the Ritz is in a nice close location to all, the people there are very nice, the people of New Orleans are super. Felt like everyone was truly sincere. Nice to say good morning to people...and get a good morning back.Cant say that about too many cities I travel to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a long weekend break in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: tangek
Reviews.Content: My husband and 20 month old son and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 4 nights in August 2009 to enjoy a break in New Orleans. We took the late flight from NY and arrived after midnight, and the hotel as able to check us in efficiently. However, we had requested a crib, and that was not in the room, and took 20 minutes to arrive after 2 calls. That was our only disappointment of the weekend. We opted for the cheap room with "no view" for $129 a night. What we received was a standard Ritz Carlton room, which was quite nice. The "no view" referred to a view of a courtyard, and the building on the other side of the courtyard was abandoned. If you like views, pay the extra money for a good view. If you are not bothered (like us), then keep the sheer curtain closed, and you'll have a full and comfortable Ritz Carlton room to enjoy. Our room had a large closet, king sized bed, and all standard accessories. The refrigerator was large enough to hold a few drinks for the baby, which helped us out. There was also plenty of space in the room, even after adding the crib. The room and the bathroom were both clean. The air conditioning was comfortable and we could adjust the temperature. We originally weren't sure about the location, but decided that it was quite convenient in the end. Jackson Square, the Aquarium, and Harrah's were an easy 10 minute walk. Also, the Charles Street Car could be boarded 2 blocks from the hotel to head over to the zoo and Garden District. Bourbon St was also 2 blocks away, but the noise did not travel to the hotel. We were able to find a good number of restaurants and breakfast cafes with walking distance. We did not try the hotel spa or restaurants. The lobby had a beautiful flower arrangement in the center, a coffee spot open in the mornings, and a beautiful courtyard with flowers that looked like a lovely place to sit, if only it weren't 90+ degrees with full humidity. We were a bit disappointed that the business center was expensive to use, as was the internet connection in the rooms, but I guess that's standard fare with the Ritz Carlton chain. Also, the concierge gave us incorrect closing times for some common attractions, which we found odd. The hotel helped arrange a car to transport us from the airport with a forward-facing child seat. We originally tried to save money by finding a car service ourselves, but failed. Not only was the car service that the hotel provided easy and efficient, but the driver gave us a lot of information on New Orleans, neighborhoods, restaurants, and seeing the impact of Katrina. We were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nearly Perfect, Spring for Club Level”
Reviews.Author: JoleneBrussels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights in a club level room (Maison Orleans) in late July. We love the Ritz hotels and have stayed in many all over the world and most always stay on the Club Level. The location of this hotel is very good, it's on Canal (on the edge of the Quarter) and an easy walk to most anything you'd want to do. It's a beautiful hotel (nice outdoor coutyard, cigar bar & lobby with live music at night) and the Club Level is very very good. We had a few issues though that are worth mentioning: (1) we had a few days when housekeeping was very late in making up our room or seemed to forget altogether until we reminded them; (2) the Club Level staff could be a little more sharp and on top of meeting the guests' needs (at times they seemed overwhelmed when asked to bring another bottle of champagne or make a drink)..however, with a few tweaks, this hotel could be flawless. We had an excellent concierge there named Christy...she recommended great restaurants and always seemed to be on top of things. Definately, definately stay there, though, it is nearly perfect. The spa is nice, but the treatments were just "okay".

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Top Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSince1980
Reviews.Content: After a bad stay at another hotel we switched to the Ritz Carlton New Orleans and loved it! We were traveling with our small dog and the Ritz Carlton chain is pet friendly with a $150 nonrefundable fee. We've never been to a Ritz Carlton before so we had no preconceived notion of what to expect. The hotel is all valet at about $36 per day. The hotel was easy to find. We loaded our bags on to a cart but a valet parked the car and a bellhop brought our bags to the room in a timely manner (about 10-15 minutes). Check-in was very fast and the lobby smells wonderful with these amazing candles. We bought 2 in the gift shop prior to our departure ($24 each). Everyone fussed over our little dog. When we got to our room, the housekeeping was already doing the turn-down service. The turn-down service consists of a mini bottled water with a glass, removal of the cover throw and accent pillows, turning down the bed sheets, and 2 chocolates. Our room was on the interior side which I liked based on previous reviews about road noise. We only had 1 wall that attached to another room so it was extremely quiet. Probably the most quiet hotel I've ever been to. We were in search of a good comforter and liked theirs so much that we purchased it! We visited the concierge multiple times throughout the trip and he was extremely helpful with finding excellent restaurants. One day when we had some time to kill, he sent us to the WWII museum. We ate at the Ritz restaurant one night. For an upscale restaurant, I'd give it 4 out of 5 stars. The location is great, 2 blocks to Bourbon Street and 1 mile to Cafe du Monde. My fiance visited the spa and received the Magnolia scrub and a facial ($150 each). It was a little too expensive for my taste but I was amazed by the large selection of choices. He loved the Magnolia scrub but didn't enjoy the facial. Not that it wasn't good, just not something he was in to. Overall, it's a great hotel and we're already planning on weekend trips to this hotel. My cons would be that there is no good place for your dog to releive his/herself. The closest grass is 2 blocks away and is the median in the middle of the street near a bus stop. It's not the best place at night and my dog could rarely make it the full 2 blocks. But let's face it, she's not the only one peeing on the sidewalks of New Orleans. This isn't a real con since it doesn't affect most people. My other con would be the elevators. You can't just go straight from the rooms to the ground level. You have to take one elevator to the lobby, walk through the lobby to the other side, and then take another elevator the rest of the way down. The good side is that it discourages people who don't have rooms at the hotel from going up to the room levels.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Establishment”
Reviews.Author: Squirrel43
Reviews.Content: The recently remodeled Ritz was very nice. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Probaby the best hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: echolake
Reviews.Content: What a place!! Big quite room, great bed, giant flat screen TV, big bathroom and all very nicely appointed. You will not be disappointed if you stay here. Bourbon Street is right there too - so a very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “oasis amid New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: OnTour77
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the New Orleans Ritz. The service was impeccable. The room (standard king) was super clean and spacious. My room was on the Bourbon street side of the building (11th floor) and although you could hear some noise from outside, it was minimal. The bed was super comfortable and the bathrooms are large (with Bulgari amenities). Coming back to this hotel was a great respite from the heat and clamor of the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Accomodating During Frustrating Time”
Reviews.Author: MikahDog
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ritz Carlton March 26-27th. On the evening of the 27th half of the French Quarter lost electricity due to a transformer fire (not the Ritz's fault or under their control). The Ritz was incredibly accomodating to this problem. The provided free sodas and water throughout the hotel; had backup generators running the elevators and hallway lights; provided as many flashlights and glowsticks as you needed; and of course did not charge you if you decided to spend the night when they didn't have electricity. I was incredibly impressed with their preparation for an "event" such as this.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: LioraRez
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful with large, elegant rooms and gorgeous bathrooms in white marble with yummy Bvlgari products. The gym was spacious with state of the art equipment. The hotel location is right in the middle of the city on Canal and the courtyard is very cute and cozy! Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: CammykissRN
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz for a week mid May 2009. I was in town for a nursing conference at the Convention center. It was a beautiful hotel and everyone was so helpful and friendly. From the door men to the reception desk and concierege, they were all great. I booked through Expedia and got a great rate, or else I couldn't afford it, and the reservation was not there when I arrived. The front desk staff were so accomadating. They just assigned me a great room on the top floor and there wasn't any problem. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and very clean. I ate room service 3-4 times and everything was delicious and gorgeous. There was a spa that I didn't try, but it looked great. The hotel smelled amazing all over, due to the Bulgari scented candles. The toiletries were Bulgari as well and they were wonderful. I can't say enoughabout how great this hotel was. I will definitly go there again when I am in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Far below our expectations”
Reviews.Author: BGSWWG
Reviews.Content: We understand New Orleans hotels are held to a lower standard than hotels in other cities, but if you are going to expose your brand by building a hotel, you should at least strive to meet minimum service standards. Unfortunately, the Ritz Carlton New Orleans did not do that. On our first day, we phoned the front desk to request an ipod player. Four hours later, we stopped by the front desk to repeat our request. Finally, seven hours after our first request, the ipod player arrived. On our second day, we realized we did not have a room service menu in our room. Fifty minutes and multiple calls later, we were told that there was a room service menu in our room (if we'd just look on the desk). Sorry folks, no menu! Our next call was to the manager, and he personally delivered the menu. Nice touch, but honestly too little too late. These might sound like small complaints, but they our anecdotal of larger service issue we experienced with the hotel (e.g. poor bar service, no turndown service). We will be selecting another hotel in Nola next time, striving for the closest approximation to luxury we can find. This is not a bad hotel, but it is no Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated rooms, elegant, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: smk88
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed there for 2 nights. The rooms were gorgeous, looked like they had recently been redone. Great service. The lobby was also beautiful but had a very strong, unpleasant scent (room freshener I guess)

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: usopenman
Reviews.Content: Over memorial day weekend, myself and my wife stayed at the Ritz Carlton Maison Orleans in New Orleans. Since I had stayed there in the past and thoroughly enjoyed it, I was very excited to stay there once again. However, from the day we checked in to the day we checked out, we were plagued with a number of incidents that left me wanting to never stay there or any other Ritz Carlton ever again. It all started when we first drove into the Ritz (the Ritz side not the Maison Orleans side) to valet our car and check in. From then on, these problems occurred: 1. The valet who registered my car was rude. Not in the sense of necessarily saying anything rude. However, his demeanor and attitude were somewhat uncomfortable to me. He seemed to be rushing me, and he was not very cordial. 2. When we arrived at the check in desk, there was nobody there to check us in. We sat on a couch and waited for about 15 minutes. That is ridiculous. It's one thing to wait in line, but it is completely different when there is no one to check you in. In my life time, that has never happened to me anywhere. There is no excuse for that; especially at a Ritz Carlton. 3. Around 7:15 on Saturday night, I went to the concierge desk to get a recommendation for a restaurant. Guess what, there was nobody there. There was a sign at the desk that said, "Sorry for the inconvenience. I am currently helping with a dinner party downstairs." When paying five star prices (and a little extra for being on the club level), one expects a concierge there at all times to help with any questions or needs. 4. Saturday night, we came back to the hotel and ordered room service. They said it would take thirty minutes or less. Guess what, it took about an hour and a half. By the time the porter got to our room, I was half asleep. And when he came in to the room, he did not present any of the food items and did not take the covers off of any of our items. He came in, dropped the food off, and left like he was in a hurry to go make a bet at the race track. 5. Sunday, we were getting ready for dinner. It was around 6:30, and the maid knocked on our door to do the turn down service. I told her to come back later. We went to dinner and came back around 10:30 later that night to find that housekeeping never came to our room. So our room was still dirty, and even worse we had no more towels. So the next morning, I used the same towel as I had used the night before. There is no excuse for that. 6. Monday morning, we ordered room service. It was literally the worst breakfast that myself and my wife I had ever had in our lives. The eggs benedict I ordered was cold. My wife pancakes were not only cold, but the consistency of the pancakes was that of cardboard. 7. When I checked out, the person checking us out was rude. He acted like he did not care about my stay. It was almost like he had no personality. He was like.....a robot. The only positive thing I have to say is that the manager of the hotel was very receptive in listening to our disputes. She told me she was very embarrassed about what happened. She explained to me that this is not the Ritz Carlton's motto, and she was going to do everything in her power to make things right. She seemed very sincere and apologetic, and I strongly believed that she was going to strive to make things better at the hotel. Unfortunately, the Ritz Carlton/ Maison Orleans gave me a bad taste in my mouth. However, because of the manager, I am going to give the hotel once more chance.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for a good deal, great location, quiet enough for rest”
Reviews.Author: queenbee19
Reviews.Content: I had gone to NOLA for the 1st week of Mardi Gras celebrations over Valentine's Day and President's Day weekend. Despite all of these events occurring, NOLA as a whole was fairly subdued and quiet. The economic recession and post-Katrina woes are still affecting NOLA. We received a standard king bed room with a corporate discount. Considering we paid about half of the rack rate, we were very pleased. We did not have a view at all and the room itself was rather dark. However, the room itself was spacious, clean and sparsely furnished. The bathroom was large, ample shelf space, and a separate enclosed toilet area (I love this). It took a day to get adjusted to the slimy/hard water of the Mississippi River. They provided ample toiletries and a blow dryer. They had a mini coffee pot for your usage. The TV was flat screen, about 27-30". The bed was very comfortable and plush. We had restful sleep and it was extremely quiet at night, despite parties being held throughout the night. There was a large desk, a large chair with ottoman, and a bench at the end of the bed, which I also really love. The closet was large and there are robes and a large umbrella. The housekeeper left chocolates on our pillow. The hotel itself is gorgeous. The outside atrium is really nice and a great place to meet your party or to wait for others. There are 2 sets of elevators you have to use: one to go up to the actual rooms (that requires you to put in your hotel card, so have it ready), and another to go down to Canal St. The doorman on Canal, an older gentleman, is very nice and friendly. The concierge was very helpful and accommodating. In addition, there is a small business center to the left of the front desk. They have the computer set-up so that you can quickly print out boarding passes, for free, before you leave. Very helpful. The location is also great. When we stepped out of Canal St, the parades were right outside. It is also close to the streetcar stop. It is several blocks from Bourbon and the craziness of NOLA, so it is close enough to enjoy but far enough to get some respite from the crowds and noise. Overall, I was pleased with my stay for the price I paid. I may have felt slightly different if I had paid the full price, as I would've had different expectations. However, if you can snag a good deal, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Just Another Hotel . . .”
Reviews.Author: Tax_Counsel
Reviews.Content: Considering Ritz-Carltonâ€™s reputation, my wife and I had high expectations for our stay in New Orleans. Unfortunately, this beautiful facility turned out to be â€œjust another hotel.â€� Check-in: Despite arriving around 6 PM, the front desk was poorly staffed; just one clerk was on duty. After waiting for three other guests to be servedâ€”none of whom were checking inâ€”it was our turn. Our check-in started smoothly, my credit card was swiped within 30 seconds of greeting the clerk. It was the next step that would prove problematic: room selection. The front desk clerk could not â€œfindâ€� a room for us. She spent several minutes paging through screen after screen of data on her computer and still could not â€œfindâ€� us that room. Next, she excused herself, disappearing for a few minutes into the office on my left and brought out Patrick to help her. Then, they both began to page through screen after screen of the hotelâ€™s computer system. Furiously pecking at their respective keyboards, they settled on Room 763 and sent us on our way, about one half-hour after we arrived. Now, there were four more guests waiting behind us. â€œScent of the Hotelâ€� and Room 763: According to the hotel staff, every Ritz-Carlton hotel has what they call the â€œscent of the hotel.â€� That smell is incorporated into the hotelâ€™s air fresheners and cleaning products. My wife and I are both allergic to the â€œscent of the hotelâ€� at Ritz-Carlton New Orleans, my wife more so than me. While we were only mildly affected in the lobby, it was our room that made us sick. Upon entering room 763 we both felt our throats tighten. We both took our allergy medications and left for dinner. The next day, when we woke up, my wifeâ€™s face was swollen, she was tearing up, and she had difficulty breathing. Around 11 AM we called the hotelâ€™s front office and asked about changing roomsâ€”it was then that we were told that the scent is used everywhere in the hotel, and that some of their regular guests call ahead to request â€œscent-freeâ€� rooms. At that time we were told that a room would be prepared for us. Returning to the business purpose of my stay I asked whether my wife could coordinate the move. Based on the instructions of the front office, my wife stayed in the room waiting for a telephone callâ€”one that never came. While out on business I called twice to check on the status of our replacement room, only to find out that no one from the hotel had even talked to my wife. Imagine my surprise when I returned at 3 PMâ€”nearly four hours laterâ€”to find my wife still in the room. Her symptoms had worsened considerably; her voice had turned hoarse and she was taking her inhaler. Shocked to see my wife in such a state I called the front office again. This time James told us that another room would be ready in two hours. Only after explaining that we had already been waiting four hours for this room change did he seem to express any concern for my wifeâ€™s ordeal. When Jeffrey, the bellman, arrived to move our belongings he commented about the strong odor in the room. We were moved to room 575 within a half hour. Room 575 was only marginally better. The next morning we learned that the housekeepers were not told to â€œde-featherâ€� the room. Placing our request directly with the housekeeper, our room was â€œde-featheredâ€� just in time for the last night of our stay. We slept much better that night. One element of this whole ordeal did surprise us: No one ever called during our stay to follow-up on our concerns. No one. In-Room Dining: When travelling on business I have grown accustomed to room service breakfasts. Eating breakfast in my room gives me another half-hour when I can dress, read the newspaper, and otherwise prepare for my day. Both of our in-room breakfasts were disappointing. Our first breakfast arrived 10 minutes late and was missing food from both of our plates. Although they brought up the missing items, other hotels will usually â€œcompâ€� a tardy breakfast, the Ritz-Carlton does not. On the next morning of our stay I noticed that the bill seemed too high, even for room service. Yes, I know about the delivery charge, mandatory percentage service charge and sales taxâ€”these add-ons can easily increase a room service bill by 35 percent. Yet, upon audit, the bill was still too high. When I called to inquire about the discrepancy the staff reported prices for our order in excess of those listed on our in-room menu. Their response â€œOh, you must have an old menu.â€� No offer of adjustment was made. Not every experience during our stay was bad. This hotel has very friendly bellmen, housekeepers and doormen. At times it seemed like they were the only ones who really cared about our stay and our well being. But for the problems described above, this review would have and should have been about themâ€”and the times they went out their way to help us. Two days after we returned home I asked my wife what she thought of our trip. Her response? â€œI expected more from the Ritz-Carlton, but it turned out to be just another hotel.â€�

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Relaxing With Southern Charm”
Reviews.Author: exquisitelady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton New Orleans for our anniversary on Easter sunday.The staff was so attentive and sweet as pie. Every employee there was friendly! We entered our room & found a card from the staff wishing us a Happy Anniversary along with strawberries, blackberries and blue berries with cream. We felt the Ritz treated us like family, they took very good care of all our needs. If you are looking for true Southern Hospitality then the Ritz Carlton New Orleans is your place to stay. Oh, and the food at the Melange Restaurant is awesome!! We can't wait to go back soon!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel Staff.”
Reviews.Author: lhathorn1
Reviews.Content: We went last weekend and stayed at the Ritz New Orleans. Every single employee there stops and says hello, how are you. They were the best staff I've ever experienced at a hotel, cheap or expensive. The only downside was that the lights went out to several blocks of the Quarter on the second night we were there. Nothing at all the hotel could do. They were as helpful as they could be and didn't charge us for the night the lights were out.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean but not what I expected from a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: grenille
Reviews.Content: I think my review mirrors many other comments here. The hotel was beautiful, service was quite good, room was comfortable -- but didn't feel like I was in the lap of luxury. I have stayed in rooms just as nice at JW Marriotts and Hiltons. I expect more from a Ritz. Hotel was mostly empty but we were assigned an interior room anyway. Could see some of downtown. Loved the big windows and huuuge TV. Bathroom was great. Loved the coffee machine. Also like having a regular fridge and not one of those things that adds $10 to your bill every time you take out a Coke. Negatives -- the scent they pipe in the common areas is overpowering. They knew there would be two of us in our room, yet we had only one bathrobe. That's the kind of small thing that Ritz is supposed to be known for. We did see a cockroach in our room (sigh). It is New Orleans and it is an old hotel, but still... No apology and we're not even sure anyone came to spray after we notified them. Had trouble getting our room made up more than once. Silly prices for some things -- $24 for eggs and bacon from room service? Come on, I know it's the Ritz, but that kind of thing sent us fleeing down the street. Was well worth the price we paid, but with a rack rate of $500, I think I'd stay somewhere else if I were paying full price. Not as luxurious as I had hoped.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FranklinsFresno
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 3/18-3/24/09. We had a one bedroom suite with 1 1/2 bathrooms. The hotel is walking distance to everything. We loved staying there. The staff made our visit very comfortable. We were there with a large group for the first 4 days and this hotel took care of everything. It was a first class operation. I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A classy service and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: mikeoc-8
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through a well known hotel booking site. We stayed mid-week and were lucky enough to be upgraded as it was our anniversary. The staff were very friendly and the room was stunning. The location, just outside the action is ideal as a staging ground to get the French quarter and beyond by foot. The only disappointment was the pool area which was not up to the standard of the rest of the hotel. Also a special thank you is due to Brittani at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we would expect of a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: alexanddeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a quick weekend at the Ritz. We chose this hotel because we use the Amex fine hotels and resorts progam, and the pricing was on par with the other nice hotels. This Ritz lives up to its name. The location is perfect for those who like the French Quarter, and don't mind walking down Bourbon Street, but don't want to be on its footsteps. The Ritz is on a part of Canal Street that if you turn right, you won't like the sights, but if you turn right, there are a few restaurants and eventually a mall a few blocks away. Bourbon Street is a couple block away, but the hotel is pleasantly removed from it noise (unlike the Sonesta). Out the back door, you're right in the French Quarter. We had an executive suite. It's wasted space for us, but a very nicely appointed room, as one would expect. We did eat breakfast, and enjoyed it (really pricey if you're paying, it was part of our room), and did have cocktails at the bar each night. Pricey again, but comfortably elegant. The lobby area is a lovely place to sit and people watch, as is the outdoor patio. The staff here are less formal that the average Ritz, appropriate for the location. One fine manager allowed us to stop him and ask some tourist guidance. We learned from him a tip I'll pass along. Stay at the Ritz, but go have a drink at the Westin, down the street. Their lobby bar has a fabulous view of the area. Also, take the trolley to the Garden District. It's a lovely area to see this way (lazily) and gives an idea of the many things that make New Orleans special.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, fancy, expensive, boring - but not bad”
Reviews.Author: bdwelle
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in New Orleans hosting a conference of 100+ people at the Ritz. We chose the hotel for business reasons, primarily the availability of the right sort of meeting-room space on the specific dates that we required. The Ritz in New Orleans is actually two older hotels that were refurbished and combined into one at some point. The layout shows this history - it's a bit confusing to get around the hotel. The lobby on the third floor so you take one elevator up from the street, and then a different set of elevators to the rooms. Getting from your hotel room to one of the conference rooms also requires two separate elevators, even if you're only going from the 5th floor to the 2nd. The decor is what you'd expect from a Ritz, I suppose, but it's not my style at all. Lots of frills and fluff, very dated. Clean and well cared for, but not my thing. There's a large typical hotel bar and an adjoining outdoor courtyard. Service in the bar wasn't great, and I wasn't unhappy paying $12 for poorly mixed cocktails, so I didn't spend much time there. The courtyard was often busy with guests, but whenever I stopped in it was uninhabitable due to wind swirling around between the four enclosing walls, and I didn't find it welcoming. As you'd expect, everything at the Ritz is pricey, starting with the rooms. The kicker was the spa fee they wanted to charge: $25 to use the steam room! Unbelievable. We didn't get the local intel until too late - apparently the gym across the street is only $10 and much nicer. Internet was also $12.95 per day -- how do they get away with that these days?!?!? Service was mixed. The guys at the door and the bell desk are top notch, but the reservations desk seemed to be staffed with trainees, and twice I returned to my room at the end of the day to find the cleaning staff still there making up the room. If I had been traveling for personal business, I wouldn't have ever ended up here, but I did, and as you can see I wasn't impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravisMizzou
Reviews.Content: The rooms were in tip top shape. The staff was awesome and went above and beyond of my expectations. Highly recommend the hotel with easy access to the French Quarter and wonderful restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: apalmbeachbum
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went with another couple. We had an absolutely delightful time! We are all seasoned travelers, and have enjoyed many fine hotels experiences worldwide. This hotel blends one part warmth of the south,one part fun atmosphere of New Orleans with two parts Ritz Carlton elegance and service, the result is a winning formula! We thoroughly enjoyed the club level food.... a good selection of healthy and gourmet nibbles & pastries baked on property. Service was excellent, great amenities, great location. Loved the spa & gym, and the selection of items to purchase there. Everything you would expect from a Ritz. It was a GREAT backdrop to a fun weekend!

Reviews.Title: “While not up to Ritz Carlton standards in some ways, still a great option”
Reviews.Author: thehotelconnoisseur
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the day after Christmas on our way to North Carolina for a family reunion. The main reason we went out of our way to go to New Orleans and stay here was to see the Houston Rockets play the New Orleans Hornets. Of course, the Rockets were staying here as expected. Having stayed at many 5 star hotels in my lifetime (including many Ritz Carltonâ€™s), the Ritz Carlton New Orleans is probably not up to Ritz Carlton standards in some ways but is a quality hotel nevertheless. CHECK IN: Check In is on the third floor which was a bit odd. However, the lobby area was beautiful. While it seems like there should be more areas to sit down, it is enhanced by a large outdoor courtyard, highlighted with a giant Christmas tree. It included a novelty ginger bread house for the kids which was nice but it did not interfere with the luxurious atmosphere. The Christmas decorations around the hotel were lovely. LOCATION: Located on Canal Street only two blocks away from Bourbon Street and in walking distance of all attractions, it appears to be the ideal location. While none of what I am about to say is the Ritz Carltonâ€™s fault it is important to note.
